translated: By us, on the other hand, the fault has been pointed out by showing, in the same way, the contradiction with the result in the case of the Pāśupata and other Smṛtis, the validity and the authoritativeness of which are inferred on the ground of their agreement with the result, etc.

analyzed: yadi nāma pañcarātra ādi smṛti prāmāṇya avadhāraṇam phala saṃvāda yuktyā āśāsyeta
translated: If the ascertainment of the validity of the Smṛti texts such as the Pañcarātra were to be sought by the method of agreement with the result,

analyzed: syāt idam tadā pratibandī grahaṇam
translated: then this counter-argument could be brought forward.

analyzed: na ca asmābhiḥ pañcarātra ādi prāmāṇya avadhāraṇasya tad yukti mūla tā upeyate
translated: But we do not accept that the ascertainment of the validity of the Pañcarātra, etc. has that [agreement with the result] as its basis.

original: na caivaṃ tatprāmāṇyāvadhāraṇaṃ nirmūlaṃ syāditi vācyam /
analyzed: na ca evam tad prāmāṇya avadhāraṇam nirmūlam syāt iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that in that case the ascertainment of their validity would be baseless.

analyzed: bodhaka tvena svatas siddha tvāt  aprāmāṇya śaṅkā nivṛttiḥ kutas iti ced āpti mūla tvena iti uktam
translated: Because [their validity] is established by itself through being the means of knowledge.🔽If it is asked how the removal of doubt regarding invalidity is [to be done], it has been said that it is by the authoritativeness having a basis.

analyzed: tad avadhāraṇam nirmūlam iti ced na
translated: If it is said that the ascertainment of that [authoritativeness] is baseless, it is not so.

analyzed: śruti saṃvāda nibandhana tvāt iti
translated: Because it has as its basis the agreement with the Veda.

original: nanu śrutereva vaktṛguṇahīnāyā na prāmāṇyamityato nirdoṣavākyetyuktam /
analyzed: nanu śruteḥ eva vaktṛ guṇa hīnāyāḥ na prāmāṇyam iti atas nirdoṣa vākyā iti uktam
translated: But it is not so that the Veda itself, which is devoid of the qualities of the speaker, is not valid. Therefore, it is said that [the Veda] is a faultless sentence.

original: bodhakatvenaiva hi prāmāṇyaṃ vyavasthāpitaṃ tacca vākyatvācchaterubhayasammatam /
analyzed: bodhaka tvena eva hi prāmāṇyam vyavasthāpitam tat ca vākya tvāt śateḥ ubhaya sammatam
translated: For validity is established only through being the means of knowledge, and that is accepted by both [parties] as belonging to the Veda by virtue of being a sentence.

analyzed: doṣaḥ tu tad apavādakaḥ
translated: But the fault is the exception to that.

original: na cāpauruṣeye sa sambhavatīti niṣkampameva śrutiprāmāṇyamiti vakṣyāma ityarthaḥ /🔽asyāṃ daśāyāṃ śrutivirodhenāpi pāśupatādismṛtīnāmaprāmāṇyaṃ śakyasādhanam /
analyzed: na ca apauruṣeye sa sambhavati iti niṣkampam eva śruti prāmāṇyam iti vakṣyāmaḥ iti arthaḥ  asyām daśāyām śruti virodhena api pāśupata ādi smṛtīnām aprāmāṇyam śakya sādhanam
translated: And we shall say that it is not possible in what is not of human origin, and therefore the authoritativeness of the Veda is unshaken. This is the meaning.🔽In this situation, the unauthoritativeness of the Pāśupata and other Smṛtis can be established even by contradiction with the Veda.

analyzed: yat api uktam itihāsa purāṇābhyām vedam samupabṛṃhayet
translated: And what has been said, that one should strengthen the Veda by means of Itihāsa and Purāṇa,

original: iti tattathā kintvaviruddhānāmevopāyatvaṃ na tu viruddhānām /
analyzed: iti tat tathā kintu aviruddhānām eva upāya tvam na tu viruddhānām
translated: that is so, but only of those that are not contradictory, not of those that are contradictory.

analyzed: na ca evam itaretara āśraya tvam
translated: And it is not so, that there is mutual dependence.

analyzed: śruti artha niścayasya smṛti saṃvāda eka nibandhana tva abhāvāt iti
translated: Because the ascertainment of the meaning of the Veda is not solely based on the agreement of the Smṛti.

original: nanu ca pañcarātrādismṛtīnāṃ prāmāṇyamaṅgīkurvāṇaiḥ sarvathā pravṛttisāmarthyamaṅgīkaraṇīyam /
analyzed: nanu ca pañcarātra ādi smṛtīnām prāmāṇyam aṅgīkurvāṇaiḥ sarvathā pravṛtti sāmarthyam aṅgīkaraṇīyam
translated: Now, those who accept the authoritativeness of the Smṛtis such as the Pañcarātra must accept the complete efficacy of action in every way.

analyzed: vyabhicārasya ca kartṛ karaṇa ādi vaiguṇya nibandhana tvam abhyupeyam
translated: And the deviation must be accepted as being due to defects in the agent, instrument, etc.

original: anyathā phalavyabhicāri ca pramāṇaṃ ceti vyāghātāpātāt /
analyzed: anyathā phala vyabhicāri ca pramāṇam ca iti vyāghāta āpātāt
translated: Otherwise, there would be the absurdity of a means of knowledge that deviates from its result.

analyzed: tathā ca phala saṃvādena api prāmāṇya ādi sādhanam suśakam evā iti kim ucyate
translated: And so, the proof of authoritativeness, etc., is very easy even by agreement with the result. What then is to be said?

original: naca tadyuktimūlateti suhṛdbhāvena pṛcchantaṃ pratyāha vedoktasyeti //
analyzed: na ca tad yukti mūla tā iti suhṛd bhāvena pṛcchantam pratyāha veda uktasya iti
translated: And that is not based on reasoning. So, out of friendship, he replies to one who asks, That which is stated in the Veda, etc.

analyzed: veda uktasya adhikārasya durnirūpa tvataḥ sadā
translated: That which is stated in the Veda is always difficult to determine,

original: niyamo vyabhicāro vā naiva jñātuṃ hi śakyate // / / //
analyzed: niyamaḥ vyabhicāraḥ vā nā eva jñātum hi śakyate
translated: whether there is a rule or an exception, it cannot be known at all.

original: vaidikagranthopadiṣyānuṣṭhāne vedoktā niṣekādisaṃskārā evādhikāratāmāpadyanta iti vedoktasyetyuktam /
analyzed: vaidika grantha upadiṣya anuṣṭhāne veda uktāḥ niṣeka ādi saṃskārāḥ eva adhikāra tām āpadyante iti veda uktasya iti uktam
translated: That which is stated in the Veda is said because in the performance of what is taught in the Vedic texts, the Vedic sacraments such as the sprinkling of water over the body of the newborn are what constitute the qualification.

analyzed: yat vā veda śabdena pañcarātra ādayaḥ pi gṛhyante
translated: Or, the word Veda also includes the Pañcarātra and other texts.

analyzed: adhikārasya iti upalakṣaṇam
translated: Of the qualification is a synecdoche.

analyzed: sādhana anuṣṭhānasya iti api draṣṭavyam
translated: Of the performance of the means should also be seen.

analyzed: durnirūpa tvam asmat ādi apratyakṣa tvam
translated: Difficult to determine means not perceptible to one like me.

original: sadeti svabhāvata eva na tu deśādivyavadhānenetyarthaḥ /
analyzed: sadā iti svabhāvataḥ eva na tu deśa ādi vyavadhānena iti arthaḥ
translated: Always means by nature, not by being obstructed by space, etc.

analyzed: niyamaḥ vyabhicāraḥ vā phalasya iti śeṣaḥ
translated: Whether there is a rule or an exception is to be supplied.

analyzed: hi śabdaḥ yasmāt iti arthe
translated: The word hi means because.

analyzed: tasmāt phala saṃvādena prāmāṇya ādi na anumīyate iti śeṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, the authoritativeness, etc. are not inferred by agreement with the result. This is the remainder.

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said.

analyzed: pramitam khalu liṅgam anumiteḥ karaṇam
translated: Indeed, a known mark is the means of inference.

analyzed: na sattā mātreṇa
translated: Not by mere existence.

analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt
translated: Because of overextension.

analyzed: atra ca evam prayoktavyam
translated: And here it should be employed in this way.

analyzed: pañcarātra ādikam pramāṇam
translated: The Pañcarātra etc. are valid means of knowledge.

analyzed: samartha pravṛtti janaka tvāt sampratipanna vat iti
translated: Because they generate effective action, like what is accepted.

analyzed: tasya ca ayam arthaḥ
translated: And this is the meaning of that.

analyzed: etad vihita sādhana anuṣṭhānavadbhiḥ tad phalasya niyamena prāpteḥ iti
translated: Because those who perform the means prescribed by this [Pañcarātra] necessarily attain its fruit.

analyzed: na ca etat liṅgam śakya avadhāraṇam  vyabhicārasya bahulam upalambhena niyamasya pratyetum aśakya tvāt
translated: And this reason cannot be ascertained.🔽Because of the frequent occurrence of deviation, the rule cannot be known.

analyzed: tad avadhāraṇe ca kākatālīya tāyāḥ śaṅkanāt
translated: And because of the suspicion of chance in ascertaining that.

analyzed: tatra etāvat vaktavyam
translated: In that case, this much should be said.

analyzed: kāryam kāraṇa sāmagrī sampādyam na tu tad eka deśena
translated: An effect is to be accomplished by the totality of causes, not by a part of it.

analyzed: tathātve ti prasakteḥ
translated: Because if it were so, there would be over-extension.

original: prakṛte cobhayakulaśuddhivaidikaniṣekādisaṃskārādyadhikārapūrvakaṃ viśuddhābhisandhyādimatā samyaganuṣṭhita karma asati pratibandhake /
analyzed: prakṛte ca ubhaya kula śuddhi vaidika niṣeka ādi saṃskāra ādi adhikāra pūrvakam viśuddha abhisandhyā ādimatā samyak anuṣṭhita karma asati pratibandhake
translated: And in the present case, when the ritual is performed well by one who has purity of both families, who has the Vedic sacraments beginning with the sprinkling [of the embryo], who has the right to [perform the ritual], who has pure intentions, and so on, in the absence of an obstruction,

analyzed: sati ca īśvara icchā ādau hi sahakāriṇi
translated: and when the cooperating factors such as the will of God are present,

analyzed: sampad ādi phala jananāya alam
translated: it is sufficient to generate the fruit such as prosperity.

original: tathā ca yatra phalaṃ nopalabdhaṃ tatrādhikārādivaiguṇyamitaratra tu tatsādguṇyamityato niyamaniścaya iti /
analyzed: tathā ca yatra phalam na upalabdham tatra adhikāra ādi vaiguṇyam itaratra tu tad sādguṇyam iti atas niyama niścayaḥ iti
translated: And so, where the result is not perceived, there is a deficiency in the qualification, etc., but in the other case there is its excellence. Thus, the ascertainment of the rule is this.

analyzed: na ca etat yuktam  para gatayoḥ adhikāra ādi bhāva abhāvayoḥ asmat ādibhiḥ avagantum aśakya tvāt
translated: And this is not proper.🔽Because the presence or absence of qualification, etc. in another person cannot be known by us.

analyzed: nahi khalu parakīya pitṛ pitāmaha ādīnām
translated: For indeed, the purity of mind, etc. of one's own father, grandfather, etc. cannot be known by later people.

analyzed: niṣeka ādi samīcīna tā vā
translated: Nor the correctness of impregnation, etc.

analyzed: mantrāṇām ayātayāma tva ādikam vā dravya ādīnām śuci tva ādikam vā
translated: Nor the freshness, etc. of the mantras, nor the purity, etc. of the substances, etc.

analyzed: arvācīnaiḥ avagantum śakyate
translated: can be known by later people.

original: tathācāsya phalaniyama eva vyabhicārastu vaiguṇyanimitta iti vāstu /
analyzed: tathā ca asya phala niyamaḥ eva vyabhicāraḥ tu vaiguṇya nimittaḥ iti vā astu
translated: And so, let it be that the rule of result is indeed the non-deviation, and the deviation is due to deficiency.

analyzed: vyabhicāraḥ eva asya
translated: But it is indeed deviation itself.

original: kvacitphalopalambhastu kākatālīyo 'nyanimitta eveti vā bhavatviti sandeho na nivartate /
analyzed: kvacid phala upalambhaḥ tu kākatālīyaḥ evā iti vā bhavatu iti sandehaḥ na nivartate
translated: And the perception of the result in some cases is indeed accidental, due to some other cause. Thus, the doubt does not cease.

analyzed: na ca sandigdhena prāmāṇya anumānam yujyate
translated: And the inference of validity is not proper with what is doubtful.

analyzed: prāmāṇya siddhay uttarakālam tu vyabhicārasya vaiguṇya nimitta tā kalpanāyām itaretarāśraya tvam syāt
translated: But if the assumption of the deviation being due to deficiency is after the establishment of validity, there would be mutual dependence.

original: vedasaṃvādena tu prāmāṇye 'vadhārite śakyate phalavyabhicārasyānyā gatiḥ kalpayitum /
analyzed: veda saṃvādena tu prāmāṇye vadhārite śakyate phala vyabhicārasya anyā gatiḥ kalpayitum
translated: But when the validity is ascertained by the agreement with the Veda, it is possible to imagine another way for the discrepancy in the result.

original: ato vedasaṃvādenaiva prāmāṇyaṃ pañcarātrādīnāmavadhāryate na pravṛttisāmarthyeneti / /
analyzed: atas veda saṃvādena eva prāmāṇyam pañcarātra ādīnām avadhāryate na pravṛtti sāmarthyena iti
translated: Therefore, the validity of the Pañcarātra and other texts is ascertained only by agreement with the Veda, not by the power of engagement.

analyzed: evam nyāya sāmya abhāvena pratibandī mocitā
translated: Thus, the opponent's argument is refuted by the absence of similarity in reasoning.

analyzed: yat api pratibandīm ādadānasya vivakṣitam
translated: And what is intended by one who takes up the opponent's argument,

original: yathā ca pañcarātrādiprāmāṇyamabhilaṣatā phalavyabhicārasyādhikārādivaikalyanibandhanatā kalpyā tathāhamapi pāśupatādismṛtiṣu kalpayiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: yathā ca pañcarātra ādi prāmāṇyam abhilaṣatā phala vyabhicārasya adhikāra ādi vaikalya nibandhana tā kalpyā tathā aham api pāśupata ādi smṛtiṣu kalpayiṣyāmi iti
translated: just as for one who desires the validity of the Pañcarātra etc., the discrepancy in the result is to be imagined as due to the deficiency in eligibility etc., in the same way I will imagine it in the Pāśupata and other Smṛtis.

analyzed: tat ayuktam vaiṣamyāt iti āha adhikāraḥ hi iti
translated: That is not proper, because of inequality. He says: The eligibility,

analyzed: adhikāraḥ hi sulabhaḥ kathitaḥ nyāgameṣu alam
translated: indeed, is easily declared in other scriptures.

analyzed: veda uktaḥ hi adhikāraḥ tu durlabhaḥ sarva mānuṣaiḥ
translated: But the eligibility mentioned in the Veda is difficult for all human beings.

analyzed: adhikāra grahaṇam sādhanasya api upalakṣaṇam
translated: The mention of eligibility is also an indication of the means.

analyzed: anya āgameṣu pāśupata ādiṣu kathitaḥ dhikāraḥ laṃ sulabhaḥ na āyāsa sādhyaḥ
translated: The eligibility declared in the Pāśupata and other scriptures is easily attainable, accomplished without effort.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

analyzed: yasmāt anya āgameṣu tathā kathitaḥ
translated: Because it is declared as such in other scriptures.

analyzed: tathā ca tad vaikalya kalpanam asambhāvanā pratihatam
translated: And thus the imagination of the absence of that is obstructed by impossibility.

analyzed: veda uktaḥ tu adhikāraḥ viśuddha santāna ja tva ādiḥ sarva mānuṣaiḥ durlabhaḥ iti prasiddham eva
translated: But it is well known that the qualification prescribed by the Veda, such as being born in a pure lineage, is difficult to obtain for all humans.

analyzed: atas tad vaikalya kalpanam sambhāvitam eva iti
translated: Therefore, the imagination of the absence of that is indeed possible.

original: nanu kathamanyāgameṣvadhikāraḥ sādhanaṃ ca sulabhamuktamityato leśena daśaryati anyāgameṣviti //
analyzed: nanu katham anya āgameṣu adhikāraḥ sādhanam ca sulabham uktam iti atas leśena daśaryati anya āgameṣu iti
translated: Now, how is there qualification in other scriptures and how is the means said to be easily obtained? Therefore, he shows a little bit, saying in other scriptures.

analyzed: anya āgameṣu vipra tvam api caṇḍāla janmanām
translated: In other scriptures, even those born as Chandalas

original: maṇḍalāntaḥpraveśena kramaśaḥ pratipādyate // / / //🔽yadbhāvāḥ tareṇa mahatā tapasā vinā vāna
analyzed: maṇḍala antar praveśena kramaśas pratipādyate  yadbhāvāḥ tareṇa mahatā tapasā vinā vāna
translated: are gradually taught to become Brahmins by entering the mandala.

analyzed: labhyam tat api iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that even that which is not attainable by mere birth or by great austerities,

analyzed: yati tva ādikam api iti vā
translated: or that even striving etc. is so.

analyzed: caṇḍāla janmanām api kimu kṣatriya ādīnām iti vā
translated: Or what to speak of Kshatriyas and others.

original: viprā eva ye kamarṇā caṇḍālāsteṣāṃ kathañcitpratyāpattirvaidikairapyaṅgīkriyata ityataścaṇḍālajanmanāmityuktam /🔽caṇḍāleṣu janma yeṣāmiti vā /
analyzed: viprāḥ eva ye caṇḍālāḥ teṣām kathañcid pratyāpattiḥ vaidikaiḥ api aṅgīkriyate iti atas caṇḍāla janmanām iti uktam  caṇḍāleṣu janma yeṣām iti vā
translated: Since even the Vedic followers accept that Brahmins can somehow be restored, therefore it is said even those born as Chandalas.🔽Or those who have birth among the Chandalas.

analyzed: caṇḍāla sambandhi tvāt caṇḍālam janma yeṣām iti vā tathā uktāḥ
translated: Or they are so called because they have birth related to the Chandalas.

analyzed: kramaśas maṇḍala antar praveśena iti anena idam ucyate
translated: This is what is said by the phrase entering the maṇḍala in due order.

original: yo yāvajjātivyavahitastasya tāvanti maṇḍalāni pūjyāni kalpyāni /
analyzed: yaḥ yāvat jāti vyavahitaḥ tasya tāvanti maṇḍalāni pūjyāni kalpyāni
translated: For one who is separated from [a higher caste] by a certain number of births, that many maṇḍalas should be worshipped and imagined.

analyzed: tatra yat yat maṇḍalam praviśati tad tad jātīyaḥ bhavati
translated: There, whatever maṇḍala one enters, one becomes of that caste.

original: caramamaṇḍalapraveśe tu vipraḥ sampadyata ityanyāgameṣu pratipādyata iti sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: carama maṇḍala praveśe tu vipraḥ sampadyate iti anya āgameṣu pratipādyate iti sambandhaḥ
translated: But it is taught in other scriptures that by entering the final maṇḍala, one becomes a Brahmin. This is the connection.

analyzed: tathā ca uktam
translated: And it is said thus:

analyzed: dīkṣā praveśa mātreṇa brāhmaṇaḥ bhavati kṣaṇāt
translated: By the mere initiation and entry, one becomes a Brahmin in an instant.

analyzed: kāpālam vratam āsthāya yatiḥ bhavati mānavaḥ
translated: By adopting the Kāpālika vow, a man becomes an ascetic.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: etat adhikāra saulabhyam udāharaṇam
translated: This ease of eligibility is an example.

analyzed: evam sādhana saulabhyam api draṣṭavyam
translated: The ease of means should be seen in the same way.

analyzed: yathā āhuḥ kāpālikāḥ
translated: As the Kāpālikas say:
One who knows the six seals and the truth, skilled in the supreme seal,

original: bhagāsanasthamātmānaṃ dhyātvā nirvāṇamṛcchati /🔽karṇikā rucakaṃ caiva kuṇḍalaṃ ca śikhāmaṇiḥ /
analyzed: bhaga āsana stham ātmānam dhyātvā nirvāṇam ṛcchati  karṇikā rucakam ca eva kuṇḍalam ca śikhāmaṇiḥ
translated: having meditated on oneself as seated in the vulva, attains nirvana.🔽The lotus, the earring, the earring, the crest jewel,

analyzed: bhasma yajñopavītam ca mudrā ṣaṭkam pracakṣate
translated: the ash, and the sacred thread - these are said to be the six seals.

original: ābhirmudritadehastu na bhūya iha jāyate kāyabhāk' / ityādi /
analyzed: ābhiḥ mudrita dehaḥ tu na bhūyas iha jāyate kāya bhāj ityādi
translated: One whose body is sealed with these is not born here again as one who possesses a body. and so on.

analyzed: tathā kālāmukhāḥ api
translated: Similarly, the Kālamukhas also.

original: rudrākṣakaṅkaṇaṃ haste jaṭā caikā ca mastake /🔽kapālaṃ bhasmanā snānaṃ lakuṭaṃ ca kalā
analyzed: rudrākṣa kaṅkaṇam haste jaṭā ca ekā ca mastake  kapālam bhasmanā snānam lakuṭam ca kalā
translated: A Rudrākṣ bracelet on the hand, a single matted lock on the head,

analyzed: kalaśa arcanam ityādi
translated: a skull, bathing with ashes, and a cudgel, and the worship of the water pot - this and so on.

original: nanu yathādhikārasādhanayoḥ saulabhyamuktamevaṃ taddaurlabhyamapi tatraivoktamiti cettarhi na kevalaṃ phalasaṃvādena pāśupatādīnāmaprāmāṇyam
analyzed: nanu yathā adhikāra sādhanayoḥ saulabhyam uktam evam tad daurlabhyam api tatra eva uktam iti ced tarhi na kevalam phala saṃvādena pāśupata ādīnām aprāmāṇyam
translated: If it is argued that just as the ease of access to the means according to one's capacity is stated, so the difficulty of access to that is also stated there itself, then the Pāśupatas and others are not only invalidated by the contradiction in the result,

analyzed: kinnāma paraspara visaṃvādena api iti āha adhikāram iti
translated: but also by the mutual contradiction. Therefore, he says the capacity and so on.

analyzed: adhikāram durāpādya muktavan ati sulabham punar
translated: Having said that the capacity is difficult to attain, he again says it is very easy.

analyzed: aśakyam sādhanam ca uktavā su śakam tad phala āptaye
translated: Having said that the means is impossible, he says it is very easy to attain its result.

analyzed: ucyate hi vyabhicāri phale tu
translated: Therefore, what is said is indeed erring even in the result.

analyzed: katham pramāṇa tām gacchet
translated: How can it be valid?

analyzed: yasmāt kvacid adhikāram durāpādyam uktvā punar api sulabham bravīti
translated: Because having said that the capacity is difficult to attain in some cases, he again says it is easy.

analyzed: yasmāt ca tad phala āptaye sampad ādi phala āptaye
translated: And because for the attainment of its result, for the attainment of the result of prosperity and so on,

analyzed: sādhanam aśakyam uktvā su śakam ca ucyate
translated: having said that the means is impossible, he says it is very easy.

original: yasmācca taduktaṃ sādhanaṃ phale 'pi viṣaye vyabhicāri atastaduktaṃ sā pāśupatādyuktiḥ kathaṃ pramāṇatāṃ gacchenna kathamapītyarthaḥ /
analyzed: yasmāt ca tat uktam sādhanam phale viṣaye vyabhicāri atas tat uktam sā pāśupata ādi uktiḥ katham pramāṇa tām gacchet na katham api iti arthaḥ
translated: And because the means of knowledge stated by them are found to fail even in regard to the result, therefore, how can the reasoning of the Pāśupatas and others be a means of valid knowledge? The meaning is: in no way at all.

analyzed: durlabha tva ukti anurodhena saulabhya vacanam prarocana artham vyākhyāyatām
translated: Let it be explained that the statement of ease is for the purpose of encouraging, in accordance with the statement of difficulty.

original: tathāca phalavisaṃvādo 'pyadhikārādivaiguṇyanimitto bhaviṣyati yathā pañcarātrādāviti cenna /
analyzed: tathā ca phala visaṃvādaḥ pi adhikāra ādi vaiguṇya nimittaḥ bhaviṣyati yathā pañcarātra ādau iti ced na
translated: And thus, the contradiction with the result will be due to defects such as lack of qualification, as in the case of the Pañcarātra and others. If it is argued thus, it is not so.

analyzed: vaiṣamyāt
translated: Because of inequality.

analyzed: yuktam hi pañcarātra ādiṣu tathā kalpanam
translated: It is proper to imagine it so in the Pañcarātra and other texts.

analyzed: śruti mūla tvena prāmāṇyasya niścita tayā kalpakasya vidyamāna tvāt
translated: Because the validity is ascertained by being based on the Veda, and the imagination exists.

analyzed: pāśupata ādau tu tad abhāvena visaṃvādasya aprāmāṇya nibandhana tā upapattau kalpaka abhāvāt
translated: But in the Pāśupata and other systems, the contradiction is logically the basis of invalidity, because it does not exist.

original: kvacitsaṃvādastu kākatālīyo vā guḍajihvikānimitto vā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kvacid saṃvādaḥ tu kākatālīyaḥ vā guḍajihvikā nimittaḥ vā bhaviṣyati
translated: The agreement in some cases may be accidental or due to the cause of the sweet tongue.

analyzed: tat idam uktam tuśabdena
translated: This is what is meant by the word but.

analyzed: tat uktam tu iti sambandhaḥ
translated: The connection is but that is stated.

original: tadevaṃ pāśupatādīnāmapasmṛtitvānna tadvirodhenoktārthāsambhavaḥ śaṅkanīya iti sthitam /
analyzed: tat evam pāśupata ādīnām apasmṛti tvāt na tad virodhena ukta artha asambhavaḥ śaṅkanīyaḥ iti sthitam
translated: Thus it is established that the Pāśupatas and others are false memories, so their contradiction cannot be suspected to make the stated meaning impossible.

analyzed: iti śrīmat nyāyasudhāyām smṛti adhikaraṇam
translated: Thus ends the chapter on Smṛti in the glorious Nyāyasudhā.

analyzed: na vilakṣaṇa tva adhikaraṇam
translated: II. The chapter on the non-difference of the means of knowledge.

analyzed: atha śrīmat nyāyasudhāyām na vilakṣaṇa tva adhikaraṇam
translated: Now, in the glorious Nyāyasudhā, the chapter on the non-difference of the means of knowledge.

original: oṃ na vilakṣaṇatvādasya tathātvaṃ ca śabdāt oṃ //🔽parihṛtaḥ smṛtivirodhaḥ /
analyzed: om na vilakṣaṇa tvāt asya tathātvam ca śabdāt om  parihṛtaḥ smṛti virodhaḥ
translated: Om. Not due to the difference of its nature, because of the statement of that nature.🔽The contradiction with Smṛti has been removed.

analyzed: samprati yukti virodhaḥ parihriyate
translated: Now the contradiction with reasoning is being removed.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: To that end,

analyzed: śruti ādi samanvayena khalu jagat janma ādi kāraṇatvam brahmaṇaḥ nirūpitam
translated: The cause of the creation etc. of the world has been described as Brahman by the agreement of the scriptures etc.

analyzed: tatra śruteḥ eva prāmāṇyam tāvat durlabham
translated: Among them, the validity of the scriptures themselves is difficult to establish.

analyzed: yat hi phala vyabhicāri tat apramāṇam dṛṣṭam
translated: For what is seen to be invalid is that which is contrary to the result.

analyzed: yathā vipralambhaka vākyam
translated: Like the statement of a deceiver.

analyzed: phala vyabhicāriṇī ca śrutiḥ
translated: And the scriptures are contrary to the result.

analyzed: putra kāmeṣyayā ādi anuṣṭhāne pi kadācid putra janma ādi anupalabdheḥ
translated: Because even when the desire for a son etc. is performed, a son's birth etc. is sometimes not perceived.

analyzed: anyathā phala anupalabdhyā uktam pāśupata ādi aprāmāṇyam api na syāt
translated: Otherwise, the invalidity of the Pāśupata etc. stated due to the non-perception of the result would also not be there.

analyzed: eka deśe ca aprāmāṇye tad nyāyena eka deśa antarasya api aprāmāṇya anumānam sulabham eva
translated: And if one part is unauthoritative, by that same reasoning, the inference of the unauthoritativeness of another part is quite easy.

analyzed: kiñca yat a buddhi pūrvakam tat apramāṇam yathā pipīlikā lipiḥ
translated: Moreover, whatever is not preceded by intelligence is unauthoritative, like the writing of ants.

analyzed: a buddhi pūrvakaḥ ca pauruṣeya tva aṅgīkārāt
translated: And the Veda is not preceded by intelligence, because of the acceptance that it is not of human origin.

analyzed: pauruṣeya tve ca mūlapramāṇa śūnya tvāt apramāṇam eva
translated: And if it is of human origin, it is itself unauthoritative because devoid of a fundamental authoritative basis,

analyzed: vipralambhaka vākya vat
translated: like the statement of a deceiver.

analyzed: api ca āpta apraṇīta vākya tvāt unmatta vākya vat aprāmāṇyam vedasya anumeyam  yadā vedasya īetā
translated: Moreover, the unauthoritativeness of the Veda is to be inferred from the fact that it is a statement not composed by a trustworthy person, like the statement of a madman.

original: dṛśī daśā tadā kā vātasmṛtītihāsapurāṇānāṃ phalavyabhicārādidoṣa
analyzed: dṛśī daśā tadā kā vāta smṛti itihāsa purāṇānām phala vyabhicāra ādi doṣa
translated: When the Veda is in such a state, then what to speak of the Smṛti, Itihāsa and Purāṇa, which are defective due to the discrepancy in their results,

analyzed: kharkharāṇām prāmāṇyasya
translated: and the authoritativeness of the harsh [Vedic sacrifices]?

original: tathāca vedādisamanvayena na jagajjanmādikāraṇatvaṃ brahmaṇaḥ siddhayatītyevaṃ prāpte tatpratividhānātharsya na vilakṣaṇatvāditi sūtrasya tātparyamāha
analyzed: tathā ca veda ādi samanvayena na jagat janma ādi kāraṇatvam brahmaṇaḥ siddhayati iti evam prāpte na vilakṣaṇa tvāt iti sūtrasya tātparyam āha
translated: And thus, the cause of the universe, etc. of Brahman is not established by the agreement of the Veda, etc. When this is the case, the purpose of the aphorism Not because of its being of a different nature is to refute that. The purport of the aphorism is stated

analyzed: nitya tvāt iti
translated: by Because of eternality, etc.

original: na vilakṣaṇatvād asya tathātvaṃ ca śabdāt / / / /
analyzed: na vilakṣaṇa tvāt asya tathātvam ca śabdāt
translated: Not because of its being of a different nature, because of its being so by the word.

analyzed: nitya tvāt puruṣa udbhavaiḥ
translated: Because of eternality, from the origin of the Puruṣa.

original: ujkhitaṃ sarvadoṣaiśca kathaṃ no mānatāṃ vrajet // / /d //
analyzed: ujkhitam sarva doṣaiḥ ca katham naḥ māna tām vrajet
translated: How can it not be considered authoritative, being free from all faults?

analyzed: veda vākyam iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder is the statement of the Veda.

analyzed: ayam arthaḥ  bodhaka tvena khalu karaṇānām prāmāṇyam doṣāt tu
translated: This is the meaning.

analyzed: kadācid apanīyate
translated: Indeed, the validity of the sense organs is due to their power to convey knowledge, but sometimes it is set aside due to faults.

analyzed: veda vākyam ca bodhaka tvena vādi prativādi sammatam
translated: And the statement of the Veda is accepted by both the proponent and the opponent as conveying knowledge.

analyzed: anyathā phala vyabhicāraḥ pi tatrasya na syāt
translated: Otherwise, even the deviation from the result would not occur there.

original: vākye ca prāmāṇyasyāpavādakā doṣā abodhakatvaviparītabodhakatvādayaḥsarve 'pi vaktṛdoṣanibandhanā eva /
analyzed: vākye ca prāmāṇyasya apavādakāḥ doṣāḥ abodhaka tva viparīta bodhaka tva ādayaḥ sarve vaktṛ doṣa nibandhanāḥ eva
translated: And in a statement, all the faults that invalidate the validity, such as the inability to convey knowledge and the conveyance of the opposite knowledge, are indeed based on the faults of the speaker.

analyzed: anvaya vyatirekābhyām tad avagamāt
translated: Because they are understood through positive and negative concomitance.

original: vedavākyaṃ ca nityatvādapauruṣeyatvātpuruṣadoṣanibandhanaiḥ sarvadoṣairvarjitaṃ svata eva prāmāṇyamāpnoti /
analyzed: veda vākyam ca nitya tvāt apauruṣeya tvāt puruṣa doṣa nibandhanaiḥ sarva doṣaiḥ varjitam svatas eva prāmāṇyam āpnoti
translated: And the statement of the Veda, being eternal and not dependent on a person, is free from all faults based on the faults of a person, and thus attains validity by itself.

original: prāmāṇye ca niścite sati phalavyabhicārasya sāmagrīvaikalyaṃ vā pratibandhakasadbhāvo vā kāraṇaṃ kalpayiṣyate /
analyzed: prāmāṇye ca niścite sati phala vyabhicārasya sāmagrī vaikalyam vā pratibandhaka sadbhāvaḥ vā kāraṇam kalpayiṣyate
translated: And when the validity is ascertained, the deviation from the result will be considered to have either an incomplete set of causes or the presence of an obstructing factor as the cause.

analyzed: anyathā siddha ananyathāsiddhayoḥ ananyathāsiddhasya balavat tvāt iti
translated: Otherwise, between what is established and what is not established, what is not established otherwise is stronger.

analyzed: atra ete prayogāḥ bhavanti
translated: Here are the arguments:

analyzed: vedaḥ pramāṇam bodhaka tve sati viparīta bodhaka tvāt sampratipanna vat
translated: The Veda is a means of valid knowledge, because it is a revealer and does not reveal contrary things, like what is commonly recognized.

analyzed: vimataḥ viparīta bodhakaḥ na bhavati anāpta apraṇīta vākya tvāt sampratipanna vākya vat
translated: The disputed [Veda] does not reveal contrary things, because it is a statement not composed by an untrustworthy person, like a commonly recognized statement.

original: vimato anāptapraṇīto na bhavati apauruṣeyatvādvayomavat /🔽vimataḥ phalavyabhicāro vaikalyādinibandhano bhavavitumarha
analyzed: vimataḥ an āpta praṇītaḥ na bhavati apauruṣeya tvāt vayoma vat  vimataḥ phala vyabhicāraḥ vaikalya ādi nibandhanaḥ
translated: The disputed [Veda] is not composed by an untrustworthy person, because it is not composed by a person, like the sky.🔽The disputed [Veda] should be capable of having a result that deviates due to incompleteness and other causes,

analyzed: ti pramāṇa siddha phala vyabhicāra tvāt caraka ādi ukta phala vyabhicāra vat iti
translated: because it has a result that deviates that is established by a means of valid knowledge, like the deviating result stated by Caraka and others.

analyzed: syāt etat
translated: This may be said:

analyzed: nitya tvam eva vedasya kutas
translated: How is the eternality of the Veda itself known?

analyzed: prāc ukta sāmānya siddhi pariśeṣābhyām iti brūmaḥ
translated: We say it is by the previously stated general establishment and by the remainder.

original: ye tu svayūthyā vedaprāmāṇyamaṅgīkṛtyāpi tannityatāṃ nānumanyante tānprati sūtrasūcitābhiḥ śrutibhistāmupapādayati virūpeti //
analyzed: ye tu sva yūthyāḥ veda prāmāṇyam aṅgīkṛtya api tad nitya tām na anumanyante tān prati sūtra sūcitābhiḥ śrutibhiḥ tām upapādayati virūpā iti
translated: But for those of our own school who, even while accepting the validity of the Veda, do not agree with its eternality, he establishes that eternality by the Vedic statements indicated in the aphorism, with the word virūpā.

analyzed: virūpa nityayā vācā
translated: With the eternal, variegated speech...

analyzed: anena tasmai nūnam abhidyave vācā virūpa nityayā
translated: By this, he cites the Vedic statement: To that Indra, indeed, variegated and eternal speech...

analyzed: vṛṣṇe codasva suṣyutim 🔽iti śrutim upādatte
translated: ...impel the good praise.

analyzed: atra vācaḥ nitya tvam ucyate
translated: Here, the eternality of speech is stated.

analyzed: na vedasya
translated: Not of the Veda.

original: tadapi bahukālīnatvaṃ bhaviṣyatītyatonityayānityayā staumi brahma tatparamaṃ padam' /🔽itiśrutirvāva nityānityā vāva smṛtayo yāścanyā vācaḥ' /
analyzed: tat api bahu kālīna tvam bhaviṣyati iti atas nityayā anityayā staumi brahma tat paramam padam  iti śrutiḥ vāva nitya anityāḥ vāva smṛtayaḥ yāḥ canyāḥ vācaḥ
translated: That too will be of long duration. Therefore, with the eternal and non-eternal, I praise that Brahman, the highest state.🔽The eternal and non-eternal indeed are the Smritis, and the other utterances.

analyzed: iti śrutim upādatte nityayā iti
translated: Thus, the Upanishad states the eternality of the Veda with the words 'with the eternal'.

analyzed: nityayā anityayā sadā
translated: With the eternal and non-eternal, always.

analyzed: ityādi śrutibhiḥ vedaḥ nityaḥ iti avagamyate
translated: Thus, it is understood that the Veda is eternal through such Vedic statements.

analyzed: vyākhyāna antara nirāsāya nityayā iti etat sadā vidyamānayā iti vyākhyātam
translated: To refute other interpretations, 'with the eternal' is explained as 'always existing'.

original: vākyaśeṣe hi bahukālīnā api smṛtīranityapakṣe nikṣipya śrutimeva nityāmāha /
analyzed: vākyaśeṣe hi bahu kālīnāḥ api smṛtīḥ anitya pakṣe nikṣipya śrutim eva nityām āha
translated: For in the remainder of the sentence, even the Smritis of long duration are placed in the non-eternal category, and the Upanishad declares the Veda alone to be eternal.

analyzed: pauruṣeya tām api śrutayaḥ bhidadhati iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the Upanishads also state the human authorship of the Veda, that is not so.

original: āptoktatvasya duravadhāraṇatāyāḥ prāguktatvena pauruṣeyatve prāmāṇyāvadhāraṇānupapattiprasaṅgena durbalatvāt /
analyzed: āpta ukta tvasya duravadhāraṇa tāyāḥ prāgukta tvena pauruṣeya tve prāmāṇya avadhāraṇa anupapatti prasaṅgena durbala tvāt
translated: Since the statement that the Veda is the work of a person is weak due to the possibility of the non-establishment of validity if it were human, because the statement that the Veda is the work of a person is not established due to the difficulty in ascertaining the statement of a trustworthy person, as stated earlier.

original: prāmāṇyasya svatastvenāpauruṣeyatve 'pi kāraṇābhāvātprāmāṇyaṃ na syāditi prasaṅgasyābhāsatvāt /
analyzed: prāmāṇyasya svatas tvena apauruṣeya tve pi kāraṇa abhāvāt prāmāṇyam na syāt iti prasaṅgasya ābhāsa tvāt
translated: And because the possibility that even if the Veda is not the work of a person due to the self-validity of validity, there would be no validity due to the absence of a cause is false.

original: prabalaśrutyanusāreṇa tattatpuruṣapravartitatvameva tāsāmartho 'vagantavyaḥ /🔽tathācaṛcaḥ sāmāni jajñire'ṛgveda evāgnerajayata' /
analyzed: prabala śruti anusāreṇa tat tatpuruṣa pravartita tvam eva tāsām arthaḥ vagantavyaḥ  tathā ca ṛcaḥ sāmāni jajñire ṛgvedaḥ eva agneḥ ajayata
translated: The meaning of those (Mantras and Arthavadas) should be understood to be that they are set in motion by different persons, in accordance with the powerful Vedic tradition.

analyzed: ityādi upapannam bhavati
translated: And thus the statements The Samans were born from the Rich verses, Only the Rig Veda conquered Agni, etc. become appropriate.

analyzed: na hi ekam vākyam aneka kartṛkam api sambhavati
translated: For a single sentence cannot be produced by many authors.

analyzed: sambhavati tu aneka pravartitam iti  yat api pipīlikā lipi vat abuddhi pūrvaka tvāt aprāmāṇyam śruteḥ iti  tat nirākaroti pipīlikā iti
translated: But it is possible that it is set in motion by many.🔽As for the argument that the Veda is not a means of valid knowledge because it is produced without intelligence, like the writing of an ant,

analyzed: pipīlikā lipiḥ ca api pramāṇam avirodhataḥ
translated: he refutes that with The writing of an ant is also a means of valid knowledge, because it is not contradicted.

analyzed: caḥ yasmāt iti arthe
translated: The word ca (also) has the sense of yasmāt (because).

analyzed: bodhaka tva samuccaye vā
translated: Or it has the sense of samuccaye (coordination) of the quality of being an indicator.

analyzed: tasmāt dṛṣṭāntasya sādhya vikala tvāt asat anumānam iti śeṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, because the example lacks the probandum, it is an invalid inference. This is the remainder.

analyzed: na kevalam śrutiḥ kintu pipīlikā lipiḥ api iti apeḥ arthaḥ
translated: The meaning of api (also) is not only the Veda, but also the writing of an ant.

original: aprāmāṇyaṃ khalu pipīlikāliperabodhakatvena vā syādviparītabodhakatvena vā /
analyzed: aprāmāṇyam khalu pipīlikā lipeḥ abodhaka tvena vā syāt viparīta bodhaka tvena vā
translated: Indeed, the invalidity of the writing of an ant may be due to its not being an indicator, or due to its indicating the opposite.

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: The first is not so.

analyzed: anubhava viruddha tvāt
translated: Because it is contradicted by experience.

analyzed: anyathā puruṣa lipeḥ api abodhaka tvam syāt
translated: Otherwise, even human writing would not be an indicator.

analyzed: tathā ca tad vaiyarthyam āpadyeta
translated: And thus it would be useless.

analyzed: api ca evam sati ākāśa ādikam evā udāhriyeta tat kim pipīlikā lipi gaveṣaṇayā
translated: And if this is so, then let us cite only space, etc., what is the use of searching for the writing of ants?

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: Not the second.

analyzed: tat hi balavat pramāṇa virodhataḥ kalpanīyam anyathā atiprasaṅgāt
translated: For that can be assumed only when there is contradiction with a strong means of knowledge, otherwise there would be overextension.

analyzed: na ca pipīlikā lipi bodhite rthe pramāṇa virodhaḥ sti
translated: And there is no contradiction with a means of knowledge in the meaning indicated by the writing of ants.

analyzed: atas katham asau apramāṇam syāt
translated: So how could that be a non-means of knowledge?

analyzed: syāt etat
translated: This may be said:

analyzed: lipiḥ tāvat na pramāṇam pṛthak
translated: Writing is certainly not a separate means of knowledge.

analyzed: anupramāṇa tritva abhyupagamāt
translated: Because three means of knowledge are accepted.

analyzed: na ca pratyakṣa āgamayoḥ antarbhavati
translated: And it does not fall within perception or scripture.

analyzed: a tad lakṣaṇa tvāt
translated: Because it does not have their characteristics.

analyzed: atas numānam eva iti vācyam
translated: Therefore it must be said to be inference.

original: tacca lekhakabuddhisthaśabdaviṣayaṃ vā tadavabuddhārthaviṣayaṃ vā syāt /
analyzed: tat ca lekhaka buddhi stha śabda viṣayam vā tad avabuddha artha viṣayam vā syāt
translated: And that would have as its object the words present in the writer's mind, or it would have as its object the meaning understood by him.

analyzed: na ca etat pipīlikā lipau sambhavati
translated: And this is not possible in the writing of ants.

analyzed: pramāṇa bādhita tvāt tat katham asau pramāṇam iti
translated: Since it is contradicted by a means of knowledge, how can that be a means of knowledge?

analyzed: mā evam
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: tathā satyā iḍamūka lipeḥ api aprāmāṇya prasaṅgāt
translated: Because if that were so, there would be the undesirable consequence that even the writing of the Mīmāṃsā school would not be a means of knowledge.

analyzed: bhavatu sā apramāṇam itarā tu anumānam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that let that be a means of knowledge, but the other is inference, no.

analyzed: eḍamūka lipeḥ api sāṃvyāvahārika tva darśanāt
translated: Because even the writing of an illiterate person is seen to be used in the world.

original: kiñcetaratrāpyanumāne kimeḍamūkavyāvṛttyarthaṃ kimapi viśeṣaṇamupādeyamuta neti vācyam /
analyzed: kiñca itaratra api anumāne kim eḍa mūka vyāvṛtti artham kim api viśeṣaṇam upādeyam uta na iti vācyam
translated: Moreover, in other inferences also, it should be stated whether some qualification should be used to exclude the writing of an illiterate person or not.

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: The first is not so.

analyzed: sandigdha asiddhi prasaṅgāt
translated: Because of the contingence of doubtful non-establishment.

analyzed: nirṇīta lekhakā eva lipiḥ anumānam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that only the writing of a determined writer is an inference, that is not so.

analyzed: a nirṇīta lekhakāyāḥ api sāṃvyāvahārika tvāt
translated: Because even the writing of an undetermined writer is used in the world.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: The second is not so.

original: eḍamūkalipāvanaikāntyāt /🔽atha mūlalekhakabuddhisthaśabdārthānumāne na ko 'pi doṣa iti matam /
analyzed: eḍa mūka lipau an aikāntyāt  atha mūlalekhaka buddhi stha śabda artha anumāne na kaḥ pi doṣaḥ iti matam
translated: Because of the contingence of non-exclusiveness with the writing of an illiterate person.

analyzed: tat api na
translated: If it is the opinion that there is no fault at all in inferring the word-meaning that exists in the mind of the original writer, that is also not so.

analyzed: pipīlika alipa avana aikāntyāt
translated: Because of the contingence of non-exclusiveness with the writing of an ant.

analyzed: tad vayāvartane ca sandigdha asiddheḥ
translated: And in excluding that, because of doubtful non-establishment.

original: nahi pipīlikālipeḥ puruṣaliperasti kaścidviśeṣo yena neyaṃ pipīlikālipiriti niścinuyāt /
analyzed: nahi pipīlikā lipeḥ puruṣa lipeḥ asti kaścid viśeṣaḥ yena na iyam pipīlikā lipiḥ iti niścinuyāt
translated: For there is no difference at all between the writing of an ant and the writing of a person, by which one could ascertain that this is not the writing of an ant.

analyzed: tasmāt puruṣa lipiḥ api padam iva padārthasya varṇānām smaraṇa hetuḥ eṣī avyā
translated: Therefore, just as a word is accepted as the cause of the recollection of the meanings of words, so too the writing of a person should be accepted as the cause of the recollection of the letters that are the meanings of words.

analyzed: tat samam pipīlika alipau api
translated: That is the same as the writing of an ant.

analyzed: smṛteḥ ca pramita tvam vakṣyāmaḥ
translated: And we will explain that memory is a form of valid cognition.

analyzed: nanu pramā tve pi smṛteḥ na tad hetu mātrasya prāmāṇyam
translated: But even in the case of valid cognition, memory is not the means of valid knowledge of the mere cause of that [memory].

analyzed: pramātṛ ādīnām api tad prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would follow that the cognizer and others are also that [means of valid knowledge].

analyzed: kintu sādhakatamasya eva
translated: But only of the most effective [cause].

analyzed: tat ca manaḥ eva iti siddhāntaḥ
translated: And that is the mind alone - this is the established conclusion.

original: lipidarśanādikaṃ tu saṃskāro dvedhābhidhasahakārisampādanenaiva caritārthamiti kathaṃ tasya prāmāṇyam /
analyzed: lipi darśana ādikam tu saṃskāraḥ dvedhā abhidha sahakāri sampādanena eva caritārtham iti katham tasya prāmāṇyam
translated: But the seeing of writing and so on is a mere impression, and it is fulfilled only by providing assistance to the expression. How then can it be a means of valid knowledge?

analyzed: mā evam
translated: No, that is not so.

analyzed: artha sannikarṣa lakṣaṇa avāntara vyāpāra sahitam hi indriyam pratyakṣam na indriya mātram
translated: For the sense organ along with the intermediate operation characterized by contact with the object is perception, not the sense organ alone.

analyzed: manasaḥ ca smaraṇa udaye saṃskāra udbodhaḥ eva artha sannikarṣaḥ
translated: And for the mind, the arousal of the impression in the arising of recollection is itself the contact with the object.

original: tathāca cakṣuṣa ivārthopasarpaṇatatsaṃyogasahitasya prāmāṇyamevaṃ lipidarśanatadudbuddhasaṃskārasahitasyaiva manasa iti kathaṃ na lipeḥ prāmāṇyam
analyzed: tathā ca cakṣuṣaḥ iva artha upasarpaṇa tad saṃyoga sahitasya prāmāṇyam evam lipi darśana tad udbuddha saṃskāra sahitasya eva manasaḥ iti katham na lipeḥ prāmāṇyam
translated: And just as the sense organ along with the approach of the object and its conjunction has validity, like the eye, in the same way, the mind along with the seeing of writing and the impression aroused by it has validity. How then can writing not be a means of valid knowledge?

analyzed: kevalāyāḥ tu na asti iti ced
translated: If it is said that it is not [a means of valid knowledge] when alone,

analyzed: śruteḥ api tat na aṅgīkriyate eva iti
translated: then that is not accepted even in the case of hearing.

original: nanvatra pramāṇaśabdo bhāvasādhano vā syātkāraṇasādhano vā /
analyzed: nanu atra pramāṇa śabdaḥ bhāva sādhanaḥ vā syāt kāraṇa sādhanaḥ vā
translated: Now, here the word 'means of valid knowledge' may be a word denoting an entity or a word denoting a cause.

original: ādye pipīlikālipiḥ pramāṇamiti sāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ na syāt /
analyzed: ādye pipīlikā lipiḥ pramāṇam iti sāmānādhikaraṇyam na syāt
translated: In the first case, the writing of ants would be the means of knowledge, so the co-reference would not be possible.

analyzed: dvitīye tu pramāṇī iti bhavitavyam
translated: But in the second case, it should be the means of knowledge.

analyzed: katham vedāḥ pramāṇam smṛtiḥ pramāṇam iti
translated: How are the Vedas the means of knowledge, how is Smṛti the means of knowledge?

analyzed: pramāṇam iti sāmānyena uddiśya veda ādi tva vidhānāt
translated: Having designated in general by the word means of knowledge, the Vedas etc. are enjoined.

analyzed: anyathā tatra api daurghaṭyam eva iti
translated: Otherwise, there would be the same difficulty there also.

analyzed: mā evam
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: bhāva sādhana tva abhyupagamāt
translated: Because the means of being is accepted.

analyzed: sāmānādhikaraṇyam tu bhāktam iti
translated: But the co-reference is figurative.

original: nanu ca śruteḥ samyaganubhavasādhanatvena prāmāṇyamiṣyaṃ natu smārakatvena /
analyzed: nanu ca śruteḥ samyak anubhava sādhana tvena prāmāṇyam iṣyam na tu smāraka tvena
translated: But the Vedas are accepted as a means of valid knowledge by being a means of right cognition, not by being a reminder.

original: tathāca na śrutiḥ samyaganubhavasādhanabuddhipūrvakatvātpipīlikālipivadityanumāsyata ityata āha yatheti //
analyzed: tathā ca na śrutiḥ samyak anubhava sādhana buddhi pūrvaka tvāt pipīlikā lipi vat iti anumāsyate iti atas āha yathā iti
translated: And thus it will be inferred that the Vedas are not a means of right cognition because they are preceded by the cognition of a person, like the writing of ants. To this he says: As...

analyzed: yathā drauṇeḥ ulūkena kṛtam api āsa bodhakam
translated: As what was done by Drona's son with an owl was also an enlightener.

analyzed: a viruddham
translated: Non-contradictory...

original: yathābuddhipūrvakamapyekenolūkena kṛtamanekakākanāśanamaśvatthāmno 'hameka evānekānvadhiṣyāmītyasyārthasya bodhakaṃ samyaganubhavaṃ prati sādhanaṃ
analyzed: yathā buddhi pūrvakam api ekena ulūkena kṛtam aneka kākanāśanam aśvatthāmnaḥ ham ekaḥ eva anekān vadhiṣyāmi iti asya arthasya bodhakam samyak anubhavam prati sādhanam
translated: As what was done by a single owl, though preceded by the cognition of a single person, was the destroyer of many crows, it became a means of right cognition for Ashvatthama, who said I alone will kill many, and it was an enlightener of the meaning of his statement.

analyzed: jātam
translated: It became a means of right cognition.

analyzed: tathā śrutiḥ abuddhi pūrvā api samyak anubhava sādhanam
translated: Similarly, even though the Veda is not produced by an intelligent being, it is a means of right knowledge.

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati  a buddhi pūrvaka tvam kim anādi tvam vivakṣitam
translated: This is what is said.🔽Is it intended that the non-production by an intelligent being means beginninglessness?

original: sāditve 'pi buddhijanyatvābhāvo vā pratipādyātharbuddhipūrvakatvābhāvo vānenaitadevaṃ pratipādayiṣyāmītyabhisandhipūrvakatāvaidhuryaṃ vā /
analyzed: sa ādi tve pi buddhi janya tva abhāvaḥ vā pratipādya athar buddhi pūrvakatva abhāvaḥ vā anena etat evam pratipādayiṣyāmi iti abhisandhi pūrvakatā vaidhuryam vā
translated: Or is it being taught that even if it has a beginning, it is not produced by an intelligent being, or that it is devoid of the intention I will teach this in this way?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first.

analyzed: pipīlika alipa avabhāvāt
translated: Because the writing of ants is not possible.

analyzed: gaganam eva dṛṣṭāntaḥ bhaviṣyati iti ced
translated: If it is argued that the sky itself will be the example,

analyzed: tathā api śruteḥ anādi tvasya pareṇa anaṅgīkṛta tvena asiddheḥ
translated: even so, since the other party does not accept the beginninglessness of the Veda, it is not established.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: Not the second.

analyzed: utpadyamānam buddhi janyam eva iti mayā aṅgīkṛta tvāt
translated: Because I accept that what is being produced is only produced by an intelligent being.

analyzed: na tṛtīya caturthau
translated: Not the third or fourth.

original: ulūkakṛtavyāpāre vyabhicārāditi /🔽yadyapi pratyakṣe vyabhicāro 'tra vaktuṃ śakyate /
analyzed: ulūka kṛta vyāpāre vyabhicārāt iti  yadi api pratyakṣe vyabhicāraḥ tra vaktum śakyate
translated: Because there is deviation in the case of an owl's activity.🔽Even though deviation can be stated here in the case of perception,

analyzed: tathā api jñāta kāraṇa sajatīya tvena śakya parihāraḥ sau iti nā uditaḥ
translated: nevertheless, that can be avoided by knowing the similarity of the cause, so it is not mentioned.

original: anumānamātre suvaco 'pi cetanavyāpāraviṣayasya tathābhūta eva śākune pradarśayitumucita iti na pradarśitaḥ /
analyzed: anumāna mātre suvacaḥ pi cetana vyāpāra viṣayasya tathābhūtaḥ eva śākune pradarśayitum ucitaḥ iti na pradarśitaḥ
translated: And although it is easy to state in mere inference, it is proper to show that which has such a nature only in the case of an omen, so it is not shown.

analyzed: nanu śākunam artha visaṃvādi api dṛśyate
translated: But is it not seen that an omen is sometimes contradicted in meaning?

analyzed: satyam
translated: True.

original: yattu pramāṇāviruddhaṃ tadvayabhicārasthalaṃ bhaviṣyatīti bhāvenoktam aviruddhamiti //
analyzed: yat tu pramāṇa aviruddham tat vayabhicāra sthalam bhaviṣyati iti bhāvena uktam aviruddham iti
translated: But that which is not contradicted by a means of valid knowledge will be a place of non-deviation. With this in mind, it is said to be non-contradictory.

analyzed: śākuna mātre vyabhicārasya darśayitum śakya tve pi āgamika tvena visaṃvāda anarha tayā idam udāhṛtam
translated: Although it is possible to show non-deviation in mere omens, this is cited because it is worthy of not being contradicted due to being scriptural.

analyzed: nanu āsa iti katham
translated: But how is it said to be asat?

analyzed: asteḥ bhūḥ iti asya nitya tvāt
translated: Because asat is eternal.

original: vibhaktipratirūpakaṃ cāvyayaṃ bhavatīti vacanādavyayametaditi na doṣaḥ /
analyzed: vibhakti pratirūpakam ca avyayam bhavati iti vacanāt avyayam etat iti na doṣaḥ
translated: And because of the statement that an indeclinable is a substitute for a case ending, this is an indeclinable, so there is no fault.

analyzed: vibhakti pratirūpakam iti ucyate
translated: It is said to be a substitute for a case ending.

analyzed: na ca evam vibhaktiḥ asti
translated: But there is no such case ending.

analyzed: na na asti
translated: It is not that there is none.

analyzed: ām anta anuprayogasya vidyamāna tvāt
translated: Because the application of the locative case exists.

original: nanvevaṃ tarhi prayujyate /🔽śrutirna samyaganubhavasādhanaṃ śabdatve satyabuddhipūrvakatvāditi /
analyzed: nanu evam tarhi prayujyate  śrutiḥ na samyak anubhava sādhanam śabda tve satya buddhi pūrvaka tvāt iti
translated: If so, then it is used in this way:🔽Śruti is not a means of valid knowledge of true experience because it is sound and is not preceded by intelligence.

analyzed: yat vā śrutiḥ na āgamaḥ buddhi pūrvaka tvāt iti
translated: Or, Śruti is not scripture because it is not preceded by intelligence.
And the absence of being preceded by intelligence means the absence of being preceded by the knowledge of the truth of the intended meaning.

analyzed: pipīlika alipa avapraveśe pi unmatta vākyam dṛṣṭāntaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Even in the case of the first [type of statement], when the writing of ants is not included, the statement of a madman will be the example.

original: na conmattavākyamapi pramāṇaṃ pramāṇaviruddhatvādityata āha viruddhaṃ tviti //🔽viruddhaṃ tu virodhādeva bādhitam // / / //
analyzed: na ca unmatta vākyam api pramāṇam pramāṇa viruddha tvāt iti atas āha viruddham tu iti  viruddham tu virodhāt eva bādhitam
translated: And a statement of a madman is not a means of valid knowledge, because it contradicts a means of valid knowledge. Therefore he says: But what is contradictory is refuted just by contradiction.

original: pramāṇaviruddhaṃ yadunmattavākyaṃ tat pramāṇavirodhādeva bādhitamayathārthamiti yāvat /
analyzed: pramāṇa viruddham yat unmatta vākyam tat pramāṇa virodhāt eva bādhitam ayathārtham iti yāvat
translated: But what is contradictory to a means of valid knowledge is refuted just by contradicting a means of valid knowledge, meaning that it is not in accordance with reality.

analyzed: na tu ukta hetubhyām iti  sopādhika tām anena ācaṣṭe
translated: It is not by the stated reasons.🔽By this he shows that [the statement of a madman] has a limiting condition.

analyzed: atas eva āpta apraṇīta vākyatva hetuḥ api apāstaḥ
translated: For this very reason, the reason being a statement composed by an untrustworthy person is also refuted.

analyzed: ayam abhisandhiḥ
translated: This is the intention.

analyzed: na tāvat samyak anubhava sādhana tva abhāvaḥ jñāna sādhana tva abhāvena
translated: First, the absence of being a means of valid knowledge of correct experience is not due to the absence of being a means of valid knowledge of knowledge.

analyzed: jñāna sādhana tvasya ubhaya siddha tvāt
translated: Because the absence of being a means of valid knowledge of knowledge is accepted by both [parties].

analyzed: nā api smṛti sādhana tvena
translated: Nor is it due to being a means of valid knowledge of memory.
Because it is accepted that [memory] has as its object something not previously experienced.

analyzed: tatas viparīta bodhaka tvena eva iti vācyam
translated: Therefore it must be said that [memory] is only a means of valid knowledge of something contrary [to the object of perception].

analyzed: evam dvitīya prayoge pi na tāvat anāgama tvam aśabda tvena
translated: In the same way, in the second formulation, being non-scripture is not due to being non-verbal.

analyzed: śabda tvasya ubhaya sammata tvāt
translated: Because soundness is accepted by both.

analyzed: tasmāt ayathā athartvena iti vaktavyam
translated: Therefore, it should be said that it is not in accordance with the meaning.

analyzed: evam tṛtīya prayoge sādhya niṣka ṣaraḥ kartavyaḥ
translated: Thus, in the third argument also, the conclusion to be proved should be stated.

analyzed: tathā ca tatra pramāṇa bādhita tvam upādhiḥ
translated: And thus, there being contradicted by valid cognition is the reason.

analyzed: yat vā anubhava sādhana tva avacchinne prathama sādhye
translated: Or, in the first conclusion to be proved, which is qualified by being the means of experience,

analyzed: vākya tva avacchinne dvitīya sādhye bodhaka tva avacchinne tṛtīye ca ayam upādhiḥ iti
translated: in the second conclusion to be proved, which is qualified by being a sentence, and in the third, which is qualified by being a revealer, this is the reason.

original: nanvasyopādheryadayathārthaṃ tatpramāṇaviruddhamiti sādhyavyāpakatve 'pi sādhanāvyāpakatvaṃ kathamityata āha virodheti //
analyzed: nanu asya upādheḥ yat ayathārtham tat pramāṇa viruddham iti sādhya vyāpaka tve pi sādhana avyāpaka tvam katham iti atas āha virodha iti
translated: If this reason is such that whatever is not in accordance with the meaning is contradicted by valid cognition, then even though it pervades the conclusion to be proved, how can it not pervade the means of proof? In response to this, it is said: because of non-observation of contradiction.

analyzed: virodha adarśanāt
translated: Because of non-observation of contradiction.

analyzed: pakṣīkṛtāyām śrutau ukta sādhana sadbhāve pi
translated: Even though the means of proof mentioned exist in the Veda which is the subject, there is no observation of contradiction with valid cognition.

analyzed: sādhana avyāpaka tvam iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder is that it does not pervade the means of proof.

analyzed: atra virodha abhāvāt iti vaktavye darśanāt iti uktam virodha abhāva sādhana artham iti draṣṭavyam
translated: Here, although because of non-existence of contradiction should be said, because of non-observation is stated for the purpose of proving the non-existence of contradiction. This should be seen.

analyzed: kim atas yadi evam pramāṇa viruddha tvam upādhiḥ iti ced
translated: If it is asked what follows from this if being contradicted by valid cognition is a reason,🔽then the answer is: Because of the absence of contradiction with valid cognition.

analyzed: upādheḥ pratipakṣa unnāyaka tvasya vakṣyamāṇa tvena anumānānām sat pratipakṣa tvam iti āśayena āha tasmāt iti
translated: Having the intention that since the counter-agent, which is the leader of the counter-evidence, will be stated, the inferences have a counter-evidence, he says therefore.

analyzed: tasmāt veda prāmāṇyam iṣyate
translated: Therefore, the authoritativeness of the Veda is accepted.

analyzed: yasmāt pramāṇa viruddha tvam ayathārtha tvasya vyāpakam vyāvṛtam ca pakṣīkṛtāt vedāt
translated: Because the contradiction with valid cognition, which is the pervader of being untrue, is excluded from the Veda, which is the subject.

analyzed: vyāpaka nivṛttau vyāpya nivṛttiḥ avaśyambhāvinī
translated: When the pervader is negated, the pervaded must necessarily be negated.

analyzed: tasmāt veda prāmāṇyam eṣyavyam
translated: Therefore, the authoritativeness of the Veda must be accepted.

analyzed: ayam atra prayogaḥ
translated: Here is the argument:

analyzed: vedaḥ na ayathārthaḥ pramāṇa aviruddha tvāt pratyakṣa vat
translated: The Veda is not untrue, because it is not contradicted by valid cognition, like perception.

original: yadvā vedo yathārtho bodhakatve sati pramāṇāviruddhatvātpratyakṣavat /
analyzed: yat vā vedaḥ yathā arthaḥ bodhaka tve sati pramāṇa aviruddha tvāt pratyakṣa vat
translated: Or, the Veda is true, because it is not contradicted by valid cognition while being a revealer, like perception.

analyzed: evam vedaḥ samyak anubhava sādhanam anubhava sādhana tve sati pramāṇa viruddha tvāt pratyakṣa vat
translated: Similarly, the Veda is a means of right experience, because it is not contradicted by valid cognition while being a means of experience, like perception.

analyzed: vedaḥ āgamaḥ vākya tve sati pramāṇa aviruddha tvāt sampratipanna vat iti
translated: The Veda is a valid testimony, because it is not contradicted by valid cognition while being a statement, like what is commonly accepted.

original: evaṃ vākyatvāvacchinne sādhye 'nāptapraṇītatvamupādhistadviparyayeṇa ca pratipakṣo 'bhidheya iti / /
analyzed: evam vākya tva avacchinne sādhye na āpta praṇīta tvam upādhiḥ tad viparyayeṇa ca pratipakṣaḥ bhidheyaḥ iti
translated: Thus, in the conclusion restricted by being a statement, being composed by an unreliable person is a reason, and its opposite is to be stated as the counter-evidence.

analyzed: astu evam veda prāmāṇyam
translated: Let it be so that the Veda is authoritative.

analyzed: pañcarātra ādi smṛtīnām tu katham
translated: But how about the Smṛtis like the Pañcarātra?

analyzed: nahi tāḥ api apauruṣeyāḥ
translated: For they are not also non-human.

original: yena prāmāṇyamavadhārya phalavyabhicāramanyathā neṣyāma ityata āha tanmūlatvāditi //
analyzed: yena prāmāṇyam avadhārya phala vyabhicāram anyathā neṣyāmaḥ iti atas āha tad mūla tvāt iti
translated: By which [authority] we can determine their validity and explain away the discrepancy in results. To this he says 'because they have the Veda as their basis,' etc.

analyzed: tad mūla tvāt smṛtīnām ca
translated: Because they have the Veda as their basis, the Smṛtis

analyzed: prāmāṇyam iṣyate iti sambandhaḥ
translated: are accepted as authoritative. This is the connection.

analyzed: yadi api bhagavat racitānām
translated: Although the meanings of the Vedas composed by the Lord

analyzed: tham upalabhya racita tvam veda mūla tvam na asti
translated: are obtained, and they are composed, they do not have the Veda as their basis.

analyzed: tasya svatas sarvajña tvam
translated: He is omniscient by himself.

original: tathāpi tamanusṛtya racitatvaṃ tanmūlatvamiha vivakṣitamiti noktadoṣaḥ /
analyzed: tathā api tam anusṛtya racita tvam tad mūla tvam iha vivakṣitam iti na ukta doṣaḥ
translated: Nevertheless, the intended meaning here is that they are composed in accordance with him, so the stated fault does not arise.

analyzed: ayam atra prayogaḥ
translated: Here is the argument:

analyzed: pañcarātra ādi smṛtiḥ pramāṇam pramāṇa mūla tvāt pramāṇa saṃvādi tvāt sampratipanna vat iti
translated: The Smṛtis like the Pañcarātra are valid because they have a valid basis, because they agree with valid knowledge, like what is commonly recognized.

analyzed: yat vā vimatam pramāṇam veda saṃvādi tvāt para abhyupagata arhiṃsā ādi vākya vat
translated: Or, the disputed [Smṛtis] are valid because they agree with the Veda, like the statements accepted by others about non-violence, etc.

analyzed: āpta vākya tvam upādhiḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that being the words of a reliable person is a limiting condition, that is not so.

analyzed: pratyakṣa ādau sādhya avyāpanāt
translated: Because it does not pervade the probandum in perception, etc.

analyzed: vākya tva avacchinna sādhya vyāpaka tvāt adoṣaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that there is no fault because it pervades the probandum qualified by being a statement, that is not so.

analyzed: tathā api veda itara vākya tva avacchinna sādhanena upādheḥ pakṣe sādhana saulabhyāt
translated: Still, because of the ease of proving the reason in the subject by the reason consisting of being a sentence other than a Vedic one.

original: sati caivaṃ smṛtīnāṃ prāmāṇye tadbalena phalavyabhicāro 'pyanyathayitavya iti /
analyzed: sati ca evam smṛtīnām prāmāṇye tad balena phala vyabhicāraḥ pi anyathayitavyaḥ iti
translated: And when the authoritativeness of the Smṛtis is thus established, the discrepancy in the result should be explained away by their force.

original: nanu coktārthaviruddhavādīnyapi smṛtītihāsapurāṇānyupalabhyante /🔽teṣāṃ prāmāṇyasādhane ca bahuviplavaḥ syādityata āha virodha iti //
analyzed: nanu ca ukta artha viruddha vādīni api smṛti itihāsa purāṇāni upalabhyante  teṣām prāmāṇya sādhane ca bahu viplavaḥ syāt iti atas āha virodhaḥ iti
translated: But are not also found Smṛtis, Itihāsas, and Purāṇas which contradict the meaning stated (above)?

analyzed: virodhaḥ yatra na kvacid
translated: And if their authoritativeness is established, there would be much confusion. To this he says: The contradiction, where there is none anywhere (verse 32).

analyzed: pūrveṇa eva anvayaḥ
translated: The antecedent (verse 31) is to be connected.

original: yāsāṃ smṛtīnāṃ sarvathā pramāṇavirodho nāsti tāsāmeva pakṣīkaraṇānna kaściddoṣa ityāśayaḥ /
analyzed: yāsām smṛtīnām sarvathā pramāṇa virodhaḥ na asti tāsām eva pakṣīkaraṇāt na kaścid doṣaḥ iti āśayaḥ
translated: The idea is that there is no fault in taking only those Smṛtis as the subject which do not in any way contradict the means of knowledge.

analyzed: nanu evam sati veda mūla tva upanyāsaḥ vyarthaḥ
translated: If that is so, the statement of having the Veda as their root is useless.

analyzed: jñāna janakānām avaśya aṅgīkaraṇīyena virodha abhāvena eva prāmāṇya siddheḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the authoritativeness is established by the absence of contradiction alone, which must be accepted if they are the producers of knowledge, that is not so.

analyzed: phala vyabhicāra lakṣaṇa virodha darśanena asiddhi prasaṅgāt
translated: Because of the possibility of non-establishment due to the seen contradiction characterized by discrepancy in the result.

analyzed: prāmāṇyena tad apanayane ca itaretarāśraya tva āpātāt
translated: And because of the contingence of mutual dependence if the authoritativeness removes that.

original: vedamūlatvena tu prāmāṇye siddhe na ko 'pi doṣa iti / /
analyzed: veda mūla tvena tu prāmāṇye siddhe na kaḥ pi doṣaḥ iti
translated: But if the validity is established by being based on the Veda, then there is no fault at all.

analyzed: aprāmāṇya prayojakasya pramāṇa virodhasya abhāvāt na śruti smṛtyoḥ aprāmāṇyam iti uktam
translated: It has been said that the Veda and Smṛti are not invalid because there is no contradiction with valid knowledge, which is the cause of invalidity.

analyzed: tat ayuktam
translated: That is not correct.

analyzed: śruti ādi uktasya
translated: Because what is stated by the Veda etc.

analyzed: īśvara sārvajña ādeḥ īśvaraḥ na sarvajñaḥ puruṣa tvāt
translated: God's omniscience etc. are contradicted by inference, such as God is not omniscient because he is a person,

analyzed: yajñadatta vat
translated: like Yajñadatta.

analyzed: ityādi anumāna viruddha tvāt iti atas āha virodhaḥ pi iti
translated: Therefore, he says Even contradiction...

analyzed: virodhaḥ saḥ eva uktaḥ pratyakṣeṇa āgamena vā
translated: Even that contradiction which is said to be with perception or scripture,

analyzed: prakṛta sambandha arthaḥ pi śabdaḥ
translated: The word api (even) has the meaning of connection with the subject matter.

analyzed: yad śabdaḥ dhyā ahāryaḥ
translated: The word yat (that) should be supplied.

original: virodhādeva bādhitamityaprāmāṇyaprayojakatayokto virodho 'pi sa eva yaḥ pratyakṣeṇāgamena vā syāt /
analyzed: virodhāt eva bādhitam iti aprāmāṇya prayojaka tayā uktaḥ saḥ eva yaḥ pratyakṣeṇa āgamena vā syāt
translated: Even that contradiction which would be with perception or scripture, which is said to be the cause of invalidity because it is contradicted by contradiction itself,

analyzed: na punar anumānena
translated: and not by inference again.

original: ayamabhisandhiḥ /🔽aprāmāṇyaprayojakatayā yadasmābhirabhihitaṃ tatpakṣe 'pyupapādayituṃ khalu parasyāyaṃ prayatnaḥ /
analyzed: ayam abhisandhiḥ  a prāmāṇya prayojaka tayā yat asmābhiḥ abhihitam tat pakṣe khalu parasya ayam prayatnaḥ
translated: This is the intention:🔽This effort of the opponent is indeed to establish what we have stated as the cause of invalidity in his own view as well.

analyzed: asmābhiḥ ca pratyakṣa āgama virodhaḥ eva tathā abhipretaḥ na anumāna virodhaḥ
translated: And we accept only the contradiction with perception and scripture, not with inference.

analyzed: tathā ca pakṣe tad vyutpādanam prakṛta asaṅgatam eva
translated: And so the explanation of that in the case of the thesis is irrelevant to the present subject.

analyzed: svatantra anumāna virodham tu uttaratra nirākariṣyati sūtrakṛt iti
translated: But the author of the aphorisms will refute the contradiction of an independent inference later on.

original: nanu pramāṇavirodha evāprāmāṇye prayojako 'stu kiṃ pratyakṣeṇāgamena veti viśeṣaṇena /
analyzed: nanu pramāṇa virodhaḥ eva aprāmāṇye prayojakaḥ stu kim pratyakṣeṇa āgamena vā iti viśeṣaṇena
translated: But let contradiction of a means of right knowledge alone be the cause of invalidity. What is the use of specifying whether it is by perception or by scripture?

analyzed: tathā ca ukta numāna virīdhāt veda ādeḥ aprāmāṇyam iti
translated: And so, because of the contradiction of the inference stated, the Veda, etc., are invalid.

analyzed: mā evam
translated: Not so.

original: vakṣyāmo hyatra brahmādivastuṣu pramāṇaṃ veda evaika iti vaidike 'rthe 'numānasyānavakāśam /
analyzed: vakṣyāmaḥ hi atra brahma ādi vastuṣu pramāṇam vedaḥ eva ekaḥ iti vaidike rthe numānasya anavakāśam
translated: For we shall say here that the Veda alone is the means of right knowledge in regard to Brahman and other things, and so inference has no place in the matter of the Veda.

original: yatra ca yasyāpraveśo na tasya tadbādhakam /
analyzed: yatra ca yasya apraveśaḥ na tasya tat bādhakam
translated: And where one does not enter, that is not a contradiction of it.

analyzed: nahi nayanam sparśa apabādhanasya iṣye  tathā ca katham anumānam
translated: For the eye is not accepted as a contradiction of touch.

analyzed: tha bādhakena tad aprāmāṇye prayojakam syāt
translated: And so how can inference be a cause of invalidity of the Veda, etc., by contradicting their meaning?

analyzed: prakṛtam ca veda ādikam eva iti
translated: And the Veda, etc., are the very subject under discussion.

analyzed: nanu evam sati
translated: But if this is so,

original: tarhi vedārthamīmāṃsā nārambhaṇīyā syāt mīmāṃsāyā yuktyanusandhānātmakatavādityata āha āgameneti //
analyzed: tarhi veda artha mīmāṃsā na ārambhaṇīyā syāt mīmāṃsāyāḥ yukti anusandhāna ātmaka tavāt iti atas āha āgamena iti
translated: then the Mīmāṃsā of the meaning of the Veda would not be worth undertaking, because Mīmāṃsā consists of the reflection on reason. In answer to this he says:

analyzed: āgamena āgamasya eva virodhe yuktiḥ iṣyate
translated: When there is a contradiction of one scripture by another, reason is accepted.

analyzed: eva śabdaḥ virodhe iti atas paraḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The word “only” should be seen as meaning “contradiction.”

analyzed: nirṇaya artham iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The rest is for the sake of determining.

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said.

original: anumānaṃ hi dharmyādipramitimapekṣate /🔽naca dharmyādirūpaṃ brahmādikaṃ vedādṛte siddhayatīti tadanapekṣāyāmāśrayāsiddhayādikam /
analyzed: anumānam hi dharmya ādi pramitim apekṣate  naca dharmya ādi rūpam brahma ādikam vedāt ṛte siddhayati iti tad anapekṣāyām āśraya asiddhayā ādikam
translated: For inference depends on the ascertainment of the subject and so on.🔽And the form of the subject and so on, such as Brahman, is not established without the Veda. Therefore, if it does not depend on that, there is the fallacy of the unestablished basis and so on.

original: apekṣāyāṃ tu virodhino dharmyādigrāhakavirodha ityevaṃ vaidike 'rthe 'numānasyānavakāśo 'bhidhistitaḥ /
analyzed: apekṣāyām tu virodhinaḥ dharmi ādi grāhaka virodhaḥ iti evam vaidike rthe numānasya anavakāśaḥ
translated: But if it does depend on that, there is contradiction with the contradicting means of knowledge that grasps the subject and so on. Thus it is said that inference has no scope in the Vedic sense.

original: mīmāṃsāyāṃ tu kvacidāgamasyāgamāntareṇa virodha evārthanirṇayārthaṃ yuktirupādīyate /
analyzed: mīmāṃsāyām tu kvacid āgamasya āgama antareṇa virodhaḥ eva artha nirṇaya artham yuktiḥ upādīyate
translated: But in Mīmāṃsā, in some cases reasoning is employed for the sake of determining the meaning due to the contradiction of one scripture by another scripture.

analyzed: sā khalu anyatara āgama prāmāṇya  m upodbalayantī antyā  nyatara āgama bādhayā rtha nirṇayāya prabhavati
translated: For that, strengthening the authoritativeness of one of the two scriptures,🔽in the end, is able to bring about the determination of the meaning by refuting the other scripture.

analyzed: anyatara āgama siddha dharmya ādi āśrayaṇena āyeṇa  śraya asiddhayā ādi anavakāśāt
translated: By the method of relying on the subject and so on established by one of the two scriptures,🔽the fallacies of the unestablished basis and so on do not arise.
Because the other scripture, being weak, does not have the nature of being the means of knowledge that grasps the subject and so on.

analyzed: āgama sūcitayā upapatteḥ tatas durbalasya
translated: Because the reasoning indicated by the scripture is weaker than that.

analyzed: a kiñcitkara tvāt
translated: Because it is of no use.

analyzed: tat evam evaṃvidha upapatteḥ āgamike pi arthe sāvakāśa tvāt upapannā mīmāṃsā iti
translated: Thus, since the Vedic meaning also has a basis in such a way, the investigation is proper.

original: api ca pratyakṣāgamavirodho 'pi na svarūpeṇāprāmāṇyaṃ prayojayati /
analyzed: api ca pratyakṣa āgama virodhaḥ na sva rūpeṇa aprāmāṇyam prayojayati
translated: Moreover, even the contradiction with perception and scripture does not directly cause invalidity.

original: kintu tayorupajīvyatvādinā prābalye satyeva durbalayoḥ svayaṃ bādhitatvena samabalayoḥ pratibandhamātrahetutvenāprāmāṇyaniścayānupapatteḥ /
analyzed: kintu tayoḥ upajīvya tva ādinā prābalye sati eva durbalayoḥ svayam bādhita tvena sama balayoḥ pratibandha mātra hetu tvena aprāmāṇya niścaya anupapatteḥ
translated: But only when they are stronger by being the basis of the other, etc., the weaker ones are contradicted by themselves, and the equally strong ones are merely the cause of obstruction, the ascertainment of invalidity is not possible.

analyzed: upajīvya ādi virodhena ca aprāmāṇyam bhavat vedasya na sarvathā ayathārtha tva lakṣaṇam
translated: And the invalidity of the Veda due to contradiction with the basis of the other, etc., is not characterized by being entirely untrue.

analyzed: kinnāma pratīta artha pracyāvana mātram
translated: But it is merely the removal of the understood meaning.

analyzed: apauruṣeya tayā nirdoṣasya sarvathā aprāmāṇya anupapatteḥ  tathā ca anya artha kalpanā avaśyam kāryā iti āśayavān āha upajīvya iti
translated: Because the entirely invalidity of the faultless Veda is not possible by being non-human.

analyzed: upajīvya virodhe tu vedasya anya artha kalpanā
translated: And thus the assumption of another meaning must necessarily be done. With this intention he says: When there is contradiction with the basis of the other, the other meaning of the Veda is assumed.

analyzed: upalakṣaṇam etat
translated: This is a metaphor.

analyzed: niravakāśa tva ādikam api grāhyam
translated: The absence of an occasion, etc. should also be taken.

analyzed: bhavatu evam tatas kim
translated: Let it be so, then what?

analyzed: veda upajīvya tva ādikam ca pratyakṣa āgamayoḥ eva prāyeṇa sambhavati
translated: And the being the basis of the Veda, etc. is mostly possible only for perception and scripture.

analyzed: yukteḥ tu kvacid eva
translated: But in some cases, it is due to connection.

analyzed: puruṣa tva ādi yukteḥ tu na asti eva
translated: But in the case of one connected with being a man and so on, it does not exist at all.

original: ataśca na tadvirodhena vedasyāprāmāṇyaṃ mantavyamityāśayenāha pratyakṣamiti // /
analyzed: atas ca na tad virodhena vedasya aprāmāṇyam mantavyam iti āśayena āha pratyakṣam iti
translated: And therefore, the unreliability of the Veda should not be thought of in contradiction with that. With this idea, he says: Perception, etc.

original: pratyakṣamupajīvyaṃ syāt prāyo yuktirapi kvacit /🔽āgamaikapramāṇeṣu tasyaiva hyupajīvyatā // / / //
analyzed: pratyakṣam upajīvyam syāt prāyas yuktiḥ api kvacid  āgama eka pramāṇeṣu tasya eva hi upajīvya tā
translated: Perception would be relied upon, and reasoning also in some cases.🔽For those where the Veda alone is the means of knowing, it is only that which is relied upon.

analyzed: vedasya iti anuvartate
translated: The Veda is continued.

analyzed: syāt iti atas param iti śabdaḥ dhyāhāryaḥ tat tvam asi ityādi vedasya pratyakṣam upajīvyam
translated: The word iti should be supplied after syāt. The Veda beginning with That thou art relies upon perception.

analyzed: yuktiḥ api kvacid vedasya upajīvyā iti sambandhaḥ
translated: Reasoning is also relied upon in some cases by the Veda. This is the connection.

analyzed: yathā prāṇāḥ vā aṇavaḥ ityādeḥ
translated: As in the case of The vital breaths are indeed subtle.

analyzed: āgama eka pramāṇakeṣu viṣṇu ādi viṣayeṣu viṣṇoḥ
translated: For those engaged in the matter of Viṣṇu and so on, where the Veda alone is the means of knowing, the Veda beginning with He who is unborn

original: ityādivedaṃ prati niraniṣyo niravadya ityādestasya vedodasyo
analyzed: ityādi vedam prati niraniṣyaḥ niravadyaḥ iti ādeḥ tasya
translated: is relied upon by that Veda beginning with He who is free from sin, free from fault, etc.

analyzed: pajīvyate iti arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: evaṃ niravakāśatvādikamapi pratyakṣāgamayoreva prāyeṇa sambhavati yuktestu kvacideva /
analyzed: evam niravakāśa tva ādikam api pratyakṣa āgamayoḥ eva prāyeṇa sambhavati yukteḥ tu kvacid eva
translated: Thus, the absence of scope, etc. also are mostly possible only for perception and the Veda, but reasoning is in some cases only.

analyzed: tat ca na prakṛta yukteḥ iti api draṣṭavyam
translated: And that is not the case with the reasoning under consideration. This should also be seen.

analyzed: āgamayoḥ paraspara virodhe sati anyatara āgama āśrayeṇa yukteḥ anupraveśa upapatteḥ yuktā mīmāṃsā iti uktam
translated: It has been said that when there is a contradiction between two scriptures, it is proper to engage in inquiry, because reasoning can be applied based on one of the scriptures.

analyzed: tat anupapannam
translated: That is not correct.

analyzed: a sārvatrika tvāt
translated: Because it is not universal.

original: nahi sarvatrāgamayoḥ parasparavirodha eva mīmāṃsāvatāryata ityata āha yukta iti //🔽yukto 'yuktaśca yadyartha āgamasya pratīyate /
analyzed: nahi sarvatra āgamayoḥ paraspara virodhaḥ eva mīmāṃsā avatāryate iti atas āha yuktaḥ iti  yuktaḥ yuktaḥ ca yadi arthaḥ āgamasya pratīyate
translated: For inquiry is not always started just because there is a contradiction between two scriptures. Therefore it is said: Reasoning is proper.🔽If the meaning of a scripture is understood to be proper or improper,

analyzed: syāt tatra yuktaḥ
translated: then the proper meaning alone should be accepted there.

analyzed: tatra tarhi ayam abhisandhiḥ
translated: In that case, this is the intention.
