translated: In that creation described by them, which has the rule of being produced by similar [causes], by only two [causes], by only atoms, etc., there is no valid means of knowledge. It would contradict the mode of creation accepted by us, which is established by perception etc.

analyzed: tathā ca uktam prāk
translated: And that has been stated earlier.

analyzed: dvitīyam dūṣayati kevala iti
translated: He refutes the second [view] with How can mere imagination.

analyzed: kevala kalpanā
translated: Mere imagination.

analyzed: katham sākṣi mitasya asya śaknuyāt vāraṇe kvacid
translated: How can it ever be able to prevent this, which is known by the witness?

analyzed: nirmūla iti arthaḥ  sākṣī iti upalakṣaṇam
translated: The meaning is: it has no basis.🔽Witness is a metaphor.

analyzed: asya aniyama ārambhasya
translated: Of this, the beginning of the unrestricted [creation].

analyzed: kalpanā mātrasya prāmāṇika nivāraka tve tiprasaṅgaḥ iti
translated: The implication is that if mere imagination were to prevent what is established by valid means of knowledge, there would be an overextension.

analyzed: ṅgāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: Ga and so on.

original: atra tatproktasṛṣṭāviti sāmānyato vadatānyadapi tatkalpitamaprāmāṇikamiti sūcitam /
analyzed: atra tad prokta sṛṣṭau iti sāmānyatas vadatā anyat api tat kalpitam aprāmāṇikam iti sūcitam
translated: Here, by saying in that creation described by him, it is generally stated that even other things imagined by him are not authoritative.

analyzed: tathā hi prakṛtemarhāt mahataḥ haṅkāraḥ haṅkārāt krameṇa ākāśa ādīni mahābhūtāni
translated: Thus, indeed, in the Prakṛti, from the great one, egoism; from egoism, in order, the great elements such as space, etc.

original: ityetāṃ śrutyādiprasiddhāṃ prakriyāmapahāya vāyvādīnāṃ caturṇāmanyonyānapekṣaiva sṛṣṭirvyutkrameṇa cābhihitā /🔽vinaiva bādhakenaākāśādvāyurvāyoragniḥ' /
analyzed: iti etām śruti ādi prasiddhām prakriyām apahāya vāyu ādīnām caturṇām anyonya anapekṣā eva sṛṣṭiḥ vyutkrameṇa ca abhihitā  vinā eva bādhakena ākāśāt vāyuḥ vāyoḥ agniḥ
translated: Abandoning this process well-known from the scriptures etc., the creation of the four beginning with air is stated to be independent of each other and in reverse order.

analyzed: ityādi pañcamī bhāktī svīkṛtā
translated: Even without any contradiction, the genitive case ending in from space, air; from air, fire, etc. is accepted as figurative.

analyzed: atyanta asataḥ eva ca janiḥ aṅgīkṛtā
translated: And the origination of something absolutely non-existent is accepted.

analyzed: sarvā api sṛṣṭiḥ samavāyī ādi kāraṇa traya adhīnā abhyupagatā
translated: And all creation is accepted as dependent on the three causes such as the inherent cause.

analyzed: tatra samavāyi kāraṇam samavāya aprāmāṇika tvasya vakṣyamāṇa tvāt ayuktam
translated: Among them, the inherent cause is not proper, because the inherence will be shown to be non-authoritative.

analyzed: atas eva asamavāyi kāraṇam api  tad adhīna nirūpaṇa tvāt ca tad lakṣaṇasya
translated: For this very reason, the non-inherent cause also.🔽And because the definition is dependent on that.

analyzed: samavāyi nimittayoḥ ativyāpteḥ ca
translated: And because of the over-extension of the inherent and the instrumental causes.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: Thus, indeed.

analyzed: tantu paṭayoḥ utpannasya dvi tvasya paṭaḥ samavāyi kāraṇam
translated: The cloth is the inherent cause of the duality produced in the cloth and the threads.

original: sa ca dvitvasamavāyikāraṇe tantau samavetatvāt samavāyikāraṇapratyāsannaḥ /🔽samavāyikāraṇatayāvadhṛtasāmarthyaśca /🔽śarīrātmanorutpannasya dvitvasyāpekṣābuddhirnimittam /🔽sā ca dvitvasamavāyikāraṇātsamavetatvānnimittatvāccoktalakṣaṇasampannā /
analyzed: sa ca dvi tva samavāyi kāraṇe tantau samaveta tvāt samavāyi kāraṇa pratyāsannaḥ  samavāyi kāraṇa tayā avadhṛta sāmarthyaḥ ca  śarīra ātmanoḥ utpannasya dvi tvasya apekṣā buddhiḥ nimittam  sā ca dvi tva samavāyi kāraṇāt samaveta tvāt nimitta tvāt ca ukta lakṣaṇa sampannā
translated: And that [duality] is proximate to the material cause by inhering in the thread, which is the material cause of duality.🔽And its potency is ascertained by being the material cause.🔽The instrumental cause of the duality produced in the body and self is the cognition of relation.🔽And that [cognition of relation] is endowed with the mentioned characteristics by inhering in the material cause of duality and by being the instrumental cause.

analyzed: samavāyi kāraṇa pratyāsanna tayā sāmarthya avadhāraṇam abhihimatam
translated: The ascertainment of potency by proximity to the material cause is stated.

analyzed: na ca tathā prakṛtaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it is not so in the present case,

original: tathāpi vyāpyabuddhervyāpakabuddhiṃ prati viṣayabuddherdharmādharmayośca sukhaduḥkhe pratyasamavāyikāraṇatvāpatteḥ /🔽nahyanyagataṃ vyāpyabuddhayādyanyagatasya vyāpakabuddhayādernimittaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tathā api vyāpya buddheḥ vyāpaka buddhim prati viṣaya buddheḥ dharma adharmayoḥ ca sukha duḥkhe prati asamavāyi kāraṇa tva āpatteḥ  na hi anya gatam vyāpya buddhayā ādi anya gatasya vyāpaka buddhayā ādeḥ nimittam bhavati
translated: even so, the cognition of the pervaded would be the material cause of the cognition of the pervader, and virtue and vice would be the material cause of pleasure and pain, because of being the object of cognition.

analyzed: ātmani pradeśa bhedāt na iti ced na
translated: For what is present in one thing cannot be the instrumental cause of what is present in another thing.🔽If it is argued that it is not so in the present case because of the difference of parts in the self, it is not so.

analyzed: ādi ādi śabdānām dvitīya ādi śabda samavāyi kāraṇa tva abhāva āpatteḥ
translated: Because the first and other words would not be the material cause of the second and other words.

analyzed: eka ākāśa gata tvena tad sambhave prakṛte samānam
translated: When they are possible by being present in the same ākāśa, the same applies in the present case.

analyzed: evam anyatra api ativyāptiḥ ūhanīyā
translated: In the same way, the over-extension in other cases should be understood.

original: saṅketo 'yamācāryasya /🔽ato nātīvātra nirbandhaḥ karaṇīya iti cet /
analyzed: saṅketaḥ yama ācāryasya  atas na atīva atra nirbandhaḥ karaṇīyaḥ iti ced
translated: This is the teacher's convention.

analyzed: evam tarhi nimūlā evā iyam prakriyā iti siddham eva
translated: Therefore, one should not insist too much on this. If so, then this procedure is indeed baseless. It is established.

analyzed: pāka ja prakriyām ca aprāmāṇikam aṅgīkurvanti
translated: And they accept the procedure of the product of cooking as unauthoritative.

original: tatracca vakṣyata ityalam / /🔽nanu paramāṇudvayaṇuke eva tāvanna sākṣisiddhe kutastadīyārambhaprakāraḥ /
analyzed: tatrat ca vakṣyate iti alam  nanu paramāṇu dvayaṇuke eva tāvat na sākṣi siddhe kutas tadīya ārambha prakāraḥ
translated: And that will be explained there. So it is enough.🔽But the atom and dyad are not established by the witness at all. How then is the mode of their origination?

analyzed: tat katham uktam sākṣi mitasya iti
translated: How then is it said that it is measured by the witness?

analyzed: tatra āha yadi iti
translated: There he says if etc.

analyzed: yadi sākṣi mitam na etat
translated: If this is not measured by the witness,

analyzed: etat iti  paramāṇu ādikam
translated: this🔽means the atom etc.

analyzed: tarhi tat aprāmāṇikam eva āpadyate iti śeṣaḥ
translated: Then it follows that it is indeed unauthoritative.

analyzed: syāt etat
translated: This may be said:

analyzed: yadi api mahat tva abhāvāt na paramāṇu ādikam cakṣuḥ ādeḥ gocaraḥ
translated: Even though the atom etc. are not the object of the eye etc. because of the absence of largeness,

analyzed: bahis svātantryāt manasaḥ pi
translated: and even of the mind because of external independence,

analyzed: āgama ādi tu na anumānāt bhidyate
translated: but the scripture etc. are not different from inference.

analyzed: bhede pi atīndriye saṅketa anupapatteḥ na āgamasya viṣayaḥ  tathā api anumānam tatra pramāṇam
translated: Even if there is a difference, it is not the object of the scripture because of the impossibility of convention regarding the supersensible.

analyzed: bhaviṣyati
translated: Nevertheless, inference will be the means of knowledge there.

analyzed: tat katham paramāṇu ādeḥ sākṣi vedya tva abhāve prāmāṇika tva āpattiḥ iti atas āha na iti
translated: How then, in the absence of the perceptibility of the atom etc. by the witness, does it lead to the fault of being unestablished? To this he says 'no' etc.

analyzed: na anumā tatra vartate
translated: Inference does not operate there.

analyzed: katham iti ced
translated: If it be asked how,

analyzed: kim paramāṇu ādikam eva pakṣīkṛtya tat sādhyate
translated: is it that the atom etc. itself is taken as the subject and that is established?

analyzed: uta anyat
translated: Or is it something else?

analyzed: ādye tad pramāṇa antarataḥ siddham na vā
translated: In the first case, is it established by another means of knowledge or not?

analyzed: pakṣa dvaye doṣam āha pakṣīkartum iti
translated: In both cases, the fault is stated by saying 'it cannot be taken as the subject' etc.

analyzed: pakṣīkartum aśakya tvāt kutas evā anumā bhavet
translated: Because it cannot be taken as the subject, how can there be inference at all?

original: siddhatve pakṣalakṣaṇābhāvādasiddhatve nyāyāviṣayatvātparamāṇvādeḥ pakṣīkartumaśakyatvāt tatpakṣīkāreṇānumā dūranirasteti /
analyzed: siddha tve pakṣa lakṣaṇa abhāvāt asiddha tve nyāya aviṣaya tvāt paramāṇu ādeḥ pakṣīkartum aśakya tvāt tad pakṣīkāreṇa anumā dūra nirastā iti
translated: If it is established, it lacks the characteristics of the subject, and if it is not established, it is not the object of reasoning. Since the atom etc. cannot be taken as the subject, inference by taking that as the subject is far removed.

analyzed: nanu pakṣīkaraṇa asambhave katham anumāna anupapattiḥ iti atas āha yatra iti
translated: If it be said that if it cannot be taken as the subject, how is inference impossible? To this he says 'where' etc.

analyzed: yatra nā asti pada nyāsaḥ kaḥ tam viṣayam āpnuyāt
translated: Where there is no placement of the foot, who can attain that object?

analyzed: yathā tathā iti adhyāhartavyam
translated: 'As it is' should be supplied.

analyzed: yatra yad viṣaye
translated: Where, in which object.

original: viṣayaṃ deśam /🔽yathā hi viṣayaprāpteḥ padanyāsaḥ kāraṇam /
analyzed: viṣayam deśam  yathā hi viṣaya prāpteḥ padanyāsaḥ kāraṇam
translated: The object is the place.🔽Just as the placement of the foot is the cause of attaining the object,

analyzed: sthāṇu asthāṇu saṃyogasya asthāṇu kriyā hetuka tvāt
translated: because the conjunction of the post and the man is the cause of the action of the man.

analyzed: atas pada nyāsa abhāve viṣaya prāptiḥ api nā asti
translated: Therefore, in the absence of the arrangement of words, the attainment of the object also does not exist.

analyzed: tathā anumā utpattau pakṣīkaraṇam kāraṇam
translated: In the arising of inference, the making of a subject is the cause.

analyzed: nahi parvata ādiḥ vā vahni ādiḥ vā anumānasya viṣayaḥ
translated: For the mountain, etc. or fire, etc. are not the object of inference.

analyzed: kintu tad sambandhaḥ
translated: But it is their relation.

analyzed: na ca sambandhi jñānena vinā sambandha jñānam sambhavati
translated: And the knowledge of the relation is not possible without the knowledge of the relata.

analyzed: atas pakṣīkaraṇa abhāve na anumāna utpattiḥ sambhavati iti
translated: Therefore, in the absence of the making of a subject, the arising of inference is not possible.

analyzed: dvitīyam api nirākaroti pakṣīkartum iti
translated: He also refutes the second [view] with to make a subject.

analyzed: dvayaṇukam hi pakṣīkṛtya paramāṇuḥ anumātavyaḥ
translated: For, making the dyad the subject, the atom should be inferred.

analyzed: kāryam eva atra pramāṇam iti ukta tvāt
translated: Because it is said that only the effect is the means of knowledge here.

analyzed: tat ca idānīm api asiddham iti pakṣīkartum aśakya tvāt kutas eva tad kāraṇa paramāṇu anumā bhavet
translated: And that is still unestablished, so because it cannot be made a subject, how much less can there be an inference of the atom which is its cause?

original: anumitaṃ dvayaṇukaṃ pakṣīkṛtya paramāṇuranumāsyata iti cenna /
analyzed: anumitam dvayaṇukam pakṣīkṛtya paramāṇuḥ anumāsyate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that having inferred the dyad, the atom should be inferred by making it the subject, that is not so.

original: tadapi hi paramāṇuṃ pakṣīkṛtya yadi sādhyate tadokta eva doṣa ityāha pakṣīkartumiti //
analyzed: tat api hi paramāṇum pakṣīkṛtya yadi sādhyate tadā uktaḥ eva doṣaḥ iti āha pakṣīkartum iti
translated: For, if that too is established by making the atom the subject, then the same fault is stated with to make a subject.

original: adyāpyasiddhasya paramāṇoḥ pakṣīkartumaśakyatvātkuta eva tatkāyardvayaṇukānumā bhavet /
analyzed: adya api asiddhasya paramāṇoḥ pakṣīkartum aśakya tvāt kutas eva bhavet
translated: Even now, since an atom which is not established can not be made a subject of inference, how much less can the inference of the dyad which is its effect be possible?

analyzed: nanu aṇu parimāṇa tāratamyam kvacid viśrāntam parimāṇa tāratamya tvāt mahat parimāṇa tāratamya vat iti anumānena paramāṇu siddhiḥ bhaviṣyati iti ced na
translated: If it be said that the establishment of the atom will be effected by the inference that the gradation of atomic dimension must rest somewhere, because it is a gradation of dimension, like the gradation of gross dimension, [we reply that] this is not so.

analyzed: vikalpa anupapatteḥ  aṇu parimāṇa śabdena kim parimāṇa apakarṣaḥ abhidhīyate
translated: Because of the impossibility of an alternative.🔽By the word atomic dimension is the diminution of dimension meant?

analyzed: kiṃvā paramāṇu parimāṇam  yat vā dvayaṇuka parimāṇam
translated: Or is the dimension of the atom meant?🔽Or is the dimension of the dyad meant?

analyzed: yadi vā ubhaya parimāṇam
translated: Or is the dimension of both meant?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: The first is not so.

analyzed: dūṣita tvāt
translated: Because it has been refuted.

analyzed: uttara pakṣa trayam dūṣayati pakṣīkartum iti
translated: He refutes the three alternative views, saying can not be made a subject of inference.

analyzed: paramāṇu dvayaṇukayoḥ asiddhau tad parimāṇasya api asiddheḥ
translated: Because, if the atom and the dyad are not established, their dimension also is not established.

analyzed: eka ekatra tāratamyasya abhāvāt ca iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And because there is no gradation in each case. This is the idea.

original: yadidaṃ jālasūryamarīcisthaṃ sarvataḥ sūkṣmatamaṃ raja upalabhyate tattryaṇukamityucyate /
analyzed: yat idam jāla sūrya marīci stham sarvatas sūkṣmatamam rajaḥ upalabhyate tat tryaṇukam iti ucyate
translated: That which is perceived as the subtlest dust everywhere in a net or sunbeam is said to be a triadic.

analyzed: tat idam mahat
translated: This is gross.

analyzed: cākṣuṣa dravya tvāt ghaṭa vat
translated: Because it is a visible substance, like a pot.

original: kāryaṃ ca mahattve sati cākṣuṣatvāt mahatve sati kriyāvatvādvā /
analyzed: kāryam ca mahat tve sati cākṣuṣa tvāt mahatve sati kriyāva tvāt vā
translated: And it is an effect, because it is perceptible when it is large, or because it is an action when it is large.

analyzed: sa avayavam ca kārya dravya tvāt
translated: And it is composed of parts, because it is an effect-substance.

analyzed: tad avayavāḥ ca dvayaṇuka nāmānaḥ
translated: And its parts are called dyads.

analyzed: te pi kāryāḥ sa avayavāḥ ca
translated: They are also effects and composed of parts.

analyzed: mahat dravya ārambhaka tvāt tantu vat
translated: Because they produce large substances, like threads.

original: yaśca tadavayavaḥ sa eva paramāṇuḥ tadavayavakalpanāyāṃ pramāṇābhāvādbādhakasadbhāvācca /
analyzed: yaḥ ca tad avayavaḥ saḥ eva paramāṇuḥ tad avayava kalpanāyām pramāṇa abhāvāt bādhaka sadbhāvāt ca
translated: And that which is a part of it is itself an atom, because there is no evidence for postulating a part of it, and because there is an objection.

analyzed: atas numānena eva paramāṇu dvayaṇuka siddhiḥ iti atas āha pakṣīkartum iti
translated: Therefore, the atom and dyad are established only by inference. Thus he says: to make them the subject.

original: pratyakṣasya tryaṇukasyaiva paramāṇutvasambhavena tatkāryatvasāvayavatvasādhānāya pakṣīkartumaśakyatvātkuta eva dvayaṇukaparamāṇvoranumā bhavet
analyzed: pratyakṣasya tryaṇukasya eva paramāṇu tva sambhavena tad kāryatva sāvayavatva sādhānāya pakṣīkartum aśakya tvāt kutas eva dvayaṇuka paramāṇvoḥ anumā bhavet
translated: Because the triadic atom itself can be an atom, it cannot be made the subject to prove that it is an effect and composed of parts. How much less can the dyad and atom be inferred?

analyzed: mahā tvāt katham asau paramāṇuḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is asked how it is an atom when it is large, no.

analyzed: mahat tva asiddheḥ
translated: Because largeness is not established.

analyzed: cākṣuṣa dravya tvāt tad siddhiḥ iti ced na  kasyacid amahataḥ cākṣuṣa tve bādhaka abhāvāt
translated: If it is said that it is established because it is a visible substance, no.🔽Because there is no objection to something being visible even though it is not large.

analyzed: mahat tvam ca dravya cākṣuṣa tāyām kāraṇam iti ced
translated: If it is said that largeness is the cause of a substance being visible,

analyzed: satyam
translated: it is true.

analyzed: kvacid anyat api kāraṇam kalpayiṣyate
translated: In some cases, another cause will be imagined.

analyzed: gauravam tathā sati syāt iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that there would be heaviness in that case, it is not so.

analyzed: dharmi kalpanātaḥ dharma mātra kalpanāyāḥ laghu tvāt
translated: Because imagining mere properties is lighter than imagining a substance.

analyzed: astu vā mahat tvam
translated: Let there be greatness.

analyzed: tathā api aṇu tvena tasya samāveśe kaḥ virodhaḥ
translated: Even so, what is the contradiction in its inclusion by minuteness?

analyzed: kāryatva sādhanam ca aprayojakam
translated: And the proof of being an effect is not inconclusive.

analyzed: mahataḥ pi ātmanaḥ pratyakṣa vat cākṣuṣa tva upapatteḥ
translated: Because even a great self can be perceived by the eye, it is possible.

analyzed: parama mahat tva abhāvena kriyā sambhavāt ca
translated: And because action is possible due to the absence of supreme greatness.

analyzed: mahat tvasya kāraṇa bahu tvam kāraṇam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the cause of greatness is the plurality of causes, it is not so.

analyzed: nitya tva upapatteḥ
translated: Because eternality is possible.

analyzed: cākṣuṣa mahā tvāt na iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that it is not so because of the greatness perceived by the eye, it is not so.

analyzed: bādhaka abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no contradiction.

original: ata eva kāryadravyatvamasiddham /🔽santu vā tadavayavāsta eva paramāṇava iti teṣāṃ punaravayavasādhanāya pakṣīkartumaśakyatvātkuta evānumā bhavet /
analyzed: atas eva kārya dravya tvam asiddham  santu vā tad avayavāḥ te eva paramāṇavaḥ iti teṣām punar avayava sādhanāya pakṣīkartum aśakya tvāt kutas eva anumā bhavet
translated: For the same reason, being an effect substance is unestablished.🔽Or let those parts themselves be atoms. Since they cannot be made the subject again for proving their parts, how much less can there be an inference?

original: nanu mahaddravyārambhakatvātte 'pi sāvayavā eveti cenna /🔽niravayavasya mahā
analyzed: nanu mahat dravya ārambhaka tvāt te pi sa avayavāḥ eva iti ced na  niravayavasya mahā
translated: If it is argued that they are also with parts because they are the cause of the origin of a great substance, it is not so.

analyzed: hat dravya ārambhaka tve bādhaka abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no contradiction in the origin of a great substance by that which is partless.

analyzed: bahu tvena eva mahat tva ārambha upapatteḥ  dravya ārambhe sa avayava tsya an upayogāt
translated: Because greatness is properly produced only by plurality.🔽Because in the production of a substance, the atoms are not useful as having parts.

analyzed: santu vā dvayaṇuka avayavāḥ te pi kutas paramāṇavaḥ
translated: Or let there be parts of the two atoms. But how are those atoms?

analyzed: mahat dravya ārambhaka tvena teṣām api sāvayava tva anumānāt
translated: Because even they are inferred to have parts by producing a large substance.

analyzed: anavasthā bādhikā iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the regress is a fault, it is not so.

analyzed: tad avayavānām tad avayava avayavānām vā niravayava tvena tad viśrānteḥ
translated: Because the parts of those [atoms] or the parts of the parts of those [atoms] are without parts, and it rests there.

analyzed: katham ca iyam anavasthā dūṣaṇam
translated: And how is this regress a fault?

analyzed: meru sarṣapa ādīnām sama parimāṇa tva āpattiḥ tu dūṣitā
translated: But the fault is the consequence of the equality of size of Meru and mustard seeds.

analyzed: ghaṭa ādi kārya anutpattiḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the non-production of effects like pots is the fault, it is not so.

analyzed: sāvayavasya eva nitya tva upapatteḥ
translated: Because the eternality of what has parts is logically possible.

analyzed: yathā uktam
translated: As it is said:

analyzed: a vibhāgaḥ paraṇu
translated: The indivisible is the atom.

analyzed: rama aṇu tā iti
translated: The atom is the ultimate particle.

original: evaṃ paramāṇudvayaṇukayoranumānataḥ siddhimapākṛtya prasaṅgādākāśādiparimāṇotkarṣānantyasyānumānikatvaṃ na yujyata iti yaduktaṃ tatprapañcayati 🔽deśāntareti //
analyzed: evam paramāṇu dvayaṇukayoḥ anumānataḥ siddhim apākṛtya prasaṅgāt ākāśa ādi parimāṇa utkarṣa ānantyasya ānumānika tvam na yujyate iti yat uktam tat prapañcayati  deśa antara iti
translated: Thus, having refuted the establishment of atoms and dyads by inference, he elaborates on what was said incidentally that the infinity of the highest measure of space etc. is not logically possible as an inference, with the words in another place etc.

analyzed: deśa antara ādi śabdaḥ ca śaśa śṛṅga ādi śabda vat
translated: And the words in another place etc. are like the word hare's horn etc.

analyzed: yaḥ yam yojana ādi paricchinnaḥ deśaḥ sampratipannaḥ
translated: This space which is delimited by yojanas etc. and is generally accepted,

original: sa svataḥ sthūlena deśāntareṇa yukto deśatvāddhastādideśavadityādyanumānaiḥ khalvākāśādiparimāṇotkarṣānantyaṃ sādhanīyam /
analyzed: sa svatas sthūlena deśa antareṇa yuktaḥ deśa tvāt hasta ādi deśa vat ityādi anumānaiḥ khalu ākāśa ādi parimāṇa utkarṣa ānantyam sādhanīyam
translated: is to be proved by such inferences as it is naturally endowed with a gross space beyond, because it is space, like the space of the hand etc., that the magnitude of space etc. is infinite.

analyzed: te ete deśa antara ādi śabdāḥ
translated: These words beyond space etc.

analyzed: deśa antara ādi sādhaka anumāna prayogāḥ
translated: are the inferences proving the existence of beyond space etc.

analyzed: śaśa śṛṅga ādi śabda vat śaśa śṛṅga ādi sādhaka anumāna prayogaiḥ tulyam vartante
translated: They are similar to the inferences proving the existence of the horn of a hare etc., like the words horn of a hare etc.🔽The meaning is that in this very way, even the horn of a hare etc. can be inferred.

original: anenaiva prakāreṇa śaśaśṛṅgādikamapyanumātuṃ śakyata iti yāvat /🔽śabdamātramevaitat /
analyzed: anena eva prakāreṇa śaśa śṛṅga ādikam api anumātum śakyate iti yāvat  śabda mātram eva etat
translated: This is mere word.

analyzed: na tu anumānam iti sūcayitum śabdāḥ iti uktam
translated: It is said that the word words is used to indicate that it is not an inference.

analyzed: na kevalam ākāśa ādīnām parimāṇa utkarṣa ānantya anumānam pratipakṣa parāhatam
translated: Not only is the inference of the infinity of the magnitude of space etc. refuted by counter-arguments,

analyzed: api tu sampratipannāni sarva śṛṅga viśṛṅga antaravanti śṛṅga tvāt go śṛṅga vat
translated: but also the generally accepted horns are endowed with another horn beyond, because they are horns, like the horn of a cow.

original: vimatāḥ sarve putrāḥ putrāntaropetāḥ putratvāddevadattaputravaditi śaśaśṛṅgādisādhakānumānābhāsasamānayogakṣemaṃ cetyarthaḥ /
analyzed: vimatāḥ sarve putrāḥ putra antara upetāḥ putra tvāt devadatta putra vat iti śaśa śṛṅga ādi sādhaka anumāna ābhāsa samāna yogakṣemam ca iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the inferred sons are similar to the fallacious inferences proving the existence of the horn of a hare etc., like all the inferred sons are endowed with another son, because they are sons, like Devadatta's son.

analyzed: na vayam evam ākāśa ādi parimāṇa utkarṣa ānantyam anumimīmahe
translated: We do not infer the infinity of the excellence of the magnitude of space etc.

analyzed: yena atiprasaṅgaḥ syāt
translated: By which there would be an overextension.

original: kintu vipratipanno deśaḥ svataḥ sthūlena sadṛśena sajātīyena vā dravyāntareṇa yukto deśatvāddhastādideśavat /
analyzed: kintu vipratipannaḥ deśaḥ svatas sthūlena sadṛśena sajātīyena vā dravya antareṇa yuktaḥ deśa tvāt hasta ādi deśa vat
translated: But the disputed space is endowed with something large from itself, or with another substance of the same kind, because it is space, like the space of the hand etc.

analyzed: saḥ pi evam saḥ pi evam
translated: That is also so, that is also so.

analyzed: evam kāle pi anumātavyam
translated: In the same way, time should also be inferred.

analyzed: na ca evam śaśa śṛṅga anumānam śakyam
translated: And in this way, the inference of the horn of a rabbit is not possible.

analyzed: tasya atyanta asataḥ n upalabhyamānasya gavādi śṛṅgeḥ sādṛśya sājātyayoḥ abhāvāt
translated: Because that is absolutely non-existent, not perceived, and does not have similarity or belonging to the same class as the horn of a cow etc.

analyzed: na ca ākāśa ādeḥ api ekaika tvāt sādṛśya ādi abhāvaḥ
translated: And it is not that space etc. also do not have similarity because they are each one.

analyzed: aupādhika bhedena tad upapatteḥ iti atas āha sadṛśam ca iti
translated: Because that is possible by the difference due to adventitious properties. Therefore he says And the similar and belonging to the same class etc.

original: sadṛśaṃ ca sajātīyaṃ nāsmatpakṣe kimeva hi // / / //
analyzed: sadṛśam ca sajātīyam na asmad pakṣe kim eva hi
translated: And the similar and belonging to the same class are not in our view at all.

analyzed: sampratipanna deśa ādinā sadṛśam sajātīyam ca
translated: The similar and belonging to the same class as the agreed upon space etc.

analyzed: vā asmad pakṣe gagana ādi parimāṇa utkarṣa ānantyam an abhyupagacchatām pakṣe kim eva na bhavati
translated: are not in our view, in the view of those who do not accept the infinity of the excellence of the magnitude of space etc. What is it that does not exist?

analyzed: kintu bhavati eva iti
translated: But it does exist.

original: tathāca sampratipannadeśasya tataḥ sthūlenātmanā sadṛśena sajātīyena vopetatvasya siddhatvātsiddhasādhanatā syāt /
analyzed: tathā ca sampratipanna deśasya tatas sthūlena ātmanā sadṛśena sajātīyena vā upeta tvasya siddha tvāt siddha sādhana tā syāt
translated: And thus, because it is established that the place in question is endowed with a gross self similar to it or with a homogeneous [self], there would be the fault of proving what is already established.

analyzed: ākāśa ādi parimāṇa utkarṣa ānantya asiddheḥ artha antara tā ca iti
translated: And because the infinity of the excellence of the dimension of space etc. is not established, [the reason] is extraneous.

analyzed: sampratipanna deśasya īśvara ādimattvam bādhitam sambandha abhāvāt iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the existence of God etc. in the place in question is contradicted because of the absence of relation, it is not so.

analyzed: deśa antareṇa api sambandha abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no relation even with a different place.

analyzed: etena śaśaviṣāṇa ādi sādhaka anumāne bādhā abhidhānam parāstam
translated: By this, the statement of contradiction in the inference proving the horn of a rabbit etc. is also refuted.

analyzed: deśa antara anumāne pi sāmyāt
translated: Because it is similar even in the inference of a different place.

analyzed: tat evam paramāṇu dvayaṇukayoḥ ākāśa ādi parimāṇa utkarṣa antyasya ca sākṣi siddhatām an aṅgīkṛtya kevala anumāna vedya tva svīkaraṇam anupapannam iti uktam
translated: Thus, it has been said that it is unreasonable to accept that the atoms and dyads, and the infinity of the excellence of the dimension of space etc., are known only through inference, without accepting their establishment by the witness [consciousness].

analyzed: evam āgamam an ādṛtya īśvara dharma ādi anumānam api ayuktam iti prasaṅgāt āha yena eva iti
translated: In the same way, it is also argued that the inference of God, Dharma etc. is improper without considering the scriptures. It is said incidentally:

analyzed: yena eva ca prakāreṇa ati asiddham anumīyate
translated: By the very same method by which the extremely unestablished is inferred,

analyzed: tena eva śaśaśṛṅga ādeḥ śakyam astitva kalpanam
translated: by that very method, the existence of the horn of a rabbit can be imagined.

analyzed: ati asiddham iti anena āgama anādaram darśayati
translated: By the words 'too much unestablished' he shows his disregard for the scriptures.

analyzed: śaśaśṛṅga ādeḥ iti aprāmāṇikasya upalakṣaṇam
translated: 'The horn of a hare' etc. is a synecdoche for what is not authoritative.

analyzed: etat ca tatra tatra leśataḥ darśitam
translated: And this has been shown in detail here and there.

analyzed: na ca śaśa śṛṅga ādi anumāna pratibandī grasta tva mātreṇa eteṣām anumānānām aprāmāṇyam yuktam
translated: And it is not proper to make these inferences invalid merely by being caught in the counter-argument of the inference of the horn of a hare etc.

analyzed: tathā sati dhūma anumānasya api aprāmāṇya prasaṅgāt
translated: Because, if that were so, it would follow that the inference of smoke is also invalid.

original: tatrāpi hi śakyate vaktuṃ yadi dhūmavattvātpavarto 'gnimāṃstadā paśutvācchaśo 'pi viṣāṇavānyasyāditi /
analyzed: tatra api hi śakyate vaktum yadi dhūmavat tvāt pavartaḥ gnimān tadā paśu tvāt śaśaḥ pi viṣāṇavān yasyāt iti
translated: For there also it can be said: 'If a hill is fiery because it has smoke, then a hare would also have horns because it is an animal.'

analyzed: atha ucyeta
translated: If it is said:

analyzed: tulya yogakṣema tve hi pratibandī grahaḥ
translated: The counter-argument is when there is equality of fitness.

analyzed: anyathā atiprasaṅgāt
translated: Otherwise, there would be an overextension.

analyzed: na ca atra tulya yogakṣema tā dhūma anumānasya vyāpti ādi sāmarthya sahita tvāt
translated: And here there is no equality of fitness, because the inference of smoke is accompanied by the capacity of pervasion etc.

analyzed: śaśa śṛṅga ādi anumānasya tad abhāvāt iti
translated: Because the inference of the horn of a hare etc. lacks that.

analyzed: samam etat prakṛte pi
translated: This is equally applicable in the present case also.

analyzed: prastuta anumānānām api vyāpti ādimat tvāt iti atas āha pratyakṣam iti
translated: Because the inferences under discussion also have pervasion etc. To this he says 'perception' etc.

analyzed: pratyakṣam āgamaḥ vā api bhavet yatra niyāmakaḥ
translated: Where perception or scripture is the determiner,

analyzed: sā eva vyāptiḥ bhavet mānam na anyā sandigdha mūlataḥ
translated: That alone would be the valid cognition, not another, because of the doubtful basis.

analyzed: vā śabdaḥ samuccaye
translated: The word 'vā' (or) is for inclusion.

analyzed: apiḥ anumānasya samuccaya arthaḥ
translated: The word 'api' (also) is for the inclusion of inference.

analyzed: niyāmakaḥ grāhakaḥ
translated: The determiner is the apprehender.
The valid cognition is that which is useful for the validity of inference.

analyzed: anyā pratyakṣa ādya gṛhītā  sandigdha mūlataḥ  vyabhicāra tvataḥ
translated: Another is not grasped by perception etc.🔽Because of the doubtful basis, because of the doubtful pervasion.

analyzed: avyabhicāraḥ hi sāhityasya vyāpti tve mūlam
translated: For non-deviation is the basis for the pervasion of concomitance.

analyzed: tatra pratyakṣa gṛhītā vyāptiḥ yathā dhūmasya agninā
translated: There, the pervasion grasped by perception is like that of smoke with fire.

analyzed: āgama gṛhītā yathā
translated: That grasped by scripture is like

analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ na hantavyaḥ iti  anumāna gṛhītāḥ yathā
translated: A Brahmin should not be killed.🔽That grasped by inference is like

analyzed: vyatireki prayoge
translated: in the case of a negative example.

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said.

analyzed: pratyakṣa ādi avadhṛtam hi vyāpti ādi anumāna māna ānata aṅgam
translated: For, that which is ascertained by perception etc. as pervasion etc. is a part of the valid cognition of inference.

analyzed: na svayam mātra siddham  sandigdhagdhā
translated: Not that which is established by itself alone.

analyzed: vyabhicāra ri tvāt
translated: Because of the doubtful pervasion.

analyzed: samayānām sandigdha mūla tvāt ca
translated: And because of the doubtful basis of conventions.

original: vidyate ca dhūmādyanumānānāṃ pramāṇāvadhṛtaṃ vyāptyādīti na pratibandīgrahamātreṇa tadbhaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: vidyate ca dhūma ādi anumānānām pramāṇa avadhṛtam vyāpti ādi iti na pratibandī graha mātreṇa tad bhaṅgaḥ
translated: And since the pervasion etc. of inferences like smoke are ascertained by valid cognition, their refutation is not by mere counter-questioning.

analyzed: na paramāṇu ādi anumānānām iti pratibandī grasta tvāt aprāmāṇyam eva
translated: The inference of atoms, etc. is not valid, because it is refuted by the counter-argument. Therefore, it is not valid.
If there is no pervasion, etc., what is the use of a counter-argument?

analyzed: tatas eva aprāmāṇya siddheḥ iti
translated: Because the invalidity is established by that itself.

analyzed: satyam
translated: True.

original: pratyakṣādyanavadhṛtavyāptyāderapi prāmāṇye 'tiprasaṅgo vā tadaprāmāṇye dṛṣṭānto vā pratibandīgraheṇa dyotyata ityadoṣa iti / /
analyzed: pratyakṣa ādi anavadhṛta vyāpti ādeḥ api prāmāṇye tiprasaṅgaḥ vā tad aprāmāṇye dṛṣṭāntaḥ vā pratibandī graheṇa dyotyate iti adoṣaḥ iti
translated: If the pervasion, etc. not ascertained by perception, etc. is also valid, there is the fallacy of over-extension, or if it is not valid, the example is shown by the counter-argument. Therefore, there is no fault.

analyzed: satyam etat pratyakṣa ādi avadhṛtā eva vyāptiḥ anumāna prāmāṇya upayoginī iti
translated: This is true. Only the pervasion ascertained by perception, etc. is useful for the validity of inference.

analyzed: sā ca dhūma anumāvat paramāṇu ādi anumāneṣu api asti eva
translated: And that exists in the inferences of atoms, etc. just as in the inference of smoke.

original: dhūmasyāgnineva mahadārambhakatvādīnāmapi sāvayavatvādinā sāhityadarśanādityata āha saheti //
analyzed: dhūmasya agninā iva mahat ārambhaka tva ādīnām api sāvayava tva ādinā sāhitya darśanāt iti atas āha saha iti
translated: Because the association of being a cause of large effects, etc. is seen with having parts, etc. just as smoke is with fire. Therefore, he says together (in the verse).

analyzed: saha darśana mātreṇa na vyāptiḥ avasīyate
translated: The pervasion is not ascertained merely by seeing together.

analyzed: na dhūma ādi īm api agni ādibhiḥ saha darśana mātreṇa vyāptiḥ avasīyate
translated: The pervasion is not ascertained merely by seeing together even in the case of smoke, etc. with fire, etc.

analyzed: yena mahat ārambhaka tva ādīnām api sāvayava tva ādibhiḥ tatas vasīyeta
translated: By which the pervasion of being a cause of large effects, etc. would be ascertained by having parts, etc.

analyzed: tathā sati agni ādīnām dhūma ādibhiḥ api vyāpti adhyavasāya prasaṅgāt
translated: Similarly, there would be the consequence of the ascertainment of pervasion even by smoke etc. with regard to fire etc.,

analyzed: saha darśana mātrasya tatra api sattvāt
translated: because mere simultaneous observation exists there also.

analyzed: vyabhicāra anupalambhe sati sāhitya darśanam vyāpti adhyavasāya hetuḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that the observation of concomitance is the cause of the ascertainment of pervasion when there is no observation of deviation,

analyzed: kim sakala deśa kāla niṣṭhaḥ nu upalambhaḥ
translated: is the non-observation restricted to all places and times?

analyzed: kim vā tad viśeṣa niṣṭhaḥ
translated: Or is it restricted to a particular case?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first,

analyzed: asmat ādi aśakya tvāt
translated: because it is impossible for us and others.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: Not the second,

analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt iti
translated: because of the great absurdity.

original: kathaṃ tarhi vyāptyadhyavasāyaḥ syādityata āha yadaiveti //🔽yadaivāvyatirekasya hyakṣajaṃ vāgamo bhavet /
analyzed: katham tarhi vyāpti adhyavasāyaḥ syāt iti atas āha yadā eva iti  yadā eva avyatirekasya hi akṣa jam vā āgamaḥ bhavet
translated: How then could there be the ascertainment of pervasion? To this he says:🔽When there is only non-deviation, if there is verbal testimony arising from the senses,

analyzed: tad nirdhārita yuktiḥ vā vyāptiḥ sā eva aparā nahi
translated: or if there is reasoning determined by that, that alone is pervasion, not another.

original: avyatireke sādhyābhimatavyatirekeṇāsattve /🔽asya sādhanābhimatasya dharmasya yuktervyāptiniścayahetutve 'navasthā syānāt /
analyzed: avyatireke sādhya abhimata vyatirekeṇa asattve  asya sādhana abhimatasya dharmasya yukteḥ vyāpti niścaya hetu tve
translated: In non-deviation, i.e., in the absence of the property to be proved apart from it,

analyzed: tad vayāpteḥ api yukti antareṇa niścetavya tvāt iti atas uktam
translated: if this property which is intended to be the reason has reasoning as the cause of the ascertainment of pervasion, there would be an infinite regress, because the ascertainment of its pervasion would also have to be done by another reasoning. To this he says:

analyzed: tad nirdhāritā iti
translated: Determined by that, etc.

analyzed: vyāpti śabdaḥ dhyā āhāryaḥ
translated: The word 'pervasion' is to be supplied.

analyzed: tena pratyakṣeṇa āgamena vā nirdhārita vyāptikā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the pervasion is ascertained by that perception or scripture.

analyzed: aparā sāhitya darśana mātra nibandhanā na hi
translated: It is not another [type of pervasion] that is merely based on the observation of concomitance.

analyzed: ayam arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

analyzed: niyataḥ sambandhaḥ hi vyāptiḥ na sambandha mātram
translated: For pervasion is a definite relation, not just any relation.

analyzed: niyamaḥ ca vyabhicāra abhāvaḥ
translated: And definiteness is the absence of contradiction.

original: ataḥ sāhitya iva vyabhicārābhāve 'pi pramāṇapravṛttau vyāptisiddhiḥ /
analyzed: atas sāhitye iva vyabhicāra abhāve pi pramāṇa pravṛttau vyāpti siddhiḥ
translated: Therefore, just as in concomitance, the establishment of pervasion occurs when there is the operation of a means of knowledge in the absence of contradiction.

analyzed: na ca etat aśakyam
translated: And this is not impossible.

analyzed: anumiti anudaye sarva vyavahāra vilopa prasaṅgena kārya darśanāt eva tad siddheḥ
translated: Because it is established by the observation of effect itself, since the consequence of the non-occurrence of inference would be the cessation of all practical affairs.

analyzed: prakāraḥ tu cintyate
translated: But the mode [of operation] is to be considered.

analyzed: tatra dhūmasya agninā sambandhaḥ tāvat pratyakṣeṇa avagamyate
translated: There, the relation of smoke with fire is first understood by perception.

analyzed: paricita deśa kālayoḥ vyabhicāraḥ ca na avagamyate
translated: And contradiction in well-known places and times is not understood.

analyzed: deśa antara ādi gate tu vyabhicāre sandehaḥ
translated: But regarding contradiction in other places, etc., doubt remains.

analyzed: sa ca na tāvat vayabhicāra cihna darśana janyaḥ
translated: And that is not produced by the observation of the marks of contradiction.

original: kintu bhūyaḥsahacaritatayā dṛṣṭā adṛṣṭavyabhicārā api dharmā vyabhicāriṇo dṛṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: kintu bhūyas sahacarita tayā dṛṣṭāḥ adṛṣṭa vyabhicārāḥ api dharmāḥ vyabhicāriṇaḥ dṛṣṭāḥ
translated: But [it is produced] by the observation of properties that are seen to be concomitant with many [instances of the reason], but are seen to be contradictory even though no contradiction has been seen.

analyzed: dharmaḥ ca ayam iti evam utpadyate
translated: And this property is like that. Thus it arises.

analyzed: tatra yadi ayam etad sahavṛtti svabhāvaḥ tadā anyatra api saha eva varteta
translated: If it has the nature of co-existence with this, then it would exist together with that also,

original: svabhāvasyānapāyāt /🔽yadi cāsahavṛttisvabhāvastadātrāpi na saha varteta /🔽asahavṛttisvabhāvasyāpi sahavṛttirnimittāntarāyattā cedatropalabhyeta /
analyzed: svabhāvasya anapāyāt  yadi ca asahavṛtti svabhāvaḥ tadā atra api na saha varteta  asahavṛtti svabhāvasya api sahavṛttiḥ nimitta antara āyattā ced atra upalabhyeta
translated: because its nature cannot be lost.🔽And if it has the nature of non-co-existence, then it would not exist together with this also.🔽If the co-existence of even that which has the nature of non-co-existence is dependent on other causes, then it would be perceived here.

original: sahavṛttisvabhāvasyāpi nimittāntarādvayabhicāro bhaviṣyatīti tu nirbījā śaṅkāṃ nodetyeva /
analyzed: saha vṛtti svabhāvasya api nimitta antarāt vayabhicāraḥ bhaviṣyati iti tu nirbījā śaṅkām nā udeti eva
translated: But the groundless doubt that even that which has the nature of co-existence will deviate due to other causes never arises at all.

analyzed: sarva vyavahāra abhāva prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would lead to the absurdity of the absence of all conventions.

original: tadevaṃ mīmāṃsāsahakṛtaṃ pratyakṣaṃ dhūmasyāgnisambandhaṃ gṛhṇadvayabhicārābhāvamapyākalayatīti vyāptimavadhārayatyeva /
analyzed: tat evam mīmāṃsā sahakṛtam pratyakṣam dhūmasya agni sambandham gṛhṇat vayabhicāra abhāvam api ākalayati iti vyāptim avadhārayati eva
translated: Thus, perception, along with reflection, apprehending the relation of smoke with fire, ascertains the absence of deviation as well, and thus determines the pervasion.

analyzed: anumāna āgamābhyām tu vyāpti graha prakāraḥ sugama
translated: The way of grasping pervasion by inference and verbal testimony is easy to understand.

original: graha eveti / /🔽nanvanenaiva nyāyena mahadārambhakatvādīnāmapi vyāptiniścayasambhavātkathaṃ paramāṇvādāvanumānāpravṛttiriti cenna /
analyzed: grahaḥ eva iti  nanu anena eva nyāyena mahat ārambhaka tva ādīnām api vyāpti niścaya sambhavāt katham paramāṇu ādau anumāna apravṛttiḥ iti ced na
translated: Grasping itself is easy.🔽If it is argued that inference does not operate regarding atoms etc. because the certainty of pervasion of being the cause of gross substances etc. is possible by the same reasoning, it is not so.

analyzed: pakṣa itara tvasya upādhi tva sambhavena vyabhicāra abhāva aniścayāt
translated: Because the absence of deviation is not ascertained due to the possibility of the otherness of the subject being a limiting condition.

analyzed: atha tasya upādhi tvam na asti iti ucyeta bādhakam āha
translated: Now, if it is said that it is not a limiting adjunct, then he states the refutation:

analyzed: anyathā iti
translated: Otherwise, etc.

analyzed: anyathā
translated: Otherwise, the existence of the seventh taste would also be established by inference.

analyzed: aniṣṭāni ca sarvāṇi hi anumā kāma cāriṇī
translated: And all undesirable things would follow, for inference acts as it pleases.

analyzed: pakṣa itaratvasya upādhi tām an ādṛtya pramāṇa antara asahakṛtena eva anumānena paramāṇu ādi siddhayabhyupagamaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that, disregarding the status of being other than the subject as a limiting adjunct, it is accepted that the existence of atoms and so on is established by inference itself, without the cooperation of another means of knowledge.

analyzed: madhuraḥ rasaḥ lavaṇa ādi rasa pañcaka vyatirikta rasa anyonya abhāvavān rasa tvāt lavaṇāt ityādi anumayā
translated: By the inference: The sweet taste is qualified by the mutual absence of tastes other than the five tastes such as salt, because it is a taste, like salt and so on.

analyzed: aniṣyāni ca sarvāṇi dahana śaitya ādīni āpateyuḥ
translated: And all undesirable things such as the coldness of fire would follow.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: yasmāt evaṃvidhā anumā kāma cāriṇī
translated: Because inference acts as it pleases in this way.

analyzed: nanu ca saptama rasa ādeḥ anupalambha ādi bādhita tvāt pakṣa itaratva upādhi duṣṭatvam anumānānām iti ced samam prakṛte pi
translated: If it is argued that the inferences regarding the seventh taste and so on are faulty due to the limiting adjunct of being other than the subject, because they are contradicted by non-apprehension and so on, the same applies to the present case as well.

analyzed: paramāṇu ādeḥ api anupalambha bādhita tvāt
translated: Because atoms and so on are also contradicted by non-apprehension.

analyzed: ayogyam tat iti ced  tulyam saptama rasa ādau api
translated: If it is argued that they are not suitable,🔽it is the same for the seventh taste and so on as well.

analyzed: anumāna prāmāṇye saptama rasa ādi siddhau ayogya tvam kalpyam
translated: If inference is valid, the existence of the seventh taste and so on must be assumed to be unsuitable.

analyzed: kalpite ca tasmin anumāna prāmāṇya siddhiḥ iti anyonya āśraya tvam iti ced
translated: If it be said that when that is imagined, the validity of inference is established, and so there is mutual dependence,

analyzed: etat api tādṛś eva
translated: this also is the same.

analyzed: anupabhogyasya saptama rasa ādeḥ kalpane gauravam iti ced
translated: If it be said that there is the fault of complexity in imagining a seventh taste, etc., which is not experienced,

analyzed: samādhi sāmyam
translated: the answer is the same.

original: pramite na gauravaṃ doṣa ityetadapi samānam /
analyzed: pramite na gauravam doṣaḥ iti etat api samānam
translated: The same applies to the statement that complexity is not a fault when it is known.

original: tasmātparamāṇvādeḥ sākṣivedyatvamaṅgīkṛtya pratibandī mocanīyeti kathaṃ na tasya sākṣivedyatvamiti / /🔽samavāyābhyupagamāc ca sāmyād anavasthiteḥ / / / /
analyzed: tasmāt paramāṇu ādeḥ sākṣi vedya tvam aṅgīkṛtya pratibandī mocanīyā iti katham na tasya sākṣi vedya tvam iti  samavāya abhyupagamāt ca sāmyāt anavasthiteḥ
translated: Therefore, accepting that atoms, etc. are known by the witness, the objection should be removed. How then is it not known by the witness?🔽And because of the acceptance of inherence, there is an infinite regress due to similarity.

analyzed: om samavāya abhyupagamāt ca sāmyāt anavasthiteḥ om
translated: Om. And because of the acceptance of inherence, there is an infinite regress due to similarity. Om.

analyzed: om ubhayathā api na karma atas tad abhāvaḥ om
translated: Om. In both ways, there is no action. Therefore, its non-existence. Om.

analyzed: iti sūtram
translated: This is the aphorism.

analyzed: tat nityam eva ca bhāvāt
translated: And because it exists eternally.

original: ityāgāmisūtravyākhyānenaiva vyākhyātaṃ bhaviṣyatīti manvānastadapahāya hetvantareṇa vaiśeṣikādisamayamapākurvant
analyzed: iti āgāmi sūtra vyākhyānena eva vyākhyātam bhaviṣyati iti manvānaḥ tat apahāya hetu antareṇa vaiśeṣika ādi samayam apākurvan
translated: Thinking that this will be explained by the explanation of the future aphorism itself, rejecting that, and refuting the doctrines of the Vaiśeṣikas and others with another reason,

analyzed: samavāya abhyupagamāt ca sāmyāt anavasthiteḥ
translated: he explains this aphorism: And because of the acceptance of inherence, there is an infinite regress due to similarity.

analyzed: iti etat sūtram vyācaṣṭe kāryā iti
translated: He explains it with The effect is not produced from the inherence of the cause.

analyzed: kārya kāraṇayoḥ ca eva
translated: And of cause and effect,🔽.🔽

analyzed: samavāyaḥ īryate iti vakṣyamāṇam atra api sambaddhayate
translated: ... the inherence is declared. What is to be said later is connected here also.

original: anena samavāyapratipādakaṃ pareṣāṃiheti yataḥ kāryakāraṇayoḥ sa samavāyaḥ' /🔽iti sūtramarthato 'nuvadati /
analyzed: anena samavāya pratipādakam pareṣām iha iti yatas kārya kāraṇayoḥ sa samavāyaḥ  iti sūtram arthataḥ nuvadati
translated: By this, he repeats the meaning of the aphorism of others which teaches inherence: From this, that inherence of the effect and cause is...

analyzed: atra kārya kāraṇa śabda avayava avayavi vācakau  tau ca upalakṣaṇa parau iti sūcana arthaḥ caśabdaḥ
translated: Here, the words effect and cause denote the part and the whole.🔽And the word ca (and) is to indicate that they are for the purpose of illustration.

analyzed: eva śabdaḥ samavāyasya iha pratyasiddha tvam sūcayati
translated: The word eva (only) indicates that inherence is well-known in this (world).

analyzed: tat etat svayam eva vivṛṇoti guṇa ādeḥ iti
translated: He himself explains this with of quality etc.

analyzed: guṇa ādeḥ pañcakasya ca
translated: Of quality etc. and of the five,

original: bhinnasyaiva tu sambandhaḥ samavāyo 'nya īryate // / /d //🔽guṇādeḥ pañcakasyeti guṇāvayavikriyāsāmānyaviśeṣaṇāmityarthaḥ /
analyzed: bhinnasya eva tu sambandhaḥ samavāyaḥ nyaḥ īryate  guṇa ādeḥ pañcakasya iti guṇa avayavi kriyā sāmānya viśeṣaṇām iti arthaḥ
translated: But the relation of only the different is declared to be inherence, another.🔽Of quality etc. and of the five means of quality, part, action, universal, and particular.

analyzed: caśabdena guṇi ādi pañcakasya ca iti samuccinoti
translated: The word ca (and) includes the five, such as the possessor of quality etc.

original: nanu guṇaguṇyādikamabhinnaṃ bhinnābhinnaṃ vā tatkiṃ samavāyenetyata uktam bhinnasyaiveti //
analyzed: nanu guṇa guṇi ādikam abhinnam bhinna abhinnam vā tat kim samavāyena iti atas uktam bhinnasya eva iti
translated: But is quality, substance etc. non-different, or different and non-different? Then why is it by inherence? Therefore it is said: of only the different.

analyzed: tuśabdaḥ viśeṣa arthaḥ
translated: The word tu (but) is for the purpose of distinguishing.

analyzed: na yayoḥ kayoḥ cit guṇa guṇinoḥ samavāyaḥ kintu ayuta siddhayoḥ eva iti
translated: The inherence is not of any two things, one of which is the quality and the other the substance, but of two things that are not produced together.

original: sa guṇaguṇyādisvabhāva eva cenna padārthāntarasiddhirityata uktam anya iti //
analyzed: sa guṇa guṇi ādi svabhāvaḥ eva ced na padārtha antara siddhiḥ iti atas uktam anye iti
translated: And if this is the very nature of the quality and the substance, etc., then there is no establishment of a separate category. Therefore it is said: other.

analyzed: īryate vaiśeṣika ādibhiḥ
translated: It is asserted by the Vaiśeṣika and others.

analyzed: tad darśanam ayuktam iti śeṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, this view is also unreasonable, the rest is implied.

analyzed: ayam arthaḥ  vaiśeṣika ādayaḥ vayava avayavinoḥ guṇa guṇinoḥ kriyā akriyāvatoḥ jāti vyaktayoḥ viśeṣa nitya dravyayoḥ atyanta bhedam abhyupagamya atyanta bhinnam eva samavāya ākhyam
translated: This is the meaning.

analyzed: sambandham abhyupagacchanti
translated: The Vaiśeṣika and others accept the absolute difference between the parts and the whole, the quality and the substance, the action and the object of action, the individual and the universal, the particular and the eternal substance, and accept the absolutely different relation called inherence.

analyzed: tatas pi anupapanna bhāṣiṇaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, they are also speakers of what is not logically possible.

analyzed: nanu ca guṇa guṇi ādīnām atyanta bhedaḥ tāvat vayapadeśa bheda ādi pramāṇa siddhaḥ
translated: But the absolute difference between the quality and the substance, etc. is established by means of valid means of knowledge such as the difference in designation.

analyzed: anyathā stambha kumbha ādīnām api atyanta bhedaḥ na syāt
translated: Otherwise, even the absolute difference between the pillar, the pot, etc. would not exist.

analyzed: asti ca iha tantuṣu paṭaḥ
translated: And here, the cloth is in the threads.

original: iha paṭe rūpamiha mūrte karmeha gavi gotvamiha nityadravye viśeṣa ityabādhitaḥ pratyayaḥ /
analyzed: iha paṭe rūpam iha mūrte karma iha gavi go tvam iha nitya dravye viśeṣaḥ iti abādhitaḥ pratyayaḥ
translated: Here, the form is in the cloth, the action is in the body, the cowness is in the cow, and the particular is in the eternal substance. This cognition is unobstructed.

analyzed: na ca iha idam iti pratyayaḥ vinā atiriktena sambandhena upapadyate
translated: And here the cognition of this does not occur without an additional relation.

analyzed: iha kuṇḍe badarāṇi iti pratyayasya saṃyoga pūrvaka tva darśanāt
translated: Because it is seen that the cognition jujubes in this pot is preceded by conjunction.

analyzed: sa ca ayam ayuta siddhayoḥ sambandhaḥ iti saṃyogāt bhidyate
translated: And this relation of the non-simultaneously originated is different from conjunction.

analyzed: yuta siddhayoḥ hi sambandhaḥ saṃyogaḥ
translated: For conjunction is the relation of the simultaneously originated.

analyzed: dravya mātra vṛttiḥ ca
translated: And it occurs only in substances.

original: tadevaṃ pramitasya samavāyasyābhyupagame kathamayuktavāditvaṃ vaiśeṣikādīnāmityata āha bhinnatveti //🔽bhinnatvasāmyatastasya tābhyāṃ yogo bhaved dhruvam // / / //
analyzed: tat evam pramitasya samavāyasya abhyupagame katham ayukta vādi tvam vaiśeṣika ādīnām iti atas āha bhinna tva iti  bhinna tva sāmyataḥ tasya tābhyām yogaḥ bhavet dhruvam
translated: Thus, when the existence of inherence, which is well-known, is accepted, how can the Vaiśeṣikas and others be called propounders of unreasonable doctrines? To this he says:🔽Due to the similarity of difference, its connection with those two would certainly be...

analyzed: bhinna tva sāmyataḥ iti upalakṣaṇam
translated: Due to the similarity of difference is an illustration.

analyzed: ihapratyaya sāmyataḥ ca iti api draṣṭavyam
translated: Due to the similarity of the cognition of this should also be seen.

analyzed: tasya samavāyasya
translated: Its means of inherence.

analyzed: tābhyām avayava avayavi ādi sambandhibhyām saha
translated: With those two means with the relata such as the parts and the whole, etc.

analyzed: yogaḥ sambandhaḥ
translated: Connection means relation.

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said:

original: iha tantuṣu paṭa ityādipratyayaḥ sambandhapūrvako 'bādhitehapratyayatvādiha kuṇḍe
analyzed: iha tantuṣu paṭaḥ ityādi pratyayaḥ sambandha pūrvakaḥ bādhita iha pratyaya tvāt iha kuṇḍe
translated: The cognition the cloth is in these threads, etc., is preceded by a relation, because the unobstructed cognition of this is like the cognition jujubes in this pot, etc.

original: badarāṇīti pratyayavaditi samavāyamanumimānena yo 'bādhitehapratyayaḥ sa sambandhapūrvaka🔽iti vyāptiravaśyamaṅgīkaraṇīyā /
analyzed: badarāṇi iti pratyaya vat iti samavāyam anumimānena yaḥ bādhita iha pratyayaḥ sa sambandha pūrvaka  iti vyāptiḥ avaśyam aṅgīkaraṇīyā
translated: One who infers the inherence of the relation of inherence, must necessarily accept the pervasion That which is the cognition of inherence is preceded by a relation.

analyzed: vidyate ca iha tantu paṭayoḥ samavāyaḥ iti abādhita iha pratyayaḥ
translated: And here, in the case of the relation of inherence between the yarn and the cloth, there is the cognition of inherence which is not contradicted.

original: tena samavāyasyāpi tantupaṭābhyāṃ samavāyo 'bhyupagantavya eva syāt /
analyzed: tena samavāyasya api tantu paṭābhyām samavāyaḥ abhyupagantavyaḥ eva syāt
translated: Therefore, even the inherence of the relation of inherence in the yarn and the cloth would have to be accepted.

analyzed: na ca abhyupagamyate
translated: But it is not accepted.

analyzed: atas tatra anaikāntikam anumānam iti
translated: Therefore, the inference there is inconclusive.

original: nanu tantupaṭayoḥ samavāyaḥ siddho na vā /🔽siddhaścetkimuttarakālabhāvinānaikāntyena /
analyzed: nanu tantu paṭayoḥ samavāyaḥ siddhaḥ na vā  siddhaḥ ced kim uttara kāla bhāvinā anaikāntyena
translated: But is the inherence of the yarn and the cloth established or not?🔽If it is established, what use is there for an inconclusive [reason] that comes later?

analyzed: na ced kva na aikāntyam
translated: If not, where is the inconclusiveness?

analyzed: mā evam
translated: This is not so.

original: āpātataḥ pratīte sambandhe vyabhicāraṃ dṛṣṭvā parāvṛtterāvaśyakatvasya vivakṣitatvāt / /
analyzed: āpātataḥ pratīte sambandhe vyabhicāram dṛṣṭvā parāvṛtteḥ āvaśyaka tvasya vivakṣita tvāt
translated: Because, when the relation is cognized at first, seeing the contradiction, the necessity of reversal is intended.

analyzed: nanu atra bhinnatva sāmyam kimartham upanyastam
translated: But why is the similarity of difference stated here?

analyzed: nahi bhinna tvam hetūkṛtam iti
translated: For difference is not taken as the reason.

analyzed: satyam  a bādhita tva dyotana artham bhinna tva grahaṇam
translated: This is true.🔽The mention of difference is for the purpose of showing the absence of contradiction.

analyzed: vibhinna vastu abhāve khalu iha pratyayaḥ bādhitaḥ syāt
translated: For, indeed, the cognition of inherence here would be contradicted in the absence of different things.

original: iha tantupaṭayoḥ samavāya iti pratyayo 'pi sambandhapūrvaka eva tantupaṭasamavāyasyaitatkāraṇatvāditi cenna /
analyzed: iha tantu paṭayoḥ samavāyaḥ iti sambandha pūrvakaḥ eva tantu paṭa samavāyasya etad kāraṇa tvāt iti ced na
translated: Even the notion of inherence between the yarn and the cloth is preceded by a relation, because the inherence of the yarn and the cloth is the cause of that. This is not so.

original: ādhārādheyatayā pratīyamānayoḥ sambandhasya pareṇa sisādhayiṣitatvāt /🔽anyathā sthāṇuśyenayoḥ saṃyoga ityatra samavāyāsiddhiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: ādhāra ādheya tayā pratīyamānayoḥ sambandhasya pareṇa sisādhayiṣita tvāt  anyathā sthāṇu śyenayoḥ saṃyogaḥ iti atra samavāya asiddhi prasaṅgāt
translated: Because the relation that is perceived as the support and the supported is intended to be established by the opponent.🔽Otherwise, in the case of the conjunction of the post and the dog, there would be the undesirable consequence of the non-establishment of inherence.

analyzed: indriya artha sannikarṣa ādinā siddha sādhana tā āpatteḥ ca
translated: And because there would be the fallacy of proving what is already established by the contact of the sense organ and the object, etc.

analyzed: nanu anavasthiteḥ iti sūtram katham
translated: Now, how is the sutra because of infinite regress [explained]?

analyzed: ittham
translated: It is like this.

analyzed: yadi vyabhicāra parihārāya samavāyasya api samavāya antaram upeyate
translated: If, in order to avoid fallacy, another inherence of inherence is accepted,

analyzed: tadā anavasthitiḥ iti
translated: then there is an infinite regress.

analyzed: iha kecid samavāyam pratyakṣam ācakṣāṇāḥ
translated: Here, some people, describing inherence as perception,

original: yata iti ca viṣayasaptamīṃ vyācakṣāṇāḥ tatsthemne anumānamācakṣate /
analyzed: yatas iti ca viṣaya saptamīm vyācakṣāṇāḥ tad sthemne anumānam ācakṣate
translated: and explaining the locative case in yataḥ as the object, describe inference as its determination.

analyzed: teṣām ihapratyayasya sambandha pūrvaka tvam nāma tad pratīti pūrvaka tvam eva
translated: For them, the fact that the notion of here is preceded by a relation is nothing but preceded by the cognition of that.

analyzed: tad mate sphuṭā eva anavasthā
translated: In their view, the infinite regress is indeed clear.

analyzed: ye tu pratyakṣa tām na abhyupagacchanti
translated: But those who do not accept it as perception,

analyzed: sambandhasya sattā mātreṇa iha pratyaya kāraṇavatvam āhuḥ teṣām
translated: They say that the relation is the cause of the cognition of 'here' merely by its existence.

analyzed: avasthitiḥ siddhāntaḥ tad virodhaḥ navasthitiḥ iti anavasthiti śabdaḥ upasiddhānta vācī vyākhyāyate
translated: The established conclusion is the settled view. Contradiction to that is unsettledness. Thus, the word 'unsettledness' is explained as meaning 'contradiction to the established conclusion'.

original: yadveha kuṇḍe badarāṇītivatsambandhasya pratītyaivehapratyayakāraṇatvādatrāpi pratītimāpādyānavasthaiva vaktavyā /
analyzed: yat vā iha kuṇḍe badarāṇi iti vat sambandhasya pratītya eva iha pratyaya kāraṇa tvāt atra api pratītim āpādya anavasthā eva vaktavyā
translated: Or, just as in the expression 'jujubes here in the pot', the relation itself is the cause of the cognition of 'here', so in this case also, the unsettledness should be stated by bringing about the cognition.

original: kuṇḍabadarasaṃyogasya yogyatayā avarjanīyatayā pratītirnehapratyayakāraṇamiti kuta eṣā kalpanā /
analyzed: kuṇḍa badara saṃyogasya yogya tayā avarjanīya tayā pratītiḥ na iha pratyaya kāraṇam iti kutas eṣā kalpanā
translated: The cognition of the conjunction of the pot and jujube is unavoidable due to their fitness, and is not the cause of the cognition of 'here'. How is this assumption made?

original: sattāmātreṇehapratyayakāraṇatvopapattau pratīterapi kāraṇatvakalpakābhāvāditi cenna /🔽satyapi saṃyoge kutaścidvayavadhānādapratīyamāne nehabuddhirbhavati /
analyzed: sattā mātreṇa iha pratyaya kāraṇa tva upapattau pratīteḥ api kāraṇa tva kalpaka abhāvāt iti ced na  sati api saṃyoge kutaścid vayavadhānāt apratīyamāne na iha buddhiḥ bhavati
translated: If the cognition of 'here' is possible by the relation being the cause merely by its existence, then there is no reason to assume that the cognition itself is also the cause.🔽Even when the conjunction exists, if it is not cognized due to some obstruction, the cognition of 'here' does not occur.

analyzed: bhavati ca asati api saṃyoge tad viparyayāt iti anvaya vyatirekayoḥ kalpaka abhāvāt
translated: And it does occur even when the conjunction does not exist, by the opposite of that. Thus, there is no reason for the positive and negative concomitance.

original: svasvāmibhāvādayo 'pi hi jñātā eva sambandhanimittavyavahārahetavo dṛṣṭā nānyathā /
analyzed: sva svāmi bhāva ādayaḥ pi hi jñātāḥ eva sambandha nimitta vyavahāra hetavaḥ dṛṣṭāḥ na anyathā
translated: The relations of master and servant, etc., are seen to be the causes of the usage based on the relation only when they are known, not otherwise.

original: na te sambandhā adviṣṭhatvāditi cenna /🔽saṃyogasyāpyadviṣṭhatāyā vakṣyamāṇatvāt /
analyzed: na te sambandhāḥ a dviṣṭha tvāt iti ced na  saṃyogasya api a dviṣṭha tāyāḥ vakṣyamāṇa tvāt
translated: If it be said that these relations are not relations because they are not reciprocal, we say no.🔽Because we shall show that conjunction also is not reciprocal.

analyzed: kiñca evam samavāyaḥ pi na sambandhaḥ syāt
translated: Moreover, in this way inherence also would not be a relation.

analyzed: tasya anāśrita tva abhyupagamāt
translated: Because it is admitted that it has no substratum.

original: nanvevaṃ tarhi nānaikāntyāt anavasthaiva bādhitatvenābādhitehapratyayatvasya tatrāvṛtteriti cenna /
analyzed: nanu evam tarhi na anaikāntyāt anavasthā eva bādhita tvena abādhita iha pratyaya tvasya tatra avṛtteḥ iti ced na
translated: If it be said that thus, on the contrary, there is the same infinite regress, because the cognition of inherence is not sublated, we say no.

analyzed: anavasthāyāḥ sādhya bādhaka tvena sādhana ābādhaka tvāt  sādhya bādhena eva sādhana bādhana abhyupagamasya vyāpti niścaya uttara kālīna tvāt
translated: Because the infinite regress sublates the conclusion, but does not sublate the reason.🔽Because the admission that the reason is sublated by the conclusion itself is subsequent to the ascertainment of the pervasion.

analyzed: tantu paṭayoḥ samavāyaḥ iti pratītiḥ api sambandha pūrvikā eva
translated: The cognition that there is inherence between the threads and the cloth is also preceded by a relation.

analyzed: kintu aropitaḥ eva asau sambandhaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it be said that this relation is only superimposed, we say no.

analyzed: anavasthā nistārāt
translated: Because the infinite regress is not avoided.

analyzed: āropita sambandha pūrvaka tvam hi sambandha āropa pūrvaka tvam eva
translated: For the relation being preceded by a superimposed relation is the same as being preceded by a superimposed relation.

analyzed: pratītau ca iyam anavasthā uktā iti katham tad nirasta anistāraḥ
translated: And if this infinite regress is stated in the cognition, how is it that it is not avoided?

original: kiñcaivaṃ vadatā sattayaiva sambandhasya kāraṇatvamiti mataṃ tyaktaṃ syāt / /
analyzed: kiñca evam vadatā sattayā eva sambandhasya kāraṇa tvam iti matam tyaktam syāt
translated: Moreover, by saying this, the view that the relation is the cause only through existence would be abandoned.

original: api cābādhito 'pīhapratyayo yadi sambandhāropamātreṇa bhavettadā tantupaṭādāvapi kinna bhavediti samavāyāsiddhiḥ /
analyzed: api ca ābādhitaḥ pi iha pratyayaḥ yadi sambandha āropa mātreṇa bhavet tadā tantu paṭa ādau api kin na bhavet iti samavāya asiddhiḥ
translated: Moreover, if the cognition of 'this' were to occur here merely by the superimposition of the relation, even in the case of a thread and a cloth, why would it not occur? Thus, there is no establishment of inherence.

analyzed: kvacid siddhasya kvacid āropaḥ kutra api abhāve tad asiddhiḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the superimposition of what is established in one place on another is not possible when it is absent anywhere, that is not so.

original: sthāṇuśyenayoḥ sambandhasya sattvāt /🔽anyathā samavāye 'pi samavāyāntarārope na syātsamavāyāntarasya kvāpyasattvātsambhavāt /
analyzed: sthāṇu śyenayoḥ sambandhasya sattvāt  anyathā samavāye pi samavāya antara ārope na syāt samavāya antarasya kvāpi asattvāt sambhavāt
translated: Because the relation between a post and a dog exists.🔽Otherwise, even in the case of inherence, when another inherence is superimposed, it would not be possible, because another inherence does not exist anywhere.

original: samavāye bheda evāropyate na samavāyāntaramiti cenna /
analyzed: samavāye bhedaḥ eva āropyate na samavāya antaram iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that only the difference is superimposed on inherence, not another inherence, that is not so.

analyzed: tāvat mātreṇa ihapratyaya ayogāt
translated: Because that alone is not suitable for the cognition of 'this' here.

analyzed: sambandhi sambandha bhāvaḥ pi āropyate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the relation of the relata is also superimposed, that is not so.

analyzed: tarhi tantu paṭa ādau api tad āropa mātreṇa iha pratyaya upapattau kim samavāyena iti
translated: Then, even in the case of a thread and a cloth, the cognition of 'this' would be possible merely by the superimposition of that. What is the use of inherence?

analyzed: nanu samavāye pi iha idam iti pratyayaḥ samavāya adhīnaḥ eva
translated: But even in the case of inherence, the cognition of 'this' is dependent on inherence itself.

analyzed: na ca apasiddhāntaḥ navasthā vā
translated: And there is no contradiction of one's own doctrine or infinite regress.

analyzed: tasya eva samavāyasya sva nirvāhaka tvāt
translated: Because that very inherence serves itself.

analyzed: yaḥ eva hi samavāyaḥ vayava ādiṣu avayavi ādīnām sambandhaḥ
translated: For that very inherence is the relation of the whole, etc. to the parts, etc.

original: sa evāvayavāvavyādiṣvātmanā sambandha ityāśaṅkate sa iti //
analyzed: saḥ eva avayavau avi ādiṣu ātmanā sambandhaḥ iti āśaṅkate saḥ iti
translated: He doubts that the same [inherence] is the relation of the whole to the parts, etc., by its own nature.

analyzed: sa sva nirvāhakaḥ ced syāt
translated: If it were to be self-sufficient...

analyzed: saḥ avayava avayavi ādi samavāyaḥ
translated: That [inherence] is the relation of the whole to the parts, etc.

analyzed: evam tarhi kim samavāyena
translated: If so, then what is the use of inherence?

analyzed: dravyasya eva sva nirvāhaka tva upapatteḥ iti pariharati dravyam eva iti
translated: He replies that the substance itself is capable of self-sufficiency.

analyzed: dravyam eva tathā na kim
translated: Why not the substance itself in that way?

analyzed: tarhi iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The rest is: then.

analyzed: tathā sva nirvāhaka tvāt
translated: In that way, because it is self-sufficient.

analyzed: kim kasmāt
translated: Why? What for?

analyzed: ayam āśayaḥ
translated: This is the idea:

analyzed: yadi iha idam iti buddhiḥ na avaśyam sva atirikta sambandha sāpekṣā
translated: If the cognition of this as that does not necessarily depend on a relation distinct from itself,

analyzed: kvacid sva nirvāhaka tvāt
translated: because in some cases it is self-sufficient,

analyzed: tarhi dravya guṇa ādīnām iha idam iti pratyayaḥ pi na atirikta sambandha adhīnaḥ ṅgīkāryaḥ
translated: then the cognition of substance, quality, etc. as this and that should also be accepted as not dependent on a distinct relation,

analyzed: dravyasya eva sva nirvāhaka tayā api tad upapatteḥ iti
translated: because that is possible even by the substance itself being self-sufficient.
Inherence, being of the nature of a relation, is self-sufficient.

analyzed: na dravyam iti ced na  tad asiddhau sambandha tvasya api asiddheḥ
translated: Not so substance, if you say. No,🔽because in its non-establishment, the nature of being a relation is also not established.

analyzed: saṃyogasya api sva nirvāhaka tā āpatteḥ ca
translated: And because conjunction would also become self-sufficient.

analyzed: tasya anitya tvāt na iti ced na
translated: If you say it is not so because it is non-eternal, no.

analyzed: samavāya nitya tvasya asiddheḥ iti
translated: Because the eternality of inherence is not established.

original: evaṃ dravyādguṇādīnāmatyantabhede 'pi na tatsambandhaḥ samavāyalakṣaṇo 'paraḥ siddhayati /
analyzed: evam dravyāt guṇa ādīnām atyanta bhede pi na tad sambandhaḥ samavāya lakṣaṇaḥ paraḥ
translated: Thus, even though there is absolute difference between quality etc. and substance, the relation between them, characterized by inherence, is not established as something else.

analyzed: samavāya vat dravyasya eva sva nirvāhaka tva upapatteḥ
translated: Because it is possible for substance itself, like inherence, to be self-sufficient, and because of the lightness of assumption.

analyzed: cca iti uktam
translated: This has been stated.

original: idānīṃ guṇādīnāṃ dravyādatyantabhedābhāvācca na samavāyasiddhirityāśayavāṃstadatyantabhede paropanyastānhetūnapākartuṃ tāvadupodghātamāha
analyzed: idānīm guṇa ādīnām dravyāt atyanta bheda abhāvāt ca na samavāya siddhiḥ iti āśayavān tad atyanta bhede para upanyastān hetūn apākartum tāvat upodghātam āha
translated: Now, the intention being that inherence is not established because there is no absolute difference between quality etc. and substance, he first states a preliminary argument to refute the reasons for their absolute difference presented by others:

analyzed: viśeṣaḥ iti
translated: The difference, etc.

analyzed: viśeṣaḥ tad gata tva ādiḥ yadi abhinne vasīyate
translated: If the difference, such as being inherent in that, is ascertained in the non-different,

analyzed: guṇa kriyā ādi rūpasya niṣedhaḥ kena hetunā
translated: by what reason is the negation of the form of quality, action, etc. made?

analyzed: abhinne samavāye iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder is in the non-different inherence.

analyzed: avasīyate aṅgīkriyate iti yāvat
translated: Is ascertained means is accepted, that is the meaning.

analyzed: guṇa kriyā ādi rūpasya viśeṣasya iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder is of the difference which has the form of quality, action, etc.

analyzed: kena hetunā na kena api
translated: By what reason? By no reason at all.

analyzed: idam uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said.

analyzed: samavāye tāvat avayava avayavi ādi gata tvam aṅgīkṛtam
translated: To begin with, inherence is accepted as being inherent in the parts, the whole, etc.

analyzed: āśrita tvam ca anyatra nitya dravyebhyaḥ
translated: And dependence is on something other than the eternal substances.

analyzed: iti vacanāt
translated: This is stated in the text.

analyzed: na ca anitya dravya gura karma sāmānya viśeṣaṇām iva samavāyasya tad gata tvam nāma samavāya lakṣaṇa vṛttiḥ sambhavati
translated: And as in the case of non-eternal substances, qualities, actions, universals and particulars, the inherence of inherence in them cannot be the definition of inherence,

analyzed: tasya abhinna tvāt
translated: because it is non-different.

analyzed: atas tad gata tvam nāma
translated: Therefore, the inherence of inherence in them

analyzed: samavāya svarūpam eva iti aṅgīkartavyam
translated: must be accepted as being the very nature of inherence itself.

analyzed: paratantra tayā upalabdhiḥ tadgata tvam iti ced na  tasyāḥ samavāya dharma tva anupapatteḥ
translated: If it be said that the inherence of inherence in them is the apprehension of them as dependent on something else, that is not so.🔽Because that cannot be a property of inherence.

analyzed: tad viṣaya tvāt tad dharma tvam iti ced na
translated: If it be said that it is a property of inherence because it has inherence as its object, that is not so.

analyzed: viṣaya tvasya api samavāya svarūpa atu anatirekāt
translated: Because the state of being an object is not different from the nature of inherence itself.

analyzed: evam astitva abhidheya tva jñeya tva sambandha tva ādayaḥ pi samavāye bhyupagatāḥ
translated: In the same way, existence, being denoted, being knowable, being a relation, etc. are accepted as inhering in inherence.

analyzed: na samavāya svarūpāt bhidyante
translated: They are not different from the nature of inherence.

original: bhedaṃ hi teṣāṃ samavāyena sambandho vaktavyaḥ /
analyzed: bhedam hi teṣām samavāyena sambandhaḥ vaktavyaḥ
translated: For their difference from inherence must be said to be related by inherence.

analyzed: anyathā katham ete tatra syuḥ
translated: Otherwise, how could they be there?

analyzed: na ca sambandhaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: And the relation is not proper.

analyzed: saṃyogasya guṇa tvena dravya mātra vṛtteḥ
translated: Because conjunction, being a quality, inheres only in substances.

analyzed: samavāyasya ca abhinna tvāt
translated: And because inherence is non-different.

analyzed: tatra pṛcchāmaḥ
translated: Here we ask:

analyzed: samavāyasya tad gata tva ādi dharmāṇām ca abhede katham aparyāya śabda vācya tvam
translated: How can there be denotation by synonymous words when inherence and its properties are non-different?

analyzed: dharma dharmi bhāvaḥ  ṣaṣṭhī prayogaḥ
translated: The relation of property and possessor of the property.🔽The use of the genitive case.

analyzed: jñāta tva ajñāta tvam
translated: Being known and being unknown.

analyzed: ekatva anekatvam ityādi yujyate iti
translated: Being one and being many, etc. are appropriate.

analyzed: na hi acā atra upacāra ādi kalpanā yuktā
translated: For here it is not proper to imagine figurative usage, etc.

analyzed: mukhya prayoga ādeḥ adarśanāt
translated: Because the primary usage, etc. are not seen.

analyzed: na tad gata tva ādi samavāya tanmātram
translated: That inherence and its properties are not mere inherence,

analyzed: yena an upapāttaḥ syāt
translated: by which it would be unestablished.

analyzed: kintu samavāya abhinnam api tad viśeṣa ātmaka tmakam
translated: But it is of the nature of that particular, although not different from inherence.

analyzed: atas vyapadeśa bheda ādi yujyate
translated: Therefore, the difference in designation, etc. is appropriate.

analyzed: viśeṣasya bheda pratinidhi tvāt iti eva agatika tayā tatra samādhiḥ abhidhānīyaḥ
translated: Because the particular is a substitute for difference, this is the only way to explain it there.

original: tathāca yadyabhinne 'pi samavāye tadgatatvādiviśeṣo 'ṅgīkriyate tadā guṇakriyādikamapi dravyasvarūpameva sadviśeṣātmakaṃ bhavatu na tu tanmātram
analyzed: tathā ca yadi abhinne samavāye tad gata tva ādi viśeṣaḥ ṅgīkriyate tadā guṇa kriyā ādikam api dravya svarūpam eva sat viśeṣa ātmakam bhavatu na tu tanmātram
translated: And thus, if in inherence, which is non-different, the particular of being inherent, etc. is accepted, then let the quality, action, etc. also be of the nature of the particular, which is the very form of substance, and not mere that.

analyzed: samavāya dharmāḥ tad viśeṣāḥ
translated: The properties of inherence are the particulars.

original: guṇādayastu na dravyaviśeṣā ityatra viśeṣahetvabhāvād iti / /
analyzed: guṇa ādayaḥ tu na dravya viśeṣāḥ iti atra viśeṣa hetu abhāvāt iti
translated: But the qualities, etc. are not the particulars of substance. Here, because there is no specific reason, it is said.

analyzed: kim atas yadi evam iti atas āha dravyam eva iti
translated: What follows from this if it is so? To this he says: Substance alone, etc.

analyzed: dravyam eva tatas nanta viśeṣa ātma tayā sadā
translated: Therefore, substance alone, always having an infinite number of distinct natures,

analyzed: nānā vyavahṛteḥ hetuḥ
translated: is the cause of the manifold usage.

analyzed: samavāya dharmavat guṇa ādīnām dravya viśeṣa tvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: because qualities, etc. are the particularities of substance, like the properties of inherence.

analyzed: ananta śabdaḥ yatra yāvantaḥ vyavahārāḥ tāvatām upalakṣakaḥ
translated: The word infinite indicates as many usages as there are.

analyzed: nānā vyavahṛteḥ vyapadeśa bheda ādiḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Manifold usage means the difference in designation, etc.

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said.

original: guṇaguṇyādeḥ atyantabhede siddhe hi tatsambandhaḥ samavāyaḥ siddhayati /
analyzed: guṇa guṇi ādeḥ atyanta bhede siddhe hi tad sambandhaḥ samavāyaḥ
translated: For when the absolute difference of quality and substance, etc. is established, the relation between them, inherence, is established.

analyzed: guṇa guṇi ādi atyanta bhedaḥ tu na prāmāṇikaḥ
translated: But the absolute difference of quality and substance, etc. is not authoritative.

analyzed: tathā hi na tāvat tatra pratyakṣam pramāṇam
translated: To explain: First, perception is not a valid means of knowledge in this case.

analyzed: gavāśva ādi vat anupalambhāt
translated: Because it is not apprehended like a cow, a horse, etc.

analyzed: atas guṇa guṇinau atyanta bhinnau aparyāya śabda vācya tvāt
translated: Therefore, quality and substance are absolutely different, because they are denoted by synonymous words.
