analyzed: ghaṭa paṭa vat ityādi anumānam eva vaktavyam
translated: Like a pot and a cloth, etc. - this kind of inference must be stated.

analyzed: tat ca anaikāntikam  samavāyasya tad dharmāṇām ca
translated: And that is inconclusive.

analyzed: bheda abhāve pi aparyāya śabda vācya tvāt anyathā asiddham ca
translated: Because of the denotation by synonymous words even in the absence of difference of inherence and its properties, and because it is otherwise established.

analyzed: yathā samavāye tadgata tva ādi dharmāṇām bheda bhāve pi viśeṣa para nāmakāt svabhāva viśeṣāt eva aparyāya śabda vācya tva ādikam upapādanīyam
translated: Just as, in the case of Inherence, even though the properties of subsisting in that and so forth are different, yet the fact of its being denoted by non-synonymous words and so forth has to be explained only on the basis of the specific nature of the thing itself, which is called its ‘peculiarity’;

analyzed: gati antara abhāvāt  tathā guṇa guṇi ādīnām atyantā
translated: because there is no other way of explaining it.

analyzed: bhede pi guṇa ādīnām dravya viśeṣa tvena dra
translated: In the same manner, even though there is absolute difference between the Quality and the Qualified, etc., yet the fact of the Quality, etc. being denoted by non-synonymous words and so forth will be due to the peculiarity of the Substance itself, which is the substratum of those Qualities, etc.;

analyzed: tat dravyam eva
translated: and the Substance itself is the substratum of those Qualities, etc.

analyzed: viśeṣa śaktayā eva aparyāya śabda vācya tva ādi vyavahāra hetuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: It is only through the peculiar potency of the Substance that the denotation by non-synonymous words and so forth becomes the basis of usage.

analyzed: tathā ca vipakṣe bādhaka abhāvāt aprayojaka tvam hetūnām iti
translated: Thus then, there being no reason against the contrary of the conclusion (of the Buddhist), the Reasons adduced by him are ‘inconclusive’ (doubtful).

analyzed: yat vā viśeṣaḥ tad gata tva ādiḥ iti anena eva guṇa guṇi ādi atyanta bheda sādhakānām hetūnām anaikāntya aprayojaka tve varṇite
translated: Or, the term ‘viśeṣa’ (in the compound ‘viśeṣastadgatatvādiḥ’) may be taken as standing for the Reasons adduced by the other party in proof of the absolute difference of the Quality from the Substance, etc.; and the term ‘tadgatatvādiḥ’ for the ‘inconclusiveness’ and ‘irrelevancy’ of those Reasons.

original: yadi tadgatatvādidharmābhinne samavāye tadgatatvādiviśeṣo 'bhyupeyate /🔽viśeṣaṇaiva ca vyavahārā nirvahiṣyante /
analyzed: yadi tadgata tva ādi dharma abhinne samavāye tadgata tva ādi viśeṣaḥ bhyupeyate 🔽viśeṣaṇā eva ca vyavahārāḥ nirvahiṣyante
translated: If, in the case of Inherence, which is not different from the properties of subsisting in that and so forth, a particular form of these latter is admitted,🔽and all notions and verbal expressions are explained on the basis of that particular form, then, in that case, the Reasons adduced by the other party become ‘inconclusive’, and also ‘irrelevant’, as there is nothing to show that the Inherence is not as asserted.

original: tadā vyapadeśabhedādihetūnāṃ vyabhicārānyathāsiddhibhyāṃ ābhāsatvātkena hetunā dravyasya guṇakriyādirūpasya guṇakriyādisvarūpatvasya niṣedhaḥ
analyzed: tadā vyapadeśa bheda ādi hetūnām vyabhicāra anyathāsiddhibhyām ābhāsa tvāt kena hetunā dravyasya guṇa kriyā ādi rūpasya guṇa kriyā ādi svarūpa tvasya niṣedhaḥ
translated: Then, since the reasons such as difference in designation etc. are fallacious due to non-establishment otherwise, by what reason will the negation of the substance having the form of quality, action etc. being of the nature of quality, action etc.

analyzed: kariṣyate kriyate
translated: be made, is being made?

original: guṇaguṇyādyatyantabhedaḥ kena hetunā sādhayiṣyata iti yāvat /
analyzed: guṇa guṇi ādi atyanta bhedaḥ kena hetunā sādhayiṣyate iti yāvat
translated: By what reason will the absolute difference between quality and substance etc. be established? - up to this extent.

analyzed: anyathā asiddhim eva prakaṭayan upasaṃharati dravyam eva iti
translated: Indicating non-establishment otherwise, he concludes with substance alone.

analyzed: samavāya vat iti vakṣyamāṇam atra api sambaddhayate
translated: Like inherence is to be connected here also.

analyzed: yathā samavāyasya tadgata tva ādi viśeṣa ātma tayā vyapadeśa bheda ādi vyavahāra hetu tvam
translated: Just as inherence is the cause of the usage of difference in designation etc. by having the nature of particularities such as inherence in that,

analyzed: tathā dravyam eva ghaṭa ādikam guṇa kriyā ādi ananta viśeṣa ātma tayā nānā vyavahṛteḥ hetuḥ bhavati iti
translated: in the same way, substance alone such as a pot etc. becomes the cause of the usage of various things by having the nature of endless particularities such as quality, action etc.

original: nanvaupacārikatvaṃ vā bhrāntimūlatvaṃ vā vyavahārāṇāmaṅgīkṛtya hetūnāṃ dūṣaṇaṃ śakyam /
analyzed: nanu aupacārika tvam vā bhrānti mūla tvam vā vyavahārāṇām aṅgīkṛtya hetūnām dūṣaṇam śakyam
translated: But the refutation of the reasons can be done by accepting that the usages are figurative or based on error.

analyzed: tat kim viśeṣa aṅgīkāreṇa
translated: So why accept particularities?

analyzed: na evam śakyam
translated: This is not possible.

analyzed: aupacārika tva ādau hi kadācid muktau vyavahāraḥ syāt
translated: For, in figurativeness etc., the usage may occur sometimes even after liberation.

analyzed: na hi tīra ādau sadā gaṅgā ādi vyavahāraḥ sti
translated: For there is never the usage of 'Ganga' etc. with regard to the bank and so on.

analyzed: na ca evam prakṛte sadā eva aparyāya śabda vācya tva ādeḥ sattvāt
translated: And it is not so in the present case, because the being denoted by synonymous words etc. always exists.

original: yadāpyabhedabodhāya rūpameva ghaṭa iti vā vijñānaṃ brahmeti vā vyavahriyate tadāpi na paryāyatāmupetya /
analyzed: yadā api abheda bodhāya rūpam eva ghaṭaḥ iti vā vijñānam brahma iti vā vyavahriyate tadā api na paryāya tām upetya
translated: Even when the form itself is spoken of as the pot, or consciousness as Brahman, for the purpose of conveying non-difference, even then synonymity is not accepted.

analyzed: tathā ananubhavāt  atas vaktavyam eva atra nimittam
translated: Because it is not experienced thus.🔽Therefore, the reason here must be stated.

analyzed: tat idam uktam sadā iti
translated: This is what is said - 'it exists' etc.

analyzed: nanu ananta viśeṣa ātmakam ekam eva dravyam iti vyāhatam iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it is contradictory to say that there is only one substance with an infinite number of attributes,

analyzed: kim mātā vandhyā iti vat sākṣāt virodhaḥ
translated: is it a direct contradiction like 'is the mother barren'?

analyzed: kiṃvā kṛtakam nityam iti vat vayāptyā
translated: Or is it by pervasion like 'what is produced is impermanent'?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ  yatas nanta tvam saṅkhaya aviśeṣaḥ
translated: It is not the first.🔽Because infinity is a particular number.

analyzed: eka tvam ca abhedaḥ
translated: And oneness is non-difference.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: It is not the second.

original: yatrānekatvaṃ tatrāvaśyaṃ bheda iti vyāptau hi sa syāt /
analyzed: yatra aneka tvam tatra avaśyam bhedaḥ iti vyāptau hi sa syāt
translated: For that would be the case if there were the pervasion that where there is plurality, there must be difference.

analyzed: na ca evam  bheda pratinidhinā viśeṣeṇa eva anekatva saṅkhaya anirvāhāt iti āha ananta tvam iti
translated: And it is not so.🔽Because the number of plurality is accomplished by the substitute of difference, namely by particularity. This is what is said - 'infinity is by particularity'.

analyzed: ananta tvam viśeṣataḥ
translated: Infinity is by particularity.

analyzed: īśvara ākhya dravya viśeṣaṇām ananta tvam anyatra aneka tvam iti draṣṭavyam
translated: The infinity of the differentia called God, and the plurality of the other [differentia], should be understood.

analyzed: atra api samavāya vat iti sambaddhayate
translated: Here also, it is connected with like inherence.

analyzed: ekaḥ eva hi samavāyaḥ neka dharma ātmakaḥ ṅgīkriyate
translated: For only one inherence is accepted as having many properties.

original: nanvayaṃ nānāvyavahāranirvāhaheturviśeṣo yadi dravyātmaiva kathaṃ tarhi taddravya
analyzed: nanu ayam nānā vyavahāra nirvāha hetuḥ viśeṣaḥ yadi dravya ātmā eva katham tarhi tad dravya
translated: If this difference, which is the cause of maintaining the various usages, is indeed the very self of substance, then how can it be

analyzed: dravyasya viśeṣaḥ syāt
translated: a difference of that substance?

analyzed: tadīya tāyāḥ bheda vyāpta tvāt
translated: Because belonging to that is pervaded by difference.

analyzed: mā evam
translated: This is not so.

original: vināpi bhedena tatpratinidhinā viśeṣaṇaiva viśeṣasya tadīyatopapatteḥ /
analyzed: vinā api bhedena tad pratinidhinā viśeṣaṇā eva viśeṣasya tadīya tā upapatteḥ
translated: Even without difference, which is its substitute, the belonging to that of the difference is logically possible just by the relation of qualifier and qualified.

original: evaṃ tarhi tasyāpi viśeṣasya viśeṣatvasiddhaye viśeṣāntaramaṅgīkartavyamityanavasthetyata āha viśeṣaśceti //
analyzed: evam tarhi tasya api viśeṣasya viśeṣa tva siddhaye viśeṣa antaram aṅgīkartavyam iti anavasthā iti atas āha viśeṣaḥ ca iti
translated: If it is so, then in order to establish the difference of that difference also, another difference must be accepted. Thus there is an infinite regress. In response to this, he says And the difference...

analyzed: viśeṣaḥ ca viśeṣī saḥ svena eva samavāya vat
translated: And the difference is that which is qualified by itself, like inherence.

analyzed: yathā samavāyaḥ svena eva samavāyī
translated: Just as inherence is inhering in itself,

analyzed: na sambandha antareṇa iti abhyupagamya anavasthā pareṇa parākriyate
translated: not by another relation, thus the infinite regress is countered by the opponent by accepting [the view].

original: tathā sa dravye 'nekavyavahāranirvāheturviśeṣaśca svenaiva viśeṣī na punarviśeṣāntareṇa /
analyzed: tathā sa dravye neka vyavahāra nirvā hetuḥ viśeṣaḥ ca svena eva viśeṣī na punar viśeṣa antareṇa
translated: Similarly, that which is the cause of the operation of the notion of oneness in a substance is a particular itself, not by another particular.

analyzed: atas na kaścid doṣaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, there is no fault at all.

analyzed: samavāya vat iti upalakṣaṇam
translated: Like inherence, is an illustration.

original: sattāntyaviśeṣavaccetyapi draṣṭavyam /🔽yathā dravyaguṇakarmasu sadvayavahārahetuḥ sattā svenaiva satī svīkṛtā /
analyzed: sattā antya viśeṣavat ca iti api draṣṭavyam  yathā dravya guṇa karmasu sat vayavahāra hetuḥ sattā svena eva satī svīkṛtā
translated: It should also be seen as like existence and ultimate particularity.🔽Just as existence, which is the cause of the operation of the notion of existence in substances, qualities, and actions, is accepted as existent by itself alone.

original: yathā ca nityadravyeṣvatyantavyāvṛttipratyaye heturantyo viśeṣaḥ svenaivātyantavyāvṛttastathaiveti / /
analyzed: yathā ca nitya dravyeṣu atyanta vyāvṛtti pratyaye hetuḥ antyaḥ viśeṣaḥ svena eva atyanta vyāvṛttaḥ tathā eva iti
translated: And just as the ultimate particular, which is the cause of the cognition of absolute distinction in eternal substances, is absolutely distinct by itself alone, so is it.

analyzed: atha api syāt
translated: Now, it may be argued as follows:

analyzed: guṇa guṇi ādi bhedam abhyupagacchatā mayā iha idam iti vyavahāra nirvāhāya samavāyaḥ ṅgīkriyate
translated: By me, who accepts the distinction of quality and substance, inherence is accepted in order to establish the usage of this in that.

analyzed: tasya ca anavasthā parihārāya sva nirvāhaka tvam  a bhedam abhyu
translated: And in order to avoid the regress in that, it is self-sustaining.

analyzed: ca abhyupagacchatā tvayā aparyāya śabda vācya tā ādi siddhaye viśeṣaḥ ṅgīkriyate
translated: But by you, who accepts non-difference, a particular is accepted in order to establish the denotation by synonymous words and so on.

original: tasya cānavasthānirāsāya svanirvāhakatvamiti pakṣadvaye samāne ko viśeṣo 'bhedapakṣe /
analyzed: tasya ca anavasthā nirāsāya sva nirvāhaka tvam iti pakṣa dvaye samāne kaḥ viśeṣaḥ bheda pakṣe
translated: And in order to avoid the regress in that, it is self-sustaining. Thus, in the case of the two positions being the same, what is the difference in the position of non-difference?

analyzed: yena sa parigṛhyate
translated: By which it is accepted.

analyzed: samavāyasya aprāmāṇika tvam iti ced
translated: If it is argued that inherence is not a valid means of knowledge,

analyzed: samam viśeṣe pi
translated: then the same applies to the distinction.

analyzed: aparyāya vyavahāra ādinā sa siddhaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it is established by the use of non-synonymous expressions, etc.,

analyzed: tarhi samavāyaḥ upi iha idam ityādinā siddhaḥ iti tulyam
translated: then it is equally established that inherence is established by expressions like this is in that.

analyzed: tat anaikāntikam iti uktam iti ced
translated: If it is argued that this is inconclusive,

original: aparyāyavyavahārādikamapi ghaṭapaṭāvanaikāntikamiti samānam /🔽astu tarhi guṇaguṇyādibhede vyavahārādisakamapi ghaṭapaṭādavanaikāntikamiti samānam /
analyzed: aparyāya vyavahāra ādikam api ghaṭa paṭau anaikāntikam iti samānam  astu tarhi guṇa guṇya ādi bhede vyavahāra ādi sakam api ghaṭa paṭa ādau anaikāntikam iti samānam
translated: then the use of non-synonymous expressions, etc. is equally inconclusive for pots and cloths.🔽If it is argued that then let there be non-difference, as the use of expressions like pot and cloth is inconclusive,

original: astu tarhi guṇaguṇyādibhede pramāṇābhāvo viśeṣa iti cenna /
analyzed: astu tarhi guṇa guṇi ādi bhede pramāṇa abhāvaḥ viśeṣaḥ iti ced na
translated: then it is not so, because there is no evidence for difference.

analyzed: abhede pi pramāṇa abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no evidence for non-difference either.

original: gavāścādivadvivekenānupalambho abhede pramāṇamiti cet /🔽tarhi vyapadeśabhedādi bhede pramāṇamastīti samādhisāmyam /
analyzed: gavāśca ādi vat vivekena anupalambhaḥ abhede pramāṇam iti ced  tarhi vyapadeśa bheda ādi bhede pramāṇam asti iti samādhi sāmyam
translated: If it is argued that the non-apprehension of difference, like the non-apprehension of a cow, etc., is the evidence for non-difference,🔽then the same applies to the argument that the difference is established by the difference in designation, etc.

analyzed: tad vayabhicāra anyathā asiddhibhyām nirastam iti ced
translated: If it is argued that this has been refuted by the fallacies of contradiction and other means of knowledge,

analyzed: abheda pramāṇam api tādṛś eva  tasya api kṣīra nīra ādau vyabhicārāt
translated: then the evidence for non-difference is also of the same kind.🔽Because it is contradicted in milk, water, etc.,

analyzed: ayuta siddha tvena anyathā asiddheḥ ca
translated: and because it is established by other means as not being inseparably related.

analyzed: tasmāt nimittaḥ yama bheda pakṣapātaḥ iti atas āha kalpanā iti
translated: Therefore, this partiality for non-difference is based on a reason. Hence he says 'in imagination' etc.

analyzed: kalpanā guru tā doṣāt padārtha antara tā nahi
translated: Due to the fault of the heaviness of imagination, there is not the nature of being a different object.

analyzed: padārtha antarā guṇa guṇi ādīnām iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder is 'of qualities, quality-possessors, etc.'

analyzed: yadi api bheda abheda pakṣayoḥ sva nirvāhaka samavāya viśeṣa aṅgīkāreṇa sāmyam
translated: Although in the views of difference and non-difference, there is equality by accepting the specific inherence that accomplishes itself,

original: tathāpi bhedapakṣe kalpanāgurutādoṣāt guṇaguṇyādīnāṃ padārthāntaratā nāṅgīkriyate /
analyzed: tathā api bheda pakṣe kalpanā guru tā doṣāt guṇa guṇya ādīnām padārtha antara tā nā aṅgīkriyate
translated: nevertheless, in the view of difference, the nature of being a different object of qualities, quality-possessors, etc. is not accepted due to the fault of the heaviness of imagination.

analyzed: kalpanā lāghavāt abhedaḥ eva upeyate iti
translated: Non-difference alone should be accepted due to the lightness of imagination.

analyzed: katham bheda vāde kalpanā gauravam iti atas āha kalpayitvā iti
translated: How is there heaviness of imagination in the doctrine of difference? Hence he says 'having imagined' etc.

analyzed: kalpayitvā ṣaṭ padārthān sa abhāvān api kevalam
translated: Having imagined the six categories, even with non-existence alone,

original: ekasmin sa viśeṣaścet kiṃ pūrvaṃ tasya vismṛtiḥ // / / //
analyzed: ekasmin sa viśeṣaḥ ced kim pūrvam tasya vismṛtiḥ
translated: if that is a particular in one, why is there first forgetfulness of it?

analyzed: kevalam iti etat ṣaṣ iti anena ekasmin iti anena ca sambaddhayate
translated: 'Alone' is connected with 'six' and 'in one'.

analyzed: ekasmin samavāye
translated: In one inherence.

analyzed: saḥ vicitra vyavahāra hetuḥ ced aṅgīkriyate iti śeṣaḥ
translated: If that, which is the cause of various usages, is accepted, the remainder is that it is accepted.

analyzed: kim kasmāt
translated: Why? For what reason?

analyzed: pūrvam dravye iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is 'before, in substance'.

analyzed: tasya viśeṣasya
translated: Of that particular.

analyzed: ayam abhisandhiḥ
translated: This is the intention.

analyzed: vyapadeśa bheda ādi pramāṇa balam avambya vaiśeṣika ādibhiḥ dravya ādayaḥ bhāva padārthāḥ ṣaṭ eva
translated: The Vaiśeṣikas and others, relying on the power of evidence such as difference in designation, have postulated that there are only six categories of real things, substance and the rest.

analyzed: saptamaḥ iti kalpitam
translated: And non-existence is the seventh.

original: samavāye pratītaṃ tadgatatvādikaṃ tu na samavāyātiriktam /
analyzed: samavāye pratītam tad gata tva ādikam tu na samavāya atiriktam
translated: But the inherence that is cognized as being in that [substance] and so on is not different from inherence.

original: kintu svabhāvabhedāparanāmnā viśeṣeṇaiva tatra vyapadeśabhedādyutpattiriti ca /
analyzed: kintu svabhāva bheda apara nāmnā viśeṣeṇa eva tatra vyapadeśa bheda ādi utpattiḥ iti ca
translated: But the origination of difference in designation and so on there is only by the difference itself, which is called a particular.

original: tatrāntato 'pyaṅgīkatarvyena vyapadeśabhedādinirvāhakeṇa viśeṣeṇaiva dravye 'pi tannirvāho vaktavyaḥ /
analyzed: vyapadeśa bheda ādi nirvāhakeṇa viśeṣeṇa eva dravye tad nirvāhaḥ vaktavyaḥ
translated: There, the explanation of substance by that very difference, which must finally be accepted as the cause of the accomplishment of difference in designation and so on, must be stated.

analyzed: na kartavyam
translated: The determination of the seven categories should not be made.

original: yadvā dravyavatsamavāye 'pi tadgatatvādīnāṃ bheda eva svīkāryaḥ /
analyzed: yat vā dravyavat samavāye tad gata tva ādīnām bhedaḥ eva svīkāryaḥ
translated: Or, like substance, the difference of being in that and so on must be accepted even in inherence.

analyzed: teṣām ca dravya ādiṣu antarbhāva asambhave sapta padārtha niyamaḥ tyājyaḥ
translated: And if they cannot be included in substance and so on, the restriction to seven categories must be abandoned.

original: viśeṣakāraṇena vinā🔽kvacidbhedasya kvacidviśeṣasyābhyupagame kathaṃ kalpanāgauravaṃ na syāt /
analyzed: viśeṣa kāraṇena vinā  kvacid bhedasya kvacid viśeṣasya abhyupagame katham kalpanā gauravam na syāt
translated: Without a cause of difference,🔽how can there be no excessive imagination if difference is accepted in some cases and particularity in others?

original: tadabhāve vābhedavāde kathaṃ kalpanālāghavaṃ na bhavediti /
analyzed: tad abhāve vā abheda vāde katham kalpanā lāghavam na bhavet iti
translated: Or, if that is not so, how can there be no economy of imagination in the doctrine of non-difference?

analyzed: bheda pratīti apratītibhyām viśeṣaḥ ityādi tu nirākariṣyate
translated: But the distinction based on the cognition or non-cognition of difference will be refuted.

original: atra dvidhākalpanapradarśanārthenaiva pūrvārdhena samavāye viśeṣasyāṅgīkartavyatāpi samathirtā veditavyā /
analyzed: atra dvidhā kalpana pradarśana arthena eva pūrva ardhena samavāye viśeṣasya aṅgīkartavya tā api veditavyā
translated: Here, it should be understood that by the first half alone, which shows the twofold assumption, the necessity of accepting a distinction in inherence is also implied.

analyzed: atas eva kevala śabda sambandhaḥ
translated: For this very reason, the connection is only with the word 'alone'.

analyzed: sapta eva hi padārthāḥ
translated: For there are only seven categories.

original: naca teṣu samavāyadharmāṇāmantarbhāvaḥ sambhavatīti viśeṣā eva tairate '🔽ṅgīkartavyā iti / /
analyzed: na ca teṣu samavāya dharmāṇām antarbhāvaḥ sambhavati iti viśeṣāḥ eva taiḥ ate  ṅgīkartavyāḥ iti
translated: And since it is not possible to include the properties of inherence among them, those distinctions must be accepted by them.

original: na kevalaṃ sarvathāṅgīkāryeṇa viśeṣeṇaiva guṇaguṇyādivyapadeśabhedādyupapattau dravyabhedamaṅgīkṛtya samavāyaeva
analyzed: na kevalam sarvathā aṅgīkāryeṇa viśeṣeṇa eva guṇa guṇya ādi vyapadeśa bheda ādi upapattau dravya bhedam aṅgīkṛtya samavāyaḥ eva
translated: Not only is the difference of substances accepted because the distinction of qualities and possessors of qualities, etc. is possible even with a distinction that must be accepted in every way, but inherence alone is accepted as the cause of the difference of substances.

analyzed: ekasmin viśeṣa abhyupagame kalpanā gauravam iti bheda matam apahāya abheda pakṣapātaḥ kriyate
translated: When a distinction is accepted in one thing, there is the fault of excessive imagination. Thus, abandoning the view of difference, partiality is shown for the view of non-difference.

analyzed: kintu samavāye pramāṇa abhāvāt api
translated: But also because there is no evidence for inherence.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: Thus it is.

analyzed: na tāvat tatra pratyakṣam pramāṇam
translated: First of all, perception is not a means of knowledge in that case.

analyzed: kuṇḍa dadhnoḥ saṃyogaḥ iti vat tantu paṭayoḥ samavāyaḥ iti apratīteḥ
translated: Because there is no cognition of the inherence of the yarn and the cloth as 'the inherence of the yarn and the cloth', like the conjunction of the pot and the curd.

analyzed: sambandha pratītiḥ eva tad pratītiḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the cognition of inherence is the cognition of the relation itself, that is not so.

analyzed: tasyāḥ a sammateḥ
translated: Because of the non-acceptance of that [view].

analyzed: etena ayam tantu paṭa sambandha pratyayaḥ cakṣuḥ janyaḥ na anyathāsiddha tad anvaya vyatireka anuvidhāyi tvāt paṭa pratyaya vat
translated: By this [argument], this cognition of the relation between the thread and the cloth is produced by the eye, because it follows the invariable concomitance and non-concomitance of that [relation], like the cognition of the cloth.

analyzed: ayam tantu paṭayoḥ sambandhaḥ yoga ja dharma ajanya janya sākṣātkāra viṣayaḥ tantu paṭa sambandha tvāt etat tantu paṭa antara saṃyoga vat iti samavāya pratyakṣa tā sādhanam api apāstam
translated: This relation between the thread and the cloth is the object of direct perception produced by the yoga-born attribute, because it is the relation between the thread and the cloth, like the conjunction with another thread and cloth. This proof of the direct perception of inherence is also refuted.

original: tantupaṭasambandhatatpratyayayoḥ asiddhayā'śrayāsiddheḥ /🔽sambandhāpratītau śuklaḥ paṭa iti sāmānādhikaraṇyapratītirna syāt /
analyzed: tantu paṭa sambandha tad pratyayayoḥ asiddhayā āśraya asiddheḥ  sambandha apratītau śuklaḥ paṭaḥ iti sāmānādhikaraṇya pratītiḥ na syāt
translated: Because of the non-establishment of the relation between the thread and the cloth and their cognition, there is the fallacy of the subject not being established.🔽If the relation is not cognized, the cognition of identity such as the cloth is white would not occur.

analyzed: daṇḍī kuṇḍalī ityādau tasya tad pūrvaka tva darśanāt iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that this is because it is seen that [identity] is preceded by that [relation] in the case of the man with the staff, the man with earrings, etc., it is not so.

analyzed: samavāyaḥ asti ityādau vyabhicārāt
translated: Because of the fallacy of over-extension in the case of inherence exists, etc.

analyzed: na api anumānam  iha idam iti pratyayasya dūṣita tvāt
translated: Nor is it inference.🔽Because the cognition this is here has been refuted.

original: iha bhūtale ghaṭābhāva iti pratyaye vyabhicārācca /🔽bhāvamātraviṣayatvena viśeṣaṇādadoṣa iti cenna /
analyzed: iha bhū tale ghaṭa abhāvaḥ iti pratyaye vyabhicārāt ca  bhāva mātra viṣaya tvena viśeṣaṇāt adoṣaḥ iti ced na
translated: And because of the fallacy of over-extension in the cognition there is the absence of the pot on this ground.🔽If it is argued that there is no fallacy because it is qualified by having only existence as its object, it is not so.

analyzed: abhāvavat bhāve pi upapattau anyathā asiddheḥ
translated: Because it is established even in the case of existence with absence, and because it is otherwise established.

analyzed: iha ghaṭe jñānam iti pratyaye vyabhicāra aparihārāt ca
translated: And because there is no avoidance of error in the cognition jar here.

analyzed: bādhitaḥ yam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that this is contradicted, it is not so.

analyzed: anyathā pratyaya anupalabdheḥ
translated: Because there is no apprehension of cognition in any other way.

original: etena jātyādigocaro viśiṣṭavyavahāraḥ sambandhiniyato bhāvamātraviṣayābādhitaviśiṣṭavyavahāratvātsaghaṭaṃ bhūtalamiti vyavahāravadityapāstam
analyzed: etena jāti ādi gocaraḥ viśiṣṭa vyavahāraḥ sambandhi niyataḥ bhāva mātra viṣaya abādhita viśiṣṭa vyavahāra tvāt sa ghaṭam bhū talam iti vyavahāra vat iti apāstam
translated: By this, the usage with a qualified object having a universal etc. is restricted to a related object, because it is an unobstructed qualified usage with respect to mere existence, like the usage the ground with a jar.

analyzed: jñātaḥ ghaṭaḥ
translated: The jar is known.

original: asti samavāyaḥ ityādau vyabhicārāt / /🔽ete tantava etatpaṭasambaddhā etadāśrayatvādbhūtalavat /
analyzed: asti samavāyaḥ ityādau vyabhicārāt  ete tantavaḥ etad paṭa sambaddhāḥ etad āśraya tvāt bhū tala vat
translated: There is inherence, etc., because there is error in this.🔽These threads are connected with this cloth, because they are its substrata, like the ground.

analyzed: ayam paṭaḥ etad tantu sambaddhaḥ etad āśrita tvāt etad āśrita tṛṇa ādi vat iti api asat
translated: This cloth is connected with these threads, because it is dependent on them, like the grass etc. that are dependent on them. This is also wrong.

original: tantupaṭayorāśrayāśrayibhāvāsiddheḥ /🔽iha tantuṣvayaṃ paṭa iti vyavahārasiddhatatpratyāttatsiddhiriti cenna /
analyzed: tantu paṭayoḥ āśraya āśrayi bhāva asiddheḥ  iha tantuṣu ayam paṭaḥ iti vyavahāra siddha tad pratyāt tad siddhiḥ iti ced na
translated: Because the relation of substratum and superimposed is not established between the threads and the cloth.🔽If it is argued that it is established by the established usage this cloth is here in the threads, it is not so.

analyzed: iha samavāye stitvam ityādau vyabhicārāt
translated: Because there is error in the existence of inherence here, etc.

analyzed: bhū tala rūpa ādayaḥ bhū tala sambaddhāḥ bhū tala viśeṣaṇa tvāt ghaṭa vat iti api
translated: The form etc. of the ground are connected with the ground, because they are the qualifiers of the ground, like the jar.

analyzed: bhū tala viśeṣaṇe jñāne vyabhicārāt ayuktam
translated: This is also wrong because there is error in the cognition of the qualifier of the ground.

original: iha tantuṣa paṭa ityādipratyaya etañjanakasaṃyogatvarahitasambandhajanya ihetipratyayatvādiha kuṇḍe badarāṇīti pratyayavat /
analyzed: iha paṭaḥ ityādi pratyayaḥ etad janaka saṃyoga tva rahita sambandha janyaḥ iha iti pratyaya tvāt iha kuṇḍe badarāṇi iti pratyaya vat
translated: Here, the cognition cloth in the yarns is produced by a relation that is devoid of the causal conjunction, because it is a cognition of the form here, like the cognition jujubes in the pot here.

original: naceha bhūtale ghaṭābhāva iti pratyaye vyabhicāraḥ tatrāpi cakṣurbhūtalasaṃyogādijanyatvasya sattvāt /
analyzed: naca iha bhū tale ghaṭa abhāvaḥ iti pratyaye vyabhicāraḥ tatra api cakṣuḥ bhū tala saṃyoga ādi janya tvasya sattvāt
translated: And it is not deviant in the cognition absence of pot on this ground, because there also the production by the conjunction of eye and ground etc. exists.

analyzed: iti api na yuktam
translated: This also is not proper.

analyzed: ayam paṭaḥ etad janaka tantu rahita upādāna janyaḥ paṭa tvāt paṭa antara vat iti ābhāsa samāna yogakṣema tvāt
translated: This cloth is produced from a material cause devoid of the yarns that produce it, because it is a cloth, like another cloth. Because it is of the same nature as the fallacious [reason].

analyzed: rūpa ādayaḥ sambandhavantaḥ prameya tvāt ghaṭa vat iti api anupapannam
translated: It is also unreasonable to say that color etc. are related, because they are objects of knowledge, like a pot.

analyzed: samavāya abhāvayoḥ vyabhicārāt
translated: Because there is deviation in the absence of inherence.

analyzed: tatra api viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāva abhyupagamāt na iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that it is not so because the relation of qualifier and qualified is accepted there also, it is not so.

analyzed: tasya pareṇa sambandha tva an aṅgīkārāt  aṅgīkāre vā tena eva artha antara tvāt
translated: Because the other party does not accept that as a relation.🔽Or if it is accepted, then by that itself there is a different meaning.

analyzed: matup arthasya abhāvāt bādhita viṣaya tvāt ca
translated: Or because the meaning of the suffix is absent and because the subject is contradicted.

analyzed: samavāyaḥ svena eva sambandhī ityādi
translated: Inherence is related to itself alone etc.

analyzed: syāt iti nirastam
translated: This is refuted.

analyzed: idam cakṣuḥ etad janya saṃyoga jñāna tva rahita sambandha jñāna janakam cakṣuṣṭvāt anya cakṣuḥ vat
translated: This eye is the cause of the cognition of the relation devoid of the property of being the cognition of the conjunction produced by that, because it is an eye, like another eye.

analyzed: aham manniṣṭha saṃyoga jñāna tva rahita sambandha jñānavān ātma tvāt ātma antara vat
translated: I am one who has the cognition of the relation devoid of the property of being the cognition of the conjunction residing in me, because I am a self, like another self.

analyzed: ayam kālaḥ idānīntana saṃyoga jñāna tva rahita sambandha jñānavān kāla tvāt anya kāla vat ityādīni
translated: This time is one who has the cognition of the relation devoid of the property of being the cognition of the present conjunction, because it is time, like another time.

analyzed: ābhāsa samāna yogakṣema tvāt
translated: Because it is of the same nature as the manifestation.

analyzed: viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāva ādinā artha antara tvāt ca apāstāni  saṃyoga tvam sambandha vyāvṛttam jāti tvāt go tva vat iti siddhasādhanam
translated: And because the relation of qualifier and qualified, etc. are different, they are refuted.🔽The universal of conjunction is excluded from relation, because it is a universal, like the universal of cow. This is a futile rejoinder.

analyzed: jāteḥ prati vyakti niyata tvasya vakṣyamāṇa tvena ekasya saṃyoga tvasya saṃyoga antarāt vaya āvṛtteḥ
translated: Because the restriction of the universal to each individual will be stated, and because the single universal of conjunction is excluded from another conjunction.

analyzed: viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāvāt itas vyāvṛtteḥ ca
translated: And because it is excluded from the relation of qualifier and qualified, etc.

original: vivādādhyāsitā mṛt ghaṭasambaddhā dravyatvādākāśavaditi ca ghaṭāntarasaṃyogenārthāntaram /
analyzed: vivāda adhyāsitā mṛd ghaṭa sambaddhā dravya tvāt ākāśa vat iti ca ghaṭa antara saṃyogena artha antaram
translated: The clay that is the substratum of the dispute is connected with the pot, because it is a substance, like space. This is different, because of the connection with another pot.

analyzed: etad ghaṭa sambaddha iti nirdeśe pi etad ghaṭa sambandham a labdhvā vinaṣṭa dravye na aikāntikam
translated: Even if the statement is connected with this pot, it is inconclusive when the substance that has ceased to exist does not obtain the connection with this pot.

analyzed: tatra api paramparā sambandhaḥ sti iti ced
translated: If it is argued that there is a connection through a series even there,

analyzed: tarhi siddha sādhanam
translated: then it is a futile rejoinder.

analyzed: mṛd saṃyukta bhū talasya ghaṭa saṃyukta tvāt
translated: Because the ground connected with clay is connected with the pot.

analyzed: tantu paṭau nitya sambaddhau dravya tvāt ākāśa vat iti
translated: The yarn and the cloth are eternally connected, because they are substances, like space.

analyzed: dṛṣṭāntasya sādhya vikala tvāt apāstam
translated: This is refuted because the example lacks the probandum.

original: saṃyogaḥ svavyatiriktasambandhādbhinnaḥ prameyatvādghaṭavadityatra svavyatiriktapadena svānyonyābhāvavivakṣāyāṃ siddhasādhanatā /
analyzed: saṃyogaḥ sva vyatirikta sambandhāt bhinnaḥ prameya tvāt ghaṭa vat iti atra sva vyatirikta padena sva anyonya abhāva vivakṣāyām siddhasādhanatā
translated: In the argument Conjunction is different from the connection other than itself, because it is an object of knowledge, like a pot, if the term other than itself refers to the mutual absence of itself, then it is a futile rejoinder.

original: ekasya saṃyogasya saṃyogāntarādbhinnatvāt /🔽saṃyogatvarahitatvavivakṣāyāmaprasiddhaviśeṣaṇatvam /🔽viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyabhāvādinā tatsamādhāne tenaiva siddhasādhanam /
analyzed: ekasya saṃyogasya saṃyoga antarāt bhinna tvāt  saṃyoga tva rahita tva vivakṣāyām aprasiddha viśeṣaṇa tvam  viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāva ādinā tad samādhāne tena eva siddha sādhanam
translated: Because a single conjunction is different from another conjunction.🔽If it refers to the absence of the property of being a conjunction, then the qualifier is not well-known.🔽If it is resolved by the relation of qualifier and qualified, then it is a futile rejoinder by the same [reason].

analyzed: ayam saṃyogaḥ etad anya saṃyoga tva rahita sambandha anyaḥ meya tvāt ghaṭa vat ityādyāḥ ca
translated: This conjunction is different from the connection other than the property of being a different conjunction, because it is an object of knowledge, like a pot, and so on.

analyzed: ābhāsa samāna yogakṣema tvāt upekṣaṇīyāḥ
translated: These should be ignored because they are of the same nature as fallacious reasons.

analyzed: tat evam samavāye pramāṇa abhāvāt na bheda pakṣaḥ ṅgīkriyate
translated: Thus, since there is no means of valid knowledge in the case of inherence, the view of difference is not accepted.

original: nanūktamatrābhedapakṣo 'pi tarhi nāṅgīkāryo viśeṣe pramāṇābhāvāditi tatrāha yeneti //🔽yena pratyakṣasiddhena vyavahāro 'khilo bhavet /
analyzed: nanu uktam atra abheda pakṣaḥ tarhi nā aṅgīkāryaḥ viśeṣe pramāṇa abhāvāt iti tatra āha yena iti  yena pratyakṣa siddhena vyavahāraḥ khilaḥ bhavet
translated: But it has been said here that then the view of non-difference should also not be accepted, since there is no means of valid knowledge in the case of the particular. In that regard, he says:

analyzed: bhāva abhāva vibhāgena yam vinā na kathañcana
translated: By which the entire usage would be due to the distinction between existence and non-existence, without which it would not be possible in any way,

original: etaddṛśe viśeṣe 'smin ko dveṣo vādināṃ bhavet // / / //
analyzed: etad dṛśe viśeṣe smin kaḥ dveṣaḥ vādinām bhavet
translated: what enmity could there be of the disputants towards this kind of particular?

original: pratyakṣasiddhenetyanena pratyakṣasiddha iti labhyate /🔽yenākhilo vyavahāro bhavet /🔽yaṃ vinā na bhavedityanvayavyatirekābhyāṃ viśeṣakāryatvaṃ vyavahārasya darśayatā
analyzed: pratyakṣa siddhena iti anena pratyakṣa siddhaḥ iti labhyate  yena akhilaḥ vyavahāraḥ bhavet  yam vinā na bhavet iti anvaya vyatirekābhyām viśeṣa kārya tvam vyavahārasya darśayatā
translated: By established by perception, it is understood to be established by perception.🔽By which the entire usage would be due to the distinction between existence and non-existence, without which it would not be possible in any way, by the positive and negative concomitance, he shows that usage is the effect of the particular.

original: vyavahārānyathānupapattiśca viśeṣe pramāṇaṃ tadanaṅgīkāre vyavahārocchedaprasaṅgaścetyuktaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: vyavahāra anyathā anupapattiḥ ca viśeṣe pramāṇam tad anaṅgīkāre vyavahāra uccheda prasaṅgaḥ ca iti uktam bhavati
translated: By this, it is said that the means of valid knowledge in the particular is the impossibility of usage in any other way, and the consequence of the cessation of usage if it is not accepted.

analyzed: akhilaḥ iti asya eva vivaraṇam bhāva abhāva vibhāgena vidhi niṣedha bhedena eti
translated: The explanation of entire itself is by the distinction between existence and non-existence, i.e., by the distinction between affirmation and negation.

analyzed: dvividhaḥ tāvat iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder is of two kinds.

analyzed: nanu bheda pakṣe pi samavāya abhyupagamena akhilaḥ pi vyavahāraḥ ghaṭiṣyate
translated: But even in the view of difference, all practical usage will be possible by accepting inherence.

analyzed: atyanta abhede vyāvṛtti svīkāreṇa bheda abhedābhyām tu sutarām
translated: Even in absolute non-difference, by accepting exclusion, it is all the more possible by difference and non-difference.

analyzed: tat kim viśeṣeṇa iti atas uktam kathañcana iti
translated: Then what is the use of a particular [view]? To this it is said: And how?

original: etādṛśe sarvavyavahāranirvāhahetau ko dveṣaḥ kinnimittānupāditā /🔽pramāṇābhāvo hyanupādānanimittam /
analyzed: etādṛśe sarva vyavahāra nirvāha hetau kaḥ dveṣaḥ kinnimitta anupādi tā  pramāṇa abhāvaḥ hi anupādāna nimittam
translated: What is the hatred towards such a cause of the conduct of all business? What is the reason for not accepting it?🔽For the absence of a means of valid knowledge is the reason for not accepting it.

analyzed: sati pramāṇe na anupādāna nimittam asti iti arthaḥ
translated: When there is a means of valid knowledge, there is no reason for not accepting it - this is the meaning.

analyzed: mā bhūt vayavahāraḥ iti atas uktam vādinām iti
translated: Let there be no practical usage. To this it is said: of the disputants.

analyzed: upalakṣaṇam ca etat
translated: And this is a mere illustration.

original: jñātṛṇāṃ cetyapi draṣṭavyam /🔽viśiṣṭaviṣayābhijñābhivadanalakṣaṇo hyatra vyavahāraḥ prakṛtaḥ / /
analyzed: jñātṛṇām ca iti api draṣṭavyam  viśiṣṭa viṣaya abhijñā abhivadana lakṣaṇaḥ hi atra vyavahāraḥ prakṛtaḥ
translated: It should also be seen as [referring to] the knowers.🔽For the practical usage characterized by the expression of the knowledge of the distinguished object is the subject matter here.

analyzed: kiñca avayava avayavi ādi bhede pramāṇa abhāvāt ca tam parityajya abheda pakṣaḥ ṅgīkriyate
translated: Moreover, the view of non-difference is accepted, abandoning that [view of difference], because there is no means of valid knowledge of the difference between parts and wholes, etc.

analyzed: nanu uktam atra abhede pi pramāṇam na asti iti
translated: But here it has been said that there is no means of valid knowledge even in non-difference.

analyzed: tatra āha abhedena iti
translated: To this he says: By non-difference, etc.

analyzed: abhedena pratītiḥ ca kārya kāraṇa pūrvake
translated: And the cognition by non-difference is in what is preceded by cause and effect.

analyzed: abhāva ante padārthe smin sa viśeṣā avasīyate
translated: In this entity which has non-existence at the end, is ascertained with a particular [nature].

analyzed: iha api kārya kāraṇa grahaṇena avayavi avayavau ucyete
translated: Here also, by mentioning cause and effect, the whole and the parts are spoken of.

analyzed: pūrva śabdena guṇa guṇi ādikam
translated: By the word 'before', quality, substance, etc. are included.

analyzed: abhāva śabdena anyonya abhāvaḥ gṛhyate
translated: By the word 'non-existence', mutual non-existence is included.

analyzed: tasya eva dharmi abhinna tvāt
translated: Because that itself is not different from the substratum.

analyzed: yat vā abhāva tad dharmau anena upalakṣyete
translated: Or, non-existence and its properties are indicated by this.

analyzed: avasīyate sākṣiṇā
translated: Is ascertained by the witness.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: It is like this.

analyzed: tantu paṭa ādi viṣayā buddhiḥ atyanta bhinna ghaṭa paṭa ādi viṣaya buddhitaḥ vilakṣaṇā anuvyavasīyate uta avilakṣaṇā
translated: Is the cognition of cloth, yarn, etc. entirely different from the cognition of pot, cloth, etc.? Or is it not different?

analyzed: na tāvat dvitīyaḥ
translated: First of all, the second is not so.

analyzed: pratīti apalāpa anupapatteḥ
translated: Because denial of what is experienced is not possible.

analyzed: ādye katham abheda pratītiḥ na asti iti śakyam vaktum
translated: In the first case, how can it be said that there is no cognition of non-difference?

analyzed: sambandhena viśe
translated: By the relation, the difference is

analyzed: śiṣyate iti ced na
translated: concealed. If it is said that it is so, it is not so.

analyzed: kuṇḍa badara pratītitaḥ pi vailakṣaṇya anubhavāt
translated: Because even from the cognition of a pot and a jujube fruit, difference is experienced.

analyzed: sambandhinoḥ ayuta siddha tvāt tathā iti ced na
translated: If it is said that it is so because the relata are not simultaneously existent, it is not so.

analyzed: ādhāra ādheya bhāvena avasthāna samaye tasya akiñcitkara tvāt
translated: Because at the time of remaining in the relation of container and contained, that [relation] does nothing.

original: atastantupaṭayoḥ kuṇḍabadarayośca bhede sambandhe ca samāne kālāntarabhāvinaḥ sambandhavināśādeḥ sambandhivibhāgādervā pratyakṣapratītiṃ pratyupayogāyogā🔽bhāvādvailakṣaṇyaṃ nānubhūyeta /
analyzed: atas tantu paṭayoḥ kuṇḍa badarayoḥ ca bhede sambandhe ca samāne kāla antara bhāvinaḥ sambandha vināśa ādeḥ sambandhi vibhāga ādeḥ vā pratyakṣa pratītim pratyupayoga ayogāḥ  bhāvāt vailakṣaṇyam na anubhūyeta
translated: Therefore, in the difference and relation of yarn and cloth, and of pot and jujube fruit, which are the same, the difference would not be experienced, because the destruction of the relation occurring at a later time, or the separation of the relata, etc., are not fit to be useful for the direct perception of the cognition.

analyzed: anubhūyate ca tantu paṭa ādi buddhiḥ kuṇḍa badara ādi buddhiḥ iviḥ lakṣaṇā iti abheda viṣayā eva sā avasīyate
translated: But the cognition of yarn and cloth, etc., is experienced as different from the cognition of pot and jujube fruit, etc., so it is ascertained to have non-difference as its object.

original: kiñca paṭotpatteḥ prāgyāvantaṃ deśamavaṣṭabhya tantavastiṣṭhanti paṭo 'pi tāvantameva /
analyzed: kiñca paṭa utpatteḥ prāk yāvantam deśam avaṣṭabhya tantavaḥ tiṣṭhanti paṭaḥ pi tāvantam eva
translated: Moreover, before the cloth is produced, the yarns occupy as much space as the cloth does.

analyzed: na ca mūrtayoḥ samāna deśa tvam yujyate
translated: And it is not possible for two material objects to occupy the same space.

analyzed: tena jñāyate tantu a bhinnaḥ paṭaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, it is known that the cloth is non-different from the yarns.

analyzed: na ca avayava avayavinoḥ rūpa rasa ādi vat
translated: And the difference between the parts and the whole is not experienced like the difference between color and taste, etc.

analyzed: dvaitam anubhūyate ityādi abheda pramāṇam svayam ūhanīyam
translated: Thus, the proofs of non-difference should be understood by oneself.

analyzed: nanu abhedaḥ ced pratyakṣeṇa eva īkṣyate
translated: If non-difference is seen only by direct perception,

analyzed: tadā katham śuklaḥ paṭaḥ calati paṭa  ityādi sāmānādhikaraṇya ādi vyavahāraḥ
translated: then how is the usage of co-reference, such as the white cloth moves,🔽the cloth, etc., possible?

analyzed: tasya daṇḍī kuṇḍalī iti vat bheda viṣaya tvāt
translated: Because that refers to difference, like the man with a staff, the man with earrings, etc.

original: nahi pratītivirodhī vyavahāro bhavatītyata uktam saviśeṣeti //
analyzed: nahi pratīti virodhī vyavahāraḥ bhavati iti atas uktam sa viśeṣa iti
translated: For a usage that is contrary to cognition does not occur. Therefore it is said that it is with a qualifier.

analyzed: viśeṣeṇa viṣayeṇa upetā
translated: Endowed with a qualifier, an object.

analyzed: ayam arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: yatra kevalamabhedaḥ pratīyate na tatra sāmānādhikaraṇyavyavahāro bhavati /
analyzed: yatra kevalam abhedaḥ pratīyate na tatra sāmānādhikaraṇya vyavahāraḥ bhavati
translated: Where only non-difference is cognized, there the usage of co-reference does not occur.

original: yathā ghaṭaḥ kalaśa iti /🔽atra tvabhedaḥ pratīyamāno viśeṣeṇa sahita eva pratīyate /
analyzed: yathā ghaṭaḥ kalaśaḥ iti  atra tu abhedaḥ pratīyamānaḥ viśeṣeṇa sahitaḥ eva pratīyate
translated: As in the pot is the jar.🔽But here, the non-difference that is cognized is cognized along with a qualifier.

original: viśeṣaśca bhedapratinidhiḥ sāmānādhikaraṇyavyavahāraṃ prasūta iti / /🔽nanvabhedapratītimabhibhūya viśeṣapratītiḥ svakāryaṃ kathaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: viśeṣaḥ ca bheda pratinidhiḥ sāmānādhikaraṇya vyavahāram prasūtaḥ iti  nanu abheda pratītim abhibhūya viśeṣa pratītiḥ sva kāryam katham kuryāt
translated: And the qualifier, which is a representative of difference, gives rise to the usage of co-reference.🔽But how could the cognition of the qualifier, overpowering the cognition of non-difference, perform its own function?

original: karoti cedabhedapratītirapi viśeṣapratītimabhibhūya svakāryaṃ kathaṃ na syāt /
analyzed: karoti ced abheda pratītiḥ api viśeṣa pratītim abhibhūya sva kāryam katham na syāt
translated: And if it does perform it, why should not the cognition of non-difference also, overpowering the cognition of the qualifier, perform its own function?

original: maivam /🔽nahi pratītirastītyeva vyavahāraḥ kintu prayojane 'pi sati /
analyzed: mā evam  nahi pratītiḥ asti iti eva vyavahāraḥ kintu prayojane sati
translated: Not so.🔽For usage is not just on the basis of cognition alone, but also on the basis of a purpose.

analyzed: prayojanam ca sāmānādhikaraṇya vyavahāreṇa eva bahulam loka vedayoḥ
translated: And the purpose is mostly in worldly and Vedic usage itself through the usage of co-reference.

original: yadā tvabhedavyavahāraḥ prayojanavāṃstadā so 'pi dṛśyata eva yathā vijñānamānandaṃ brahmetyādi / /
analyzed: yadā tu abheda vyavahāraḥ prayojanavān tadā saḥ dṛśyate eva yathā vijñānam ānandam brahma ityādi
translated: But when the usage of non-difference has a purpose, then that also is seen, just as in statements like consciousness is bliss, Brahman is, etc.

analyzed: yat vā viśeṣaḥ pratyakṣa arthāpatti siddhaḥ iti uktam
translated: Or, it has been said that the distinction is established by perception and presumption.

analyzed: tat katham iti atas pratyakṣa siddha tām tāvat upapādayati abhedena iti
translated: How is that? Therefore, he explains the establishment by perception: by non-difference, etc.

analyzed: anukta samuccaya arthaḥ caśabdaḥ
translated: And the word and is for including what is not mentioned.

original: padārtha ityekavacanaṃ jātiviṣayam asti yatastasmātsā saviśeṣāvasīyata iti yojanā /
analyzed: padārthaḥ iti ekavacanam jāti viṣayam asti yatas tasmāt sā sa viśeṣā avasīyate iti yojanā
translated: The singular object refers to the universal. Since it exists, therefore it is ascertained to have a distinction. This is the construction.

analyzed: tatas ca ayam arthaḥ
translated: And from this, this is the meaning:

analyzed: asti tāvat avayava avayavi ādi padārtha sārthe bhedena pratītiḥ
translated: There is indeed the cognition of the collection of word-meanings like parts and wholes, etc., by non-difference.

analyzed: syāḥ vyāvṛtta tayā adhyavasāyāt
translated: Because it is ascertained as distinguished from the cognition of a pot, a jujube fruit, etc.

analyzed: na ca abhedam antareṇa vyāvṛtti hetuḥ asti
translated: And there is no cause of distinction without non-difference.

original: ato 'sati nimittāntare sammatabhedavastvantarapratītito vyāvṛtteyamabheda eva viśrāmyatīti /
analyzed: atas sati nimitta antare sammata bheda vastu antara pratītitaḥ vyāvṛttā iyam abhedaḥ eva viśrāmyati iti
translated: Therefore, in the absence of another cause, this distinction, which is distinguished from the cognition of another different thing that is agreed upon, rests only on non-difference.

analyzed: asti ca tathā api sāmānādhikaraṇya ādi vyavahāraḥ
translated: And even so, there is the usage of co-reference, etc.

original: tatra yadīyamabhedamātraviṣayā syāttadā na sāmānādhikaraṇyādivyavahāraṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: tatra yadi iyam abheda mātra viṣayā syāt tadā na sāmānādhikaraṇya ādi vyavahāram kuryāt
translated: If it had only non-difference as its object, then it would not make the usage of co-reference etc.

analyzed: ghaṭaḥ kalaśaḥ iti vyavahāra adarśanāt
translated: Because the usage the pot and the jar is not seen.

analyzed: tatas jñāyate dhikaḥ pi viṣayaḥ vidyate iti
translated: Therefore it is known that it has an additional object.

analyzed: na ca bhedaḥ sau iti vācyam  bheda abheda vāde pi antaḥ viśeṣasya aṅgīkārya tvāt
translated: And it should not be said that that is difference.🔽Even in the doctrine of difference and non-difference, the particular must be admitted in the end.

analyzed: tathā ca iyam abheda pratītiḥ indriya jā sa viśeṣā avasīyate iti
translated: And thus this cognition of non-difference is produced by the senses and is cognized as having a particular.

analyzed: prāk uktam samavāye
translated: It was said earlier that a particular must be accepted in inherence.

analyzed: kriyate iti tat na tāvat eva
translated: It is done, but not just that.

original: kintu sarveṣvapi padārtheṣviti darśayanviśeṣasya vyavahārānyathānupapattisiddhatāṃ copapādayati sāmānyādīti //
analyzed: kintu sarveṣu api padārtheṣu iti darśayan viśeṣasya vyavahāra anyathā anupapatti siddha tām ca upapādayati sāmānya ādi iti
translated: But it is shown that it is in all things, and the fact that the particular is established by the non-applicability of usage in another way is also explained by in the categories like universals etc.

analyzed: sāmānya ādi padārtheṣu tad niṣṭha tva ādayaḥ khilāḥ
translated: All the properties like being based on that etc.

original: kathaṃ dharmā nivāryante vastvaikye 'pi hi vādibhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: katham dharmāḥ nivāryante vastu aikye hi vādibhiḥ
translated: How are they prevented even by the proponents in the case of the identity of the substance, in the categories like universals?

analyzed: tad niṣṭha tva ādayaḥ vyakti niṣṭha tva ādayaḥ
translated: Being based on that etc. means being based on the individual etc.

analyzed: katham iti ākṣepe
translated: How is in the sense of a question.

analyzed: vastu aikye pi dharma aikye pi
translated: Even in the case of the identity of the substance, even in the case of the identity of the property.

original: kuto na nivāryata ityata uktam vādibhiriti //
analyzed: kutas na nivāryate iti atas uktam vādibhiḥ iti
translated: Why is it not prevented? To this it is said: by the disputants.

analyzed: avisaṃvādi vyavahāra siddha tvāt iti yāvat
translated: That is, because it is established in non-contradictory usage.

analyzed: etat eva prapañcayati kāryasya iti
translated: This is elaborated:
The fact that an effect is located in that and that, the pervasiveness etc. of qualities and so on,

analyzed: katham viśeṣaḥ na eva asti
translated: how can there be no difference at all?

analyzed: asti tāvat avayavinaḥ vayava niṣṭha tvam nāma dharmaḥ
translated: To begin with, there is the property of the whole being located in the parts.

analyzed: guṇānām keṣāṃcid rūpa ādīnām āśraya vyāpi tvam keṣāṃcid saṃyoga ādīnām pradeśa vṛtti tvam
translated: Of qualities, some like color etc. are pervasive in their substratum, some like conjunction etc. are restricted to a part.

analyzed: rūpa ādīnām udbhūta tvam
translated: Color etc. are manifest.

original: sarveṣāṃ caturviṃśatitvam karmaṇaśca āśrayavyāpitvamanityatvaṃ pañcatvaṃ mūrtaniṣṭhatvam /
analyzed: sarveṣām caturviṃśati tvam karmaṇaḥ ca āśraya vyāpi tvam anitya tvam pañcatvam mūrta niṣṭha tvam
translated: And all have twenty-four kinds. Action is pervasive in its substratum, impermanent, fivefold, and located in the corporeal.

analyzed: sāmānyasya api dravya guṇa karma niṣṭha tvam
translated: Universals also are located in substances, qualities and actions.
They are eternal, pervasive,

analyzed: dvividha tvam iti ati bahulaḥ yam padārtha dharma samūhaḥ
translated: and twofold. This is the very extensive group of properties of objects.

analyzed: na ca ayam āśrayataḥ bhinnaḥ eva iti yuktam
translated: And it is not right to say that this is entirely different from the substratum.

analyzed: asti ca dharma dharmya ādi vyavahāraḥ
translated: And there is the usage of property and possessor of property etc.

analyzed: tantuṣu paṭaḥ pagha
translated: The cloth is in the threads.

analyzed: ṭaḥ na bhavati ghapaṭaḥ ityādiḥ
translated: The jar is not in the cloth, the cloth is not in the jar, and so on.

original: sa cāyamatyantābhede 'nupapadyamānaḥ svopapādakaṃ viśeṣamavagamayatīti sarvapadārtheṣu kathaṃ viśeṣo naivāsti / /
analyzed: sa ca ayam atyanta abhede sva upapādakam viśeṣam avagamayati iti sarva padārtheṣu katham viśeṣaḥ na eva asti
translated: And this [difference] being impossible in the case of absolute non-difference, makes us understand the difference [which is the cause of the impossibility], and thus how can there be no difference at all among all the categories?

analyzed: satyam
translated: True.

original: santyeva dravyādiṣu saptasvapi padārtheṣu te te dharmāḥ /
analyzed: santi eva dravya ādiṣu saptasu api padārtheṣu te te dharmāḥ
translated: The properties of the seven categories, substance and the rest, do exist.

analyzed: kinnāma āśrayataḥ bhinnāḥ eva
translated: But they are different only from their substrata.

original: tathāca tatsambandhanibandhanatayaivopapadyamāno vyavahāraḥ sarvapadārtheṣu na viśeṣamākṣeptumalamityāśayena śaṅkate sa ceti // /
analyzed: tathā ca tad sambandha nibandhanatayā eva upapadyamānaḥ vyavahāraḥ sarva padārtheṣu na viśeṣam ākṣeptum alam iti āśayena śaṅkate sa ca iti
translated: And thus the usage, which is possible only on the basis of the relation with them, cannot bring about any difference among all the categories. With this idea in mind, he raises the doubt with the words 'And that' (in the commentary).

analyzed: sa ca paraḥ yadi
translated: And if that property is another (different from the substance, etc.),

analyzed: na kevalam guṇa ādi dravya āditaḥ bhinnam
translated: It is not only that the quality, etc. are different from substance, etc.

original: kintu saḥ tattanniṣṭhatvādidharmaśca aparaḥ svāśrayādbhinno yadyaṅgīkriyata ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: kintu saḥ tad tad niṣṭha tva ādi dharmaḥ ca aparaḥ svāśrayāt bhinnaḥ yadi aṅgīkriyate iti arthaḥ
translated: But if that property, such as being dependent on that and that, is accepted as another, different from its substratum, that is the meaning.

analyzed: nirākaroti ṣaṣ iti  ṣaṣ padārtha atirekaḥ syāt
translated: He refutes [the view] with the words 'six' (in the commentary).🔽There would be an excess over the six categories.

analyzed: tarhi dharmāṇām ṣaḍbhyaḥ padārthebhyaḥ tirekaḥ syāt
translated: Then there would be an excess of properties over the six categories.

original: tathāca ṣaḍeva padārthā sati niyamo bhajyeteti /
analyzed: tathā ca ṣaṣ eva padārthā sati niyamaḥ bhajyeta iti
translated: And thus the restriction to only six categories would be violated.

original: nanu svāśrayato vibhinnā api dharmā na ṣaḍbhyaḥ
analyzed: nanu sva āśrayataḥ vibhinnāḥ api dharmāḥ na ṣaḍbhyaḥ
translated: But even though the properties are different from their substrata, they are not different from the six.

analyzed: ṭ pada arthebhyaḥ tiricyante
translated: [They are] not separate from the categories.

analyzed: kintu te eva anyonya viśeṣaṇībhūtāḥ dharmāḥ iti ucyante
translated: But they are said to be the very same [categories] that become qualifying factors of each other.

original: yathā'hayadyapi dharmāḥ ṣaṭpadārthebhyo na vyatiricyante /🔽kintu ta evānyonyāpekṣayā dharmadharmiṇaśca bhavanti' / itrata /🔽anyatrāpiteṣāṃ dharmāsta eva parasparaṃ viśeṣaṇībhūtāḥ' / iti /
analyzed: yathā āha yadi api dharmāḥ ṣaṣ padārthebhyaḥ na vyatiricyante  kintu te eva anyonya apekṣayā dharma dharmiṇaḥ ca bhavanti  anyatra api teṣām dharmāḥ te eva parasparam viśeṣaṇībhūtāḥ iti
translated: As it is said: Although the categories are not separate from the six categories,🔽but they are the very same [categories] that become the qualified and the qualifier in relation to each other.🔽And elsewhere it is said: Those very [categories] are the qualifying factors of each other.

analyzed: tat katham niyama bhaṅgaḥ iti
translated: How then is there a violation of the rule?

analyzed: mā evam
translated: No, that is not so.

analyzed: tad niṣṭha tva ādīnām ṣaṭsu padārtheṣu antar bhāvayitum aśakya tvāt
translated: Because being based, etc. cannot be included among the six categories.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: It is like this.

analyzed: āśrita tvam ca anyatra nitya dravyebhyaḥ
translated: And it is accepted that being based is on something other than the eternal substances.

analyzed: iti abhyupagatam kārya dravya guṇa karma sāmānya viśeṣa samavāyānām avayava ādi niṣṭha tvam na tāvat dravya ādikam
translated: The fact of being based on parts, etc. of the produced substances, qualities, actions, universals, particulars, and inherence cannot be a substance, etc.

analyzed: guṇa ādi vṛtti anupapatteḥ
translated: Because it is not possible for it to occur in qualities, etc.

analyzed: nā api samavāyaḥ tasya sva vṛtti anupapatteḥ
translated: Nor is it inherence, because it is not possible for it to occur in itself.

analyzed: kiñca ādhārya ādhāra bhūtayoḥ sambandhaḥ samavāyaḥ iṣyate
translated: Moreover, the relation between what is supported and what supports is accepted to be inherence.

original: tathāca kathaṃ sa evādhāritvamādhāratvaṃ ca syāt /
analyzed: tathā ca katham saḥ eva ādhāri tvam ādhāra tvam ca syāt
translated: And how could that very [inherence] be the fact of being supported and the fact of being a support?

analyzed: tathā rūpa ādīnām āśraya vyāpi tvam na dravya ādiṣu antarbhavati
translated: Similarly, the pervasiveness of form etc. over their substratum does not fall under substance etc.

analyzed: teṣām guṇa vṛtti vā asambhavāt
translated: Because the functioning of qualities is not possible in them.

analyzed: samavāyaḥ tu ukta rītyā nirastaḥ
translated: And inherence has been refuted in the manner stated.

analyzed: api ca vṛtti tva mātram samavāyaḥ
translated: Moreover, inherence is merely the state of being present.

analyzed: vyāpya vṛtti tvam tu atiriktam
translated: But the state of being present in the pervaded should be either defined or expressed as something distinct.

analyzed: kṛtsne sva āśraye samavāyaḥ tat iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that inherence is the state of being present in the whole substratum, that is not so.

analyzed: dravyasya asamudita tvena kṛtsna tva ādi anavakāśāt
translated: Because the whole cannot be applied to substance, which is not a collection.

analyzed: svabhāvena saha anavasthānam vyāpya vṛtti tvam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the state of being present in the pervaded is the non-coexistence with its own nature, that is not so.

analyzed: tasya api antar bhāvya tvāt
translated: Because that also has to be included.

analyzed: sau iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that it is non-existence, that is not so.

analyzed: nirākariṣyamāṇa tvāt
translated: Because it will be refuted.

analyzed: evam saṃyoga ādīnām pradeśa vṛtti tvam nirastam
translated: Thus the state of being present in a part is refuted in the case of conjunction etc.

analyzed: udbhūta tvam ca na jāti viśeṣaḥ
translated: And the state of being manifest is not a particular universal.

analyzed: rūpa tva ādinā para apara bhāva anupapatteḥ
translated: Because the relation of higher and lower is not possible with color etc.

original: yadi hi rūpatvaṃ paraṃ syāttadā sparśasyodbhūtatvaṃ na syāt /
analyzed: yadi hi rūpa tvam param syāt tadā sparśasya udbhūta tvam na syāt
translated: For if color were higher, then the state of being manifest would not be possible for touch.

original: yadi codbhūtatvaṃ paraṃ bhavettadā sarvamapi rūpamudbhūtamiti cakṣurāderapi pratītiḥ syāt / /
analyzed: yadi ca udbhūta tvam param bhavet tadā sarvam api rūpam udbhūtam iti cakṣuḥ ādeḥ api pratītiḥ syāt
translated: And if the state of being manifest were higher, then all color would be manifest, and there would be cognition even of the eye etc.

analyzed: caturviṃśati tvam ca na saṅkhayā
translated: And the number twenty-four is not a number.

analyzed: guṇānām nirguṇa tva aṅgīkārāt
translated: Because the qualities are accepted as being without qualities.

analyzed: upacāraḥ yam iti ced na
translated: If it is said that this is a figurative usage, it is not so.

analyzed: nimitta abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no reason.

analyzed: na tāvat eka athar samavāyaḥ nimittam
translated: First, the reason is not the combination of one meaning.

analyzed: dravye caturviṃśati tva niyama abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no restriction to twenty-four in substances.

analyzed: pratyekam rūpa ādiṣu tad prasaṅgāt ca
translated: And because that would follow for each, such as form, etc.

analyzed: aparyāya caturviṃśati śabda vācya tvam iti ced na
translated: If it is said that it is the being denoted by the word twenty-four in an unexampled way, it is not so.

analyzed: śabde pi caturviṃśati tva abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no twenty-four even in the word.

analyzed: caturviṃśati puruṣa uccārita aparyāya śabda vācya tvam iti ced na
translated: If it is said that it is the being denoted by the unexampled word uttered by twenty-four persons, it is not so.

analyzed: badhira ādīnām rūpa ādiṣu saṅkhaya avyavahāra abhāva prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would follow that the deaf, etc. would not have the convention of number for form, etc.

analyzed: evam anyeṣām api dharmāṇām antarbhāvaḥ nirasanīyaḥ
translated: In the same way, the inclusion of other dharmas should be refuted.

analyzed: kaścid āha
translated: Someone says:

analyzed: dharma padārthaḥ bhāve ntarbhavati iti
translated: The meaning of the word dharma is included in non-existence.

analyzed: tat asat
translated: That is not so.

analyzed: niṣedha buddhi bodhya tva abhāvāt  abhāve bhāva anaṅgīkāreṇa tad dharmāṇām abhāva tva ayogāt ca
translated: Because it is not to be known by the cognition of negation.🔽And because the attributes of non-existence are not suitable to be non-existence due to not accepting non-existence in non-existence.

analyzed: dravya ādi ṣaṣ lakṣaṇa śanyatama rāhityam abhāva tvam
translated: Non-existence is the absence of one of the six characteristics such as substance, etc.

analyzed: na tu niṣedha buddhi bodhya tvam iti ced na
translated: If it is said that it is not the being to be known by the cognition of negation, it is not so.

original: lokapratītimavadhūya svakalpanādaraṇe dravyameva bhāvāstallakṣaṇarahito 'bhāva ityapi kalpanāprasaṅgāt /🔽atastattanniṣṭhatvādayo dravyādidharmāstadātmāna evāṅgīkāryāḥ /
analyzed: loka pratītim avadhūya sva kalpanā ādaraṇe dravyam eva bhāvāḥ tad lakṣaṇa rahitaḥ bhāvaḥ iti api kalpanā prasaṅgāt  atas tad tad niṣṭha tva ādayaḥ dravya ādi dharmāḥ tad ātmānaḥ eva aṅgīkāryāḥ
translated: If you reject the common notion and accept your own imagination, then it would follow that the entities are substances alone, and non-existence is that which lacks the characteristics of substance.🔽Therefore, the properties of substance etc., such as having that and that as their substratum, should be accepted as being the very selves of those [properties].

analyzed: tathā ca āha bhāvasya svarūpam eva avasthā bhedena astitvam jñeya tvam abhidheya tvam ca ucyate iti
translated: And thus it is said: The very form of non-existence is said to be existence, knowability, and nameability in the different states.

analyzed: na ca viśeṣam apahāya avasthā bhedaḥ śakya nirūpaṇaḥ
translated: And a different state cannot be determined without a difference in the [property's] particulars.

analyzed: nanu dharmāḥ dharmitaḥ bhinnāḥ eva
translated: But the properties are indeed different from the property-possessor.

analyzed: na ca ukta doṣaḥ
translated: And the stated fault does not arise.

original: naiyāyikādibhiḥ paramāṇvārambhavādibhiḥ ṣaḍeva padārthā iti niyamasyānaṅgīkṛtatvāt /
analyzed: naiyāyika ādibhiḥ paramāṇu ārambha vādibhiḥ ṣaṭ eva padārthāḥ iti niyamasya anaṅgīkṛta tvāt
translated: Because the Naiyāyikas and others who advocate the creation from atoms do not accept the restriction that there are only six categories,

analyzed: dharma padārthasya pṛthak aṅgīkṛta tvāt ca
translated: and because the category of properties is accepted separately.

original: tathāca bhinnadharmasaṃsargavaśātsarvavyavahāropapattau na tadanyathānupapattyā viśeṣasiddhirityata āha padārtheti //
analyzed: tathā ca bhinna dharma saṃsarga vaśāt sarva vyavahāra upapattau na tad anyathā anupapattyā viśeṣa siddhiḥ iti atas āha padārtha iti
translated: And thus, when all practical usage is possible by the connection of different properties, the establishment of the particulars is not by the non-applicability of anything else. Therefore he says:

analyzed: padārtha aniyame pi hi
translated: Even if there is no restriction on the categories,

analyzed: dharmasya dharma santānāt anavasthā karaḥ bhavet
translated: the property would cause an infinite regress due to the succession of properties.

original: padārthānāṃ ṣaḍeveti niyamābhāvapakṣe 'pi hi yasmāddharmasya dharmasantānādanavasthāyā ākaro bhavedayaṃ pakṣaḥ /
analyzed: padārthānām ṣaṭ eva iti niyama abhāva pakṣe hi yasmāt dharmasya dharma santānāt anavasthāyāḥ ākaraḥ bhavet ayam pakṣaḥ
translated: Even in the view that there are only six categories of things, this view would be a source of infinite regress, because the property of a property would lead to an infinite series of properties.

original: tasmāddharmadharmāṇāmāśrayābhede 'vaśyamaṅgīkārye tatra dharmadharmyādivyavahārānyathānupapattyā viśeṣo 'ṅgīkaraṇīya iti yojyam /
analyzed: tasmāt dharma dharmāṇām āśraya abhede vaśyam aṅgīkārye tatra dharma dharmya ādi vyavahāra anyathā anupapattyā viśeṣaḥ ṅgīkaraṇīyaḥ iti yojyam
translated: Therefore, when the non-difference of the substratum of the property and the property is necessarily accepted, the distinction must be accepted as the only way to explain the usage of the terms 'property', 'property-possessor', etc. This is how it should be connected.

analyzed: khaniḥ ākaraḥ
translated: A mine is a source.

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is being said.

analyzed: dharma padārtham dravya ādibhyaḥ bhinnam abhyupagacchan praṣṭavyaḥ
translated: One who accepts the category of property to be different from substance, etc. should be asked:

analyzed: astitva ādi dharmeṣu api astitva ādikam asti na vā
translated: Is existence, etc. also present in the properties of existence, etc. or not?

analyzed: na iti pakṣe nubhava virodhaḥ
translated: If the view is that it is not, then it contradicts experience.

analyzed: astitvam na jñeyam na abhidheyam iti sva kriyā virodhaḥ ca
translated: And there would be a contradiction in one's own action if one says that existence should not be known or spoken of.

analyzed: anyathā dravya ādiṣu api tad abhāva āpattiḥ
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that existence, etc. are absent even in substance, etc.

analyzed: ādye tad āśrayataḥ bhinnam abhinnam vā
translated: If the first is accepted, is it different or non-different from its substratum?

analyzed: ādye tatra api astitva ādi antaram iti anavasthā syāt
translated: If the first, then there would be an infinite regress, as existence, etc. would be present there also.

analyzed: dvitīye tu asti tāvat tatra api dharma dharmya ādi vyavahāraḥ
translated: If the second, then there is indeed the usage of the terms 'property', 'property-possessor', etc. there also.

analyzed: sa ca an upapadyamānaḥ viśeṣam gamayati iti
translated: And that, being inexplicable, implies a distinction.

original: kiñca dharmagatā dharmā yadi āśrayābhinnāstadā kiṃ dravyādigatāstitvādidharmairaparāddham /
analyzed: kiñca dharma gatāḥ dharmāḥ yadi āśraya abhinnāḥ tadā kim dravya ādi gata astitva ādi dharmaiḥ aparāddham
translated: Moreover, if the properties of dharma are not different from the substratum, then what wrong have the properties such as existence etc. of substance etc. done,

analyzed: yena te dravya āditaḥ bhidyeran
translated: by which they are distinguished from substance etc.?

analyzed: yogakṣema sāmyāt
translated: Because of the equality of yoga and kshema.

original: tatasteṣāmeva dravyādyabhede sati punarvyavahārānyathānupapattyā dravyādiṣveva viśeṣasiddhiḥ iti / /
analyzed: tatas teṣām eva dravya ādi abhede sati punar vyavahāra anyathā anupapattyā dravya ādiṣu eva viśeṣa siddhiḥ iti
translated: Therefore, when there is non-difference of those very [properties] from substance etc., the establishment of the distinction in substance etc. is again due to the impossibility of the usage being otherwise.

analyzed: nanu asti eva dravya ādi dharmeṣu astitva ādiṣu api astitva ādikam
translated: But existence etc. do indeed exist in the properties of substance etc., and existence etc. also exist in them.

analyzed: tat ca āśrayataḥ bhinnam eva
translated: And that is indeed different from the substratum.

analyzed: na ca evam dharmasya anavadhika dharma santānāt anavasthā doṣaḥ
translated: And thus, for the property, there is no fault of infinite regress due to the series of properties without limit.

analyzed: utpatti jñapti pratibandhaka tva abhāvena adoṣa tvāt
translated: Because it is not a fault due to the absence of the cause of the obstruction of origination and manifestation.

analyzed: yathā āhuḥ mūla kṣaya karīm prāhuḥ anavasthām hi dūṣaṇam iti
translated: As they say: They declare the fault of infinite regress to be the one that destroys the root.

analyzed: yad artham uttara uttara anusaraṇam tad mūlam utpattiḥ jñaptiḥ vā
translated: The root is either origination or manifestation, for the sake of which there is the pursuit of one after another.

original: tato bhinnanimittatayopapadyamāno vyavahāro na viśeṣamākṣeptumalamityata āha sāmānyasyāpīti //
analyzed: tatas bhinna nimitta tayā upapadyamānaḥ vyavahāraḥ na viśeṣam ākṣeptum alam iti atas āha sāmānyasya api iti
translated: The usage, which is established as having a different cause from that, is not able to bring about a distinction. Therefore he says: Even of the universal...

analyzed: sāmānyasya api sāmānyam guṇasya api guṇaḥ hi atas
translated: The universal also has a universal, and the quality also has a quality, therefore,

analyzed: na aṅgīkṛtaḥ  sāmānyasya go tva ādeḥ
translated: Not accepted...🔽Of the universal such as cowness.

analyzed: sāmānyam sattā lakṣaṇam
translated: The universal characterized by existence.

analyzed: guṇasya ca rūpa ādeḥ
translated: And of the quality such as color.

analyzed: saṅkhaya apṛthaktava ādi guṇaḥ anavasthā bhayāt eva hi na aṅgīkṛtaḥ
translated: The quality such as number, separateness, etc. is not accepted only out of fear of infinite regress.

analyzed: ayam āśayaḥ
translated: This is the idea.

analyzed: sāmānyasya api sāmānyam tāvat pareṇa na aṅgīkṛtam
translated: Even the universal is not accepted by the opponent as having another universal.

analyzed: tathā guṇasya api guṇaḥ na aṅgīkṛtaḥ
translated: Similarly, the quality is not accepted as having another quality.

analyzed: tat kasmāt iti vaktavyam
translated: Why is that? It should be said.

analyzed: na tāvat pratīti abhāvāt
translated: Not just because of the absence of cognition.

original: sadgotvaṃ caturviṃśatiguṇā rūpādrasaḥ pṛthagiti pratibhāsasya durapahnavatvāt /
analyzed: sat go tvam caturviṃśati guṇāḥ rūpāt rasaḥ pṛthak iti pratibhāsasya durapahnava tvāt
translated: The appearance of existent cowness, the twenty-four qualities, color, taste, separateness, etc. is hard to deny.

original: naca na sadgotvamityādi bādhakamasti yena pratītasyāpi parityāgaḥ /
analyzed: na ca na sat go tvam ityādi bādhakam asti yena pratītasya api parityāgaḥ
translated: And there is no contradictory cognition such as it is not existent cowness, etc. by which even what is cognized should be abandoned.

analyzed: go tvam na sattāvat apara sāmānya śūnyatvāt viśeṣa vat
translated: Cowness is not like existence because it is devoid of another universal, like a particular.

analyzed: guṇāḥ na guṇavantaḥ dravya tvāt kriyā vat ityādi bādhakam asti iti ced na
translated: The qualities do not possess qualities because they are not substances, like action. If it is argued that there is such a contradictory cognition, it is not so.

analyzed: vipakṣe bādhaka abhāvena aprayojaka tvāt
translated: Because in the absence of a contradiction in the contrary, it is not a proper reason.

analyzed: dṛṣṭāntayoḥ ca
translated: And in the examples,

analyzed: sādhya vikala tvāt ca
translated: because the probandum is absent.

original: yadi gotvādau sattā syāttadā sattāyāmapi syāt /
analyzed: yadi go tva ādau sattā syāt tadā sattāyām api syāt
translated: If cowness etc. had existence, then it would also exist in existence.

analyzed: tathā ca ātma āśraya tvam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that this leads to self-dependence, it is not so.

analyzed: sattā antara tva upapatteḥ
translated: Because the existence of another is possible.

analyzed: kiñca pratīteḥ kim ātma āśraya tā kariṣyati
translated: Moreover, what will self-dependence do to the cognition?

analyzed: anyathā prameya tva ādīnām kevala anvayi tvam na syāt
translated: Otherwise, the universal of 'cognizability' etc. would not be a mere universal.

analyzed: ātma āśraya bhaya ādi atas prameya tva ādi vyāvṛttiḥ tasya eva vipakṣa tvāt
translated: Because, out of fear of self-dependence, there is exclusion of 'cognizability' etc., as that itself is the contradictory.

analyzed: uktam ca katham svavṛttiḥ iṣyā ced yathā anyatra iti gṛhyatām
translated: And it has been said - How can it be accepted as operating on itself? It should be accepted as operating elsewhere.

original: pramāṇaṃ śaraṇaṃ vṛttau na bhinnābhinnateyatā' / iti /
analyzed: pramāṇam śaraṇam vṛttau na iti
translated: The means of knowledge is the refuge in operation, not by being different or non-different.

analyzed: guṇānām api guṇavat tve dravya lakṣaṇa yogāt dravya tā āpattiḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that qualities also having qualities would become substances because they possess the definition of substances, it is not so.

analyzed: pratītim anuruddhaya lakṣaṇa antarasya kartavya tvāt
translated: Because another definition should be made in accordance with the cognition.

original: tasmātsāmānye sāmānyaṃ guṇe ca guṇaḥ anavasthābhayādeva nāṅgīkriyata ityeva vaktavyam /
analyzed: tasmāt sāmānye sāmānyam guṇe ca guṇaḥ anavasthā bhayāt eva nā aṅgīkriyate iti eva vaktavyam
translated: Therefore, it should be said that the universal of universals and the quality of qualities are not accepted only out of fear of infinite regress.

analyzed: yathā āha vyakteḥ abhedaḥ tulya tvam saṅkaraḥ thā anavasthitiḥ
translated: As it is said - Non-difference from the individual, sameness, confusion, and infinite regress.

analyzed: rūpa hāniḥ asambandhaḥ jāti bādhaka saṅgrahaḥ iti
translated: Loss of form, lack of relation - this is the collection of objections to universals.

analyzed: na ca anavacchinnā sāmānya paramparā guṇa paramparā ca utpatti jñapti pratibandhe hetuḥ
translated: And an unbroken series of universals and a series of qualities are not the cause of the obstruction of the cognition of origination.

original: tathāca yathā sā dūṣaṇaṃ tathā prakṛtāpi dūṣaṇameva /
analyzed: tathā ca yathā sā dūṣaṇam tathā prakṛtā api dūṣaṇam eva
translated: And just as that is a fault, so is the one under discussion also a fault.

original: na cetsāpi na syāditi sāmānyāderapi sāmānyādyaṅgīkāryaṃ syāt /
analyzed: na ced sā api na syāt iti sāmānya ādeḥ api sāmānya ādi aṅgīkāryam syāt
translated: If it were not so, that also would not be so. Therefore, even universals etc. would have to be accepted as having universals etc.

analyzed: yadi kathañcid jñapti pratibandhaka tvam tatra vyutpadyeta
translated: If somehow the obstruction of cognition were to be established there,

analyzed: tarhi vayam api atra tat vyutpādayiṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: then we also will establish that here.

analyzed: yadi kaścid vaiyātyāt brūyāt
translated: If someone out of ignorance were to say:

original: astyeva sāmānyasyāpi sāmānyaṃ guṇasyāpi guṇo nirbādhapratītisiddhatvāt /
analyzed: asti eva sāmānyasya api sāmānyam guṇasya api guṇaḥ nirbādha pratīti siddha tvāt
translated: The universal of the universal exists, and the quality of the quality is established by unobstructed cognition.

analyzed: utpatti jñapti apratibandha hetoḥ anavasthāyāḥ doṣa tva ayogāt
translated: Because the cause of the obstruction of the origination and cognition is not a fault in the form of infinite regress.

analyzed: atas na etad nyāyena dharma paramparā anavasthā bhayāt nivāraṇīyā iti
translated: Therefore, by this reasoning, it should not be rejected out of fear of the infinite regress of the series of properties.

analyzed: tatra āha sa ca iti
translated: To that, he says that etc.

original: sa ca yadi nānavasthā kvacid bhavet // / / //
analyzed: sa ca yadi na anavasthā kvacid bhavet
translated: And that would not be an infinite regress if it existed anywhere.

analyzed: sa ca guṇasya api guṇaḥ
translated: And that is the quality of the quality.

original: caśabdātsāmānyasyāpi sāmānyaṃ yadyaṅgīkriyate tadā brūmo nānavasthā kvacidbhavediti / /
analyzed: caśabdāt sāmānyasya api sāmānyam yadi aṅgīkriyate tadā brūmaḥ nā anavasthā kvacid bhavet iti
translated: From the word ca (and), if the universal of the universal is accepted, then we say that it would not be an infinite regress if it existed anywhere.

analyzed: ayam āśayaḥ
translated: This is the idea:

analyzed: evam vadan kvacid anavasthā dūṣaṇam aṅgīkaroti na vā iti vācyam
translated: Thus speaking, it should be said whether he sometimes accepts the fault of infinite regress or not.

analyzed: naced dūṣaṇa antaram api na aṅgīkuryāt
