translated: If not, he should not accept any other fault either.

analyzed: aviśeṣāt
translated: Because there is no distinction.

analyzed: tathā ca kathāyām na adhikārī syāt
translated: And thus he would not be a participant in the debate.

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: The first is not so.
Because if the infinite regress of the general qualities of dharma is not a fault, then even the one under consideration cannot be a fault.

analyzed: viśeṣa hetoḥ abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no specific reason.
Even if there is mere similarity in the non-terminating series, where there is obstruction to origination etc., there it is a fault.

analyzed: yatra yad abhāvaḥ tatra adūṣaṇa tvam iti ced
translated: Where there is absence of that, there it is not a fault. If this is argued,

analyzed: kimartham utpatti ādi pratibandhaka tvam anusaraṇīyam
translated: why should the obstruction to origination etc. be followed?

analyzed: anavasthā hi tarka viśeṣaḥ  tarkaḥ ca aniṣya prasañjanam
translated: For an infinite regress is a particular kind of reasoning.🔽And reasoning is the implication of something undesirable.

analyzed: utpatti ādi pratibandhaḥ ca aniṣyaḥ
translated: And the obstruction to origination etc. is undesirable.

analyzed: prāmāṇika parityāga rūpa tvāt
translated: Because it is in the form of abandoning what is authoritative.

analyzed: utpatti ādeḥ prāmāṇika tvāt  atas tad apratibandhe tarka tva ayogāt katham dūṣaṇa antaram
translated: Because origination etc. is authoritative.🔽Therefore, because it cannot be reasoning if there is no obstruction to that, how can it be a different fault?

analyzed: evam eva dūṣaṇa tve tiprasaṅgaḥ ced
translated: If it is argued that if it is a fault in this way alone, there is over-extension,

analyzed: kim prāmāṇika parityāgaḥ eva aniṣyaḥ uta aprāmāṇika svīkāraḥ
translated: Is the undesirable [consequence] just the abandonment of what is authoritative, or is the acceptance of what is not authoritative also [undesirable]?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: The first is not so.

analyzed: niyāmaka abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no restriction.

original: dvitīye kathaṃ na prakṛtānavasthā dūṣaṇam /🔽atyantabhinnadharmaparamparāyā apyaprāmāṇikatvāt /
analyzed: dvitīye katham na prakṛta anavasthā dūṣaṇam  atyanta bhinna dharma paramparāyāḥ api aprāmāṇika tvāt
translated: In the second case, how is the fault of infinite regress in the present case not [undesirable]?🔽Because even a series of extremely different properties is not authoritative.

analyzed: atha aprāmāṇika svīkāraḥ na dūṣaṇam
translated: If the acceptance of what is not authoritative is not a fault,

original: tarhi prāmāṇikaparityāgo 'pi na dūṣaṇaṃ🔽syāditi nānavasthā kvaciddūṣaṇaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: tarhi prāmāṇika parityāgaḥ na dūṣaṇam  syāt iti nā anavasthā kvacid dūṣaṇam bhavet
translated: then the abandonment of what is authoritative is also not a fault.🔽So infinite regress would not be a fault anywhere.

analyzed: atha aniṣya āpatti hetuḥ anavasthā dūṣaṇam
translated: If infinite regress is a fault because it is the cause of undesirable consequences,

analyzed: na punar aniṣya rūpā iti ced na
translated: but it is not of the nature of the undesirable, then no.

analyzed: aniṣya rūpā eva anavasthā dūṣaṇam
translated: Infinite regress is a fault only in the form of the undesirable.

original: natvaniṣyāpattiheturityapi vaktuṃ śakyatvena kvacidaṅgīkṛtāpyanavasthā na dūṣaṇaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: natu aniṣya āpatti hetuḥ iti api vaktum śakya tvena kvacid aṅgīkṛtā api anavasthā na dūṣaṇam bhavet
translated: It cannot be said that it is not the cause of undesirable consequences, so even if accepted somewhere, infinite regress would not be a fault.

analyzed: tasmāt prāmāṇika parityāga aprāmāṇika parigraha rūpā vā tad hetuḥ vā anavacchinna paramparā anavasthā iti vācyam
translated: Therefore, it must be said that the cause of infinite regress is either the abandonment of what is authoritative or the acceptance of what is not authoritative, or the infinite series of causes without distinction.

original: ata eva nātiprasaṅgaḥ /🔽tathāca dharmaparamparāyā apyanavasthātvenābheda evāṅgīkāryaḥ /
analyzed: atas eva na atiprasaṅgaḥ 🔽tathā ca dharma paramparāyāḥ api anavasthā tvena abhedaḥ eva aṅgīkāryaḥ
translated: For this very reason, there is no overextension.🔽And so, even if the series of properties is infinite regress, it must be accepted as non-different.

analyzed: evam ca ukta nyāyena vyavahāra anyathā anupapattyā viśeṣa siddhiḥ iti
translated: And thus, by the method stated, the existence of the particular is established by the impossibility of any other explanation of the usage.

original: api ca yo dharmadharmiṇorbhedaṃ samavāyaṃ cāṅgīkṛtyābhedaṃ viśeṣaṃ cāvajānāti tenānavasthāto bibhyatā guṇasāmānyayorguṇasāmānyapratītirevāpalapanīyā
analyzed: api ca yaḥ dharma dharmiṇoḥ bhedam samavāyam ca aṅgīkṛtya abhedam viśeṣam ca avajānāti tena anavasthātaḥ bibhyatā guṇa sāmānyayoḥ guṇa sāmānya pratītiḥ eva apalapanīyā
translated: Moreover, he who, accepting the difference of the attribute and the substrate, and inherence, disregards non-difference and the particular, by him, fearing regressus ad infinitum, the cognition of the universal and the quality as universal and quality should be denied.

analyzed: vinā eva bādhakena bhrāntiḥ vā vācyā
translated: Or, without any sublation, illusion should be asserted.

original: pratītyapalāpādito vā bibhyato 'navasthā syādityekaṃ sandhitsato 'nyatpraccyavate /🔽abhedaṃ viśeṣaṃ cāṅgīkurvatāṃ tu nedaṃ dūṣaṇadvayamato 'pi tatpakṣapāta ityāśayavānāha asmatpakṣa iti //
analyzed: pratīti apalāpāt itas vā bibhyataḥ na avasthā syāt iti ekam sandhitsataḥ  abhedam viśeṣam ca aṅgīkurvatām tu na idam dūṣaṇa dvayam atas tad pakṣapātaḥ iti āśayavān āha asmad pakṣe iti
translated: Or, fearing the denial of cognition, there would be regressus ad infinitum; desiring to establish one, another falls away.

analyzed: asmad pakṣe guṇa ādyāḥ ca tadvantaḥ hi viśeṣataḥ
translated: But for those who accept non-difference and the particular, this pair of faults does not exist. Therefore, this is the position of their view. With this intention, he says: In our view, the qualities etc. and their possessors are indeed distinguished.

analyzed: ananya tvāt na anavasthā
translated: Due to non-difference, there is no regressus ad infinitum.

original: dharmadharmiṇoḥ saviśeṣābhedavādināṃ pakṣa ityarthaḥ /🔽guṇādyā guṇāḥ sāmānyāni ca /🔽tadvanto guṇavantaḥ /
analyzed: dharma dharmiṇoḥ sa viśeṣa abheda vādinām pakṣaḥ iti arthaḥ  guṇa ādyāḥ guṇāḥ sāmānyāni ca  tadvantaḥ guṇavantaḥ
translated: The meaning is: in the view of those who assert the non-difference of the attribute and the substrate with a particular.🔽The qualities etc. are the qualities and universals.🔽They are the possessors of qualities.

analyzed: sāmānyavanti ca
translated: And they are the possessors of universals.

analyzed: tena caturviṃśati guṇāḥ sat go tvam ityādi pratīti virodhaḥ na asti iti śeṣaḥ
translated: And by that, there is no contradiction with the cognition that cowhood is twenty-four times greater, and so on - this is the remainder.

analyzed: ananya tvāt dharma dharmiṇoḥ iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder is that the property and the possessor of the property are not different.

analyzed: a prāmāṇika a paryavasita paramparā rūpā hi eṣā
translated: For this is a series of unauthoritative and inconclusive forms.

original: ananyatve kathaṃ tadvṛttamiti tadavasthaḥ pratītivirodha ityata uktam viśeṣato hi tadvanta iti //
analyzed: ananyatve katham tat vṛttam iti tad avasthaḥ pratīti virodhaḥ iti atas uktam viśeṣataḥ hi tadvantaḥ iti
translated: If they are not different, how can it be said to inhere in that? The contradiction with cognition remains as before. Therefore it is said: For they possess that in a particular way.

analyzed: bheda sambandha kārya kārī hi viśeṣaḥ iti
translated: For a particular is that which performs the function of the relation of difference.

analyzed: evam avayava avayavi ādīnām abhedaḥ tra nirūpitaḥ
translated: Thus the non-difference of the parts, the whole, etc. has been determined here.

original: idānīṃ kvacidbhedābhedāvapi bhavata iti tadapavādamāha bheda iti //
analyzed: idānīm kvacid bheda abhedau api bhavataḥ iti tad apavādam āha bhedaḥ iti
translated: Now, in some cases, there is also difference and non-difference. Therefore, as an exception to that, he says: Difference, in destruction, may be so...

analyzed: bhedaḥ nāśe bhavet tathā
translated: Difference may be so in destruction.

analyzed: yat vā yadi avayavi ādayaḥ vayava ādi abhinnāḥ
translated: Or, if the whole, etc. are not different from the parts, etc.,

original: kathaṃ tarhi satsvevāvayavādiṣu vinaśyantītyata āha bheda iti //
analyzed: katham tarhi satsu eva avayava ādiṣu vinaśyanti iti atas āha bhedaḥ iti
translated: then how is it that they are destroyed even when the parts, etc. exist? Therefore he says: Difference...

analyzed: tathāśabdaḥ samuccaye
translated: The word so has the sense of also.

analyzed: avayava ādiṣu satsu eva avayavi ādīnām nāśe bhedaḥ bhedaḥ ca bhavet iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that in the destruction of the whole, etc. even when the parts, etc. exist, there may be both difference and non-difference.

analyzed: atra nāśaḥ iti upalakṣaṇam
translated: Here, destruction is a metaphor.

original: yatra satsvevāvayaveṣvavayavino 'bhāvaḥ sati guṇini guṇasyābhāvastatra bhedābhedāvityādi draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: yatra satsu eva avayaveṣu avayavinaḥ bhāvaḥ sati guṇini guṇasya abhāvaḥ tatra bheda abhedau ityādi draṣṭavyam
translated: Where there is non-existence of the whole when the parts exist, and non-existence of the quality when the possessor of the quality exists, there difference and non-difference should be seen, etc.

original: anyathā yatrāvayavāvayavyādīnāṃ yugapadvināśastatra bhedābhedāvuktau na syātām /
analyzed: anyathā yatra avayava avayavi ādīnām yugapad vināśaḥ tatra bheda abhedau uktau na syātām
translated: Otherwise, where there is simultaneous destruction of the parts, the whole, etc., the stated difference and non-difference would not be there.

analyzed: idam uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said.

original: satyapi tasminnasattvādityanena hetunāvayavyādīnāmavayavādibhyo bhedamātraṃ vā sādhyate 'tyantabhedo vā /
analyzed: sati api tasmin asattvāt iti anena hetunā avayavi ādīnām avayava ādibhyaḥ bheda mātram vā sādhyate tyanta bhedaḥ vā
translated: By this reason even though it exists, it is non-existent, is it being proved that the whole, etc. are merely different from the parts, etc. or absolutely different?

analyzed: ādye siddha sādhana tā bhāga asiddhiḥ ca
translated: In the first case, there is the fault of proving what is already established and partial non-establishment.

analyzed: tathā hi  sati api utyu
translated: This is how.

analyzed: pādāne kadācid upādeyam asat
translated: Even though the material cause exists, sometimes the effect is non-existent.

analyzed: yathā paṭaḥ
translated: For example, a cloth.

original: evaṃ satyapi dravye kecidguṇā asanto yathā pākajādayaḥ /🔽tathā satyapyātyevā
analyzed: evam sati api dravye kecid guṇāḥ asantaḥ yathā pāka ja ādayaḥ  tathā sati api āti eva
translated: Similarly, even though substance exists, some qualities are non-existent, like those produced by cooking.

analyzed: śraye kāścid kriyāḥ asatyaḥ yathā paṭa calana ādayaḥ
translated: Likewise, even though the substratum exists, some actions are non-existent, like the movement of a cloth.

analyzed: jātiḥ ca kācid sati jātimatī asatī
translated: And some universals are non-existent when the universal bearer exists.

analyzed: yathā brāhmaṇam
translated: For example, a Brahmin.

analyzed: tatra bheda abhedayoḥ aṅgīkārāt bheda sādhanam siddha viṣayam
translated: There, since difference and non-difference are accepted, the proof of difference has an established object.

analyzed: gagana tad bhāgayoḥ īśvara ādi āśrita jñāna ādi guṇa kriyā jātiṣu abhāvāt bhāga asiddha tvam hetoḥ iti
translated: In the case of the sky and its parts, the reason is inconclusive, because the qualities, actions, and universals such as the knowledge residing in God are absent.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ  kāla atyaya apadiṣṭa tvāt
translated: The second alternative is not correct.🔽Because it is contradicted by the passage of time.

analyzed: abhedasya prāk upapādita tvāt upapādayiṣyamāṇa tvāt ca iti
translated: Because non-difference has been explained before and will be explained later.

analyzed: syāt etat
translated: This may be the case.

analyzed: yathā bheda sādhakānām vyapadeśa bheda ādīnām viśeṣa āśrayeṇa eva anyathā siddhiḥ uktā
translated: Just as the difference-establishing factors such as different designations are said to be otherwise established only on the basis of particulars,

original: tathā satyapi tasminnasattvasyāpi viśeṣaṇaiva nirvāhaḥ kriyatām /
analyzed: tathā sati api tasmin asattvasya api viśeṣaṇā eva nirvāhaḥ kriyatām
translated: in the same way, even if that is so, let non-existence be accomplished only by the qualification.

analyzed: kim bheda abheda abhyupagamena
translated: What is the use of accepting both difference and non-difference?

analyzed: mā evam
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: viśeṣasya bheda kārya vyavahāra mātra nirvāhaka tvena vināśam prati anirvāhaka tvāt
translated: Because the particular only accomplishes the usage of difference, which is the effect of difference, and does not accomplish destruction.
If it accomplishes all the effects of difference, the particular is just difference.

analyzed: na tad pratinidhiḥ syāt
translated: It cannot be a substitute for that.

analyzed: kiñca aneka āśritasya avayavinaḥ dvi tva ādeḥ ca āśrayeṇa atyānta abhede sati āśrayaṇām api parasparam abhedaḥ prasajyate
translated: Moreover, if the whole, which is based on many, and duality, etc., are absolutely non-different from their basis, then the bases would also be non-different from each other.

analyzed: tad parihāra artham tāvat avaśyam tatra bhedaḥ ṅgīkaraṇīyaḥ
translated: For the sake of avoiding that, difference must necessarily be accepted there.

original: nacāvacchedakena vinā bhedābhedabhūmeḥ saṅgrahaḥ syādityayāvadāśrayabhāvitvameva grāhyam /
analyzed: na ca avacchedakena vinā bheda abheda bhūmeḥ saṅgrahaḥ syāt iti ayāvadāśrayabhāvi tvam eva grāhyam
translated: And without a limiting adjunct, there could be no inclusion of the realm of difference and non-difference. Therefore, inherence should be accepted as lasting as long as the substratum.

original: tatrāpi viśeṣa eva saṅkaraṃ vārayiṣyatīti tu nirastam /
analyzed: tatra api viśeṣaḥ eva saṅkaram vārayiṣyati iti tu nirastam
translated: Even there, the distinction itself will prevent confusion. This has been refuted.

analyzed: vyavasthā na tu sva icchā anusāriṇī
translated: Moreover, the determination should follow the means of knowledge, not one's own will.

analyzed: pramāṇam tu bheda abhedau avagāhate iti vakṣyate
translated: And it will be said that the means of knowledge comprehends difference and non-difference.

original: nanu anityadravyāśritā ekatvādayo 'pi guṇāḥ kiṃ bhedavantasteṣāmapi dravyakāryatayā taduttarakṣaṇabhāvitvāditi /
analyzed: nanu anitya dravya āśritāḥ eka tva ādayaḥ api guṇāḥ kim bhedavantaḥ teṣām api dravya kāryatayā tad uttara kṣaṇa bhāvi tvāt iti
translated: But even the qualities like unity, etc., which inhere in impermanent substances, are they different? Because they also exist in the next moment, being the effect of substance.

analyzed: mā evam
translated: Not so.

analyzed: ukta uttara tvāt
translated: Because the answer has been given.

analyzed: uktam hi etat
translated: For this has been said:

analyzed: upādāna dravyam guṇavat upādeya tayā pariṇamate iti
translated: The material cause, along with the qualities, transforms into the effect.

analyzed: nanu bheda abhedau ekatra viruddhau
translated: But difference and non-difference are contradictory in one thing.

analyzed: tat katham ayāvat āśraya bhāvinām avayavi guṇa kamaḥ sāmānyānām avayava ādibhiḥ bheda arbheda abhyupagamaḥ iti atas āha viśeṣam eva iti
translated: How then can the universals like inherence, which last as long as the substratum, be accepted as different and non-different from the parts etc.? To this he says: The distinction itself...

analyzed: viśeṣam eva saṃśritya
translated: Relying on the distinction alone...

analyzed: bheda abhedau ekatra bhavataḥ iti sambandhaḥ
translated: Difference and non-difference occur in one thing. This is the connection.

analyzed: avadhāraṇam kāla ādi bheda vyāvṛtti artham
translated: The restriction is for the purpose of excluding differences in time, etc.

original: kathaṃ viśeṣāśrayaṇe virodhaśāntirityata āha virodha iti //
analyzed: katham viśeṣa āśrayaṇe virodha śāntiḥ iti atas āha virodhaḥ iti
translated: How is the contradiction resolved by resorting to the distinction? To this he says: The contradiction, etc.

analyzed: viśeṣaḥ balavān yatas
translated: Because the distinction is powerful.

analyzed: balavān bheda kārya kāraṇaḥ iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder is: powerful in causing the effect of difference.

original: tato viśeṣaṃ samāśrityaikatra bhedābhedau bhavata ityanvayaḥ /
analyzed: tatas viśeṣam samāśritya ekatra bheda abhedau bhavataḥ iti anvayaḥ
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that difference and non-difference occur in one place by resorting to the distinction.

analyzed: ayam arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

analyzed: bhedaḥ hi virodha śānti hetuḥ
translated: For difference is the cause of resolving contradictions.

original: tathāhi /🔽kvacidāśrayabhedo yathā madhurāyāṃ devadattasadbhāvaḥ srughne tadabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi  kvacid āśraya bhedaḥ yathā madhurāyām devadatta sadbhāvaḥ srughne tad abhāvaḥ
translated: This is how it is.🔽In some cases, there is a difference in the substratum, as Devadatta exists in Madhura but is absent in Srughna.

analyzed: kvacid kāla abhedaḥ yathā madhurāyām eva devadattasya bhāva abhāvau
translated: In some cases, there is a difference in time, as Devadatta's existence and non-existence occur in Madhura itself.

original: kvacitpratiyogibhedo yathā gavayo goghaṭābhyāṃ sadṛśo visadṛśaśceti /
analyzed: kvacid pratiyogi bhedaḥ yathā gavayaḥ go ghaṭābhyām sadṛśaḥ visadṛśaḥ ca iti
translated: In some cases, there is a difference in the counter-correlate, as a gavaya is similar to a cow and a pot, but dissimilar.

analyzed: bheda pratinidhiḥ ca viśeṣaḥ iti uktam
translated: And it has been said that the distinction is a substitute for difference.

analyzed: atas katham asau bheda abhedau ekadā eva ekatra eva na avasthāpayet iti
translated: Therefore, how could it not establish difference and non-difference at the same time and in the same place?

analyzed: evam tarhi atiprasaṅgaḥ
translated: If so, then there is over-extension.

original: sarvatra viśeṣamāśritya virodhasyotsādayituṃ śakyatvādityata āha dṛṣṭīti //
analyzed: sarvatra viśeṣam āśritya virodhasya utsādayitum śakya tvāt iti atas āha dṛṣṭi iti
translated: Because the contradiction can be eradicated everywhere by resorting to the distinction, to this he says: The seen, etc.

analyzed: dṛṣṭi pramāṇataḥ ca eva
translated: And because of the perception and the means of knowledge.

analyzed: dṛṣṭiḥ ca tat pramāṇam ca
translated: And perception and that means of knowledge.

analyzed: pramāṇa bhūtā dṛṣṭiḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that perception is the means of knowledge.

analyzed: tatas bheda abhedau na viruddhau iti sambandhaḥ
translated: Therefore, difference and non-difference are not contradictory - this is the connection.

analyzed: caśabdaḥ viśeṣeṇa saha dṛṣṭeḥ samuccaye
translated: The word ca (and) is for the inclusion of difference along with perception.

analyzed: na sva icchā mātreṇa bheda abhedau iti upetya viśeṣeṇa virodha abhāvaḥ bhidhīyate
translated: It is accepted that difference and non-difference are not due to one's own will alone, and the absence of contradiction with the particular is stated.

analyzed: yena atiprasaṅgaḥ syāt iti eva śabdaḥ
translated: The word eva (only) is used to prevent over-extension.

analyzed: uktam tāvat avayava avayavi ādi abheda grāhiṇī dṛṣṭiḥ asti
translated: It has been said that there is a perception that grasps the non-difference of the parts and the whole, etc.

analyzed: sambaddha vastu buddhitaḥ vilakṣaṇa tayā anuvyavasāyāt
translated: Because of the ascertainment that it is different from the cognition of a related object.

original: asti ca bhedagrāhiṇī satyapi tasminnasattvāditi hetujanitā dṛṣṭiriti /
analyzed: asti ca bheda grāhiṇī satī api tasmin asattvāt iti hetu janitā dṛṣṭiḥ iti
translated: And there is a perception that grasps difference, even when that exists, because of the absence of existence - this is the perception generated by the cause.

analyzed: na ca ete bādhya bādhake
translated: And these are not the negatee and the negator.

analyzed: anyatara an anuvṛtti prasaṅgāt
translated: Because of the consequence of the non-occurrence of either one.

analyzed: na api pratipakṣa bhūte
translated: Nor are they mutually opposed.

analyzed: pratipattṛṇām ubhaya udāsīna tā āpatteḥ
translated: Because of the consequence of the neutrality of both the cognizers towards both.

analyzed: ca evam na
translated: It is not so.

analyzed: atas dvayoḥ api prāmāṇyataḥ ca bheda abhedayoḥ avagata yoneḥ virodhaḥ
translated: Therefore, because of the validity of both, there is no contradiction between the difference and non-difference that are cognized.

analyzed: tat idam uktam pramāṇataḥ iti
translated: This is what is meant by because of the means of knowledge.

analyzed: nanu bhavavaitām bheda abhedau ekatra eva ekadā eva pramitau
translated: But it is not so. For the difference and non-difference are perceived together in one cognition.

original: tathāpi kathaṃ virodhaśāntirityata āha virodha iti //🔽virodho darśane katham // / / //
analyzed: tathā api katham virodha śāntiḥ iti atas āha virodhaḥ iti  virodhaḥ darśane katham
translated: Even so, how is the cessation of contradiction? To this he says 'contradiction' etc.🔽How can there be contradiction in perception?

original: sahadarśane sati kathaṃ virodho vaktuṃ śakyate /
analyzed: saha darśane sati katham virodhaḥ vaktum śakyate
translated: When there is simultaneous perception, how can contradiction be stated?

analyzed: saha dṛṣṭau viruddhau ca iti vipratiṣiddham iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that it is contradictory to say that two things are perceived together and yet contradictory.

analyzed: etat eva vivṛṇoti virodhaḥ hi iti
translated: He explains this very thing with 'contradiction' etc.

analyzed: virodhaḥ hi avirodhaḥ ca yatas darśana māna gau
translated: For contradiction and non-contradiction are based on perception.

original: tato dṛṣṭe virodhastu sadbhirāpādyate katham // / / //🔽sarvatra parasparaparihāreṇaiva sattvadarśanaṃ mahānavasthānalakṣaṇavirodhe pramāṇam /
analyzed: tatas dṛṣṭe virodhaḥ tu sadbhiḥ āpādyate katham  sarvatra paraspara parihāreṇa eva sattva darśanam mahānavasthāna lakṣaṇa virodhe pramāṇam
translated: Therefore, how can contradiction be imposed by the wise on what is perceived?🔽The perception of existence everywhere by mutual exclusion alone is the proof of contradiction characterized by the great regress.

analyzed: kvacid saha darśanam ca avirodhe
translated: And the perception of something together is the proof of non-contradiction.

analyzed: anyasya a nirūpaṇāt
translated: Because the other cannot be determined.

original: ataḥ sahadṛṣṭe bhedābhedalakṣaṇe vastudvaye virodhaḥ kathamucyeta /
analyzed: atas saha dṛṣṭe bheda abheda lakṣaṇe vastu dvaye virodhaḥ katham ucyeta
translated: Therefore, how can contradiction be said to exist in the two mutually exclusive and inclusive objects that are perceived together?

analyzed: saha darśane hi avirodhaḥ syāt
translated: For if they are perceived together, there would be non-contradiction.

analyzed: punar virodha kathane vyāghāta a nivāraṇāt iti
translated: Because the statement of contradiction again would not avoid the contradiction.

original: hiśabdena śītoṣṇādau rūparasādau ca virodhāvirodhayordarśanaikapramāṇatvaṃ nidarśayati /
analyzed: hi śabdena śīta uṣṇa ādau rūpa rasa ādau ca virodha avirodhayoḥ darśana eka pramāṇa tvam nidarśayati
translated: The word 'hi' (in fact) indicates that the perception of contradiction and non-contradiction in cold and hot, and in form and taste, etc., is based on perception alone.

analyzed: tuśabdasya dṛṣṭe tu iti sambandhaḥ
translated: The word 'tu' (but) is connected with 'dṛṣṭe tu' (but when seen).

analyzed: sadbhiḥ vidvadbhiḥ iti upahāsaḥ
translated: 'By the good' (in the text) is a term of reproach.

original: vaiśeṣikādayo hi saṃyogavibhāgaśabdātmaviśeṣaguṇānāṃ tatraiva tadaiva bhāvābhāvāvupetya
analyzed: vaiśeṣika ādayaḥ hi saṃyoga vibhāga śabda ātma viśeṣa guṇānām tatra eva tadā eva bhāva abhāvau upetya
translated: For the Vaiśeṣikas and others, accepting the presence and absence of conjunction, disjunction, sound, and specific qualities of the self only there and then,

original: sahadarśanādvirodho nāstīti vadantaḥ punaratra sahadarśane 'pi virodhamudbhāvayantaḥ
analyzed: sahadarśanāt virodhaḥ na asti iti vadantaḥ punar atra sahadarśane virodham udbhāvayantaḥ
translated: say that there is no contradiction due to the observation of their co-existence. But here, even when they observe the co-existence, they point out the contradiction.

original: svavyāhatabhāṣiṇaḥ svoktavismaraṇaśīlāḥ svadṛṣṭipakṣapātinaḥ kathaṃ santaḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: sva vyāhata bhāṣiṇaḥ sva ukta vismaraṇa śīlāḥ sva dṛṣṭi pakṣapātinaḥ katham santaḥ syuḥ
translated: How can they be good people who speak self-contradictory things, who are prone to forget their own statements, and who are biased towards their own views?

original: sarvatrāsahadṛṣṭayoryadi kaścidāgrahamātreṇa sahāvasthānaṃ manyate taṃ pratyeva virodhodbhāvanaṃ kriyate nānyatheti // /
analyzed: sarvatra asaha dṛṣṭayoḥ yadi kaścid āgraha mātreṇa saha avasthānam manyate tam prati eva virodha udbhāvanam kriyate na anyathā iti
translated: If someone, due to mere misunderstanding, thinks that there is co-existence even when there is no co-observation everywhere, then the pointing out of contradiction is done only for him, not otherwise.

analyzed: dharma dharmiṇoḥ bheda abhedau kvacid iti saṅkṣepeṇa uktam
translated: It has been stated in brief that the difference and non-difference of the attribute and the possessor of the attribute exist in some cases.

original: tatkiṃ sarveṣvapi dravyeṣūta keṣucidevetyapekṣāyāmāha abhinna iti //
analyzed: tat kim sarveṣu api dravyeṣu uta keṣucid eva iti apekṣāyām āha abhinnaḥ iti
translated: What is that? In all substances or in some? In anticipation of this question, he says 'abhinna' (non-different), etc.

analyzed: abhinnaḥ bhagavān svena tad anyena vibhedavān
translated: The Lord is non-different by Himself, and different by something else than Himself.

analyzed: bhagavān iti cetana mātra upalakṣaṇam
translated: And Lord is a mere designation of the conscious Self.

analyzed: svena sva avayava guṇa kriyā ādibhiḥ
translated: By Himself, by His own parts, qualities, actions, etc.

original: tadanyena prakṛtijīvajaḍātmanā prapañcenetyevaṃ vyavasthitāveva bhedābhedau na tvekaviṣayāvityarthaḥ /
analyzed: tad anyena prakṛti jīva jaḍa ātmanā prapañcena iti evam vyavasthitau eva bheda abhedau na tu eka viṣayau iti arthaḥ
translated: By something else than Himself, by the universe consisting of Primordial Matter, the Individual Souls, and the non-intelligent (evils). Thus, Difference and Non-difference are well-established in this way, and are not of the same object. This is the meaning.

original: ayāvaddravyabhāvidharmairbhedābhedau kuto na syātāmityata āha nityā iti //
analyzed: ayāvaddravya bhāvi dharmaiḥ bheda abhedau kutas na syātām iti atas āha nityāḥ iti
translated: How can there not be Difference and Non-difference by the attributes that do not exist as long as the substance exists? To this he says The eternal etc.

analyzed: nityāḥ dharmāḥ tadīyāḥ tu sarve smāt nā eva bhedinaḥ
translated: The eternal attributes are all different from Him.

analyzed: tuśabdaḥ va dhāraṇe
translated: The word tu (but) is for emphasis.

analyzed: asmāt kāraṇam
translated: From Him is the reason.

analyzed: asmāt bhagavataḥ
translated: From Him means from the Lord.

analyzed: dvi tva ādi saṅkhaya avyatiriktāḥ iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder is except for number such as two and so on.

analyzed: kva tarhi bheda abhedau iti atas āha sāmastya iti
translated: Where then are Difference and Non-difference? To this he says In totality etc.

analyzed: sāmastya ucchedinaḥ nyatra dharmāḥ ubhaya rūpakāḥ
translated: The attributes that are destroyed in totality are of two kinds elsewhere.

analyzed: bhāve
translated: In existence...

analyzed: anyatra parameśvarāt
translated: Elsewhere than the Supreme Lord.

analyzed: jaḍe vastuni iti yāvat
translated: As much as in an inert object.

original: satyeva dhamirṇi sāmastyenocchedavanto ye dharmāste ubhayarūpiṇo bhinnābhinnā ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: sati eva dhamirṇi sāmastyena ucchedavantaḥ ye dharmāḥ te ubhaya rūpiṇaḥ bhinna abhinnāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The attributes that are destroyed in totality when the possessor of attributes exists are of two kinds, i.e., different and non-different. This is the meaning.

analyzed: abhibhava vyāvṛtti artham sāmastyā iti uktam
translated: The word 'together' is used to exclude the idea of superseding.

original: yadvā sāmastye dravyasyāvikalatve nāśābhāve 'pi ye ucchedina iti vyākhyeyam /
analyzed: yat vā sāmastye dravyasya avikala tve nāśa abhāve pi ye ucchedinaḥ iti vyākhyeyam
translated: Or, in 'together', when the substance is not deficient, even in the absence of destruction, those who are destroyers should be explained.

original: kiṃ svasadbhāvavelāyāmabhedino 'sadbhāvavelāyāṃ bhedina ityevaṃ kālabhedena bhedābhedāvityata uktam bhāva iti //
analyzed: kim sva sadbhāva velāyām abhedinaḥ sadbhāva velāyām bhedinaḥ iti evam kāla bhedena bheda abhedau iti atas uktam bhāvaḥ iti
translated: Is it that at the time of its own existence it is non-different, and at the time of non-existence it is different? Thus, difference and non-difference are due to difference in time. Therefore it is said 'existence'.

analyzed: sva sadbhāva daśāyām eva ubhaya rūpakāḥ iti arthaḥ  vinaṣṭasya asattvena bheda cintā anavakāśāt
translated: The meaning is that at the time of its own existence, they have both forms.🔽Because of the impossibility of thinking of difference due to the non-existence of what is destroyed,

analyzed: prāk atyanta abhede vināśa asambhavāt ca
translated: and because destruction is not possible before absolute non-difference.

original: kuto bhinnābhinnā ityata āha ta eveti //
analyzed: kutas bhinna abhinnāḥ iti atas āha te eva iti
translated: How are they different and non-different? Therefore it is said 'they themselves'.

original: ta eva cocchedāt tadanye ca samastaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: te eva ca ucchedāt tad anye ca samastaśas
translated: And they themselves, due to destruction, and others than that, entirely...

original: pratyakṣabalena ta eva dharmisvarūpabhūtā eva ucchedāt satyeva dharmiṇyasattvāddhetostadanye /
analyzed: pratyakṣa balena te eva dharmi svarūpa bhūtāḥ eva ucchedāt satī eva dharmiṇī asattvāt hetoḥ tad anye
translated: By the power of perception, they themselves, which are the form of the subject, due to destruction, even when the subject exists, because of non-existence, others than that.

analyzed: caśabdau mithas samuccaya arthau 🔽samastaśas iti ayāvaddravyabhāvi vivakṣayā uktam
translated: The words 'and' have the meaning of mutual combination.🔽'Entirely' is said for the intention of not lasting as long as the substance.

analyzed: yat uktam yāvat avayava bhāvinaḥ vayavinaḥ vayavaiḥ atyanta abhedaḥ yāvat avayava bhāvinaḥ tu bheda abhedau iti
translated: What has been said, that as long as there is the state of being composed of parts, there is absolute non-difference of the whole from the parts, but when there is no longer the state of being composed of parts, there is difference and non-difference,

original: tenānyadapi codyaṃ parihṛtamityāha aṃśāṃśinoriti // /🔽aṃśāṃśinorabhedena tvaṃśasaṃyoga eva hi /
analyzed: tena anyat api codyam parihṛtam iti āha aṃśa aṃśinoḥ iti  aṃśa aṃśinoḥ abhedena tu aṃśa saṃyogaḥ eva hi
translated: by that, another objection is also answered. He says of the part and the whole, etc.🔽If there is non-difference of the part and the whole, then the whole is just the conjunction of the parts.

analyzed: aṃśinaḥ na anavasthātaḥ yadi api aṃśeṣu aviśramaḥ
translated: There is no infinite regress, even though there is no resting in the parts.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: This is because:

original: sarvadikṣvapi sambandhāditi yadaṃśataḥ saṃyoga ityuktaṃ tadayuktam /
analyzed: sarva dikṣu api sambandhāt iti yat aṃśataḥ saṃyogaḥ iti uktam tat ayuktam
translated: What was said, that the conjunction is partial because of the connection in all directions, is incorrect.

analyzed: anavasthā āpatteḥ
translated: Because of the occurrence of an infinite regress.

analyzed: ghaṭa saṃyogaḥ hi ghaṭa aṃśa saṃyoga pūrvakaḥ
translated: For the conjunction of the pot is preceded by the conjunction of the parts of the pot.

analyzed: saḥ api tad aṃśa saṃyoga pūrvakaḥ
translated: That too is preceded by the conjunction of its parts.

analyzed: na ca iyam niraṃśe paramparā viśrāmyati iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that this series does not rest in the partless.

analyzed: aṃśa paramparāyāḥ aviśramasya api aṅgīkṛta tvāt
translated: Because the non-resting of the series of parts is also accepted.

original: ataḥ pūrvapūrvasaṃyogānutpattāvuttarottarānutpattiprasaṅgādaṃśataḥ saṃyoga iti niyamo nopapadyata iti /
analyzed: atas pūrva pūrva saṃyoga anutpattau uttara uttara anutpatti prasaṅgāt aṃśataḥ saṃyogaḥ iti niyamaḥ nā upapadyate iti
translated: Therefore, because of the consequence of non-production of the later ones if the earlier conjunctions do not arise, the rule that the conjunction is partial is not tenable.

analyzed: tat idam asaṅgatam
translated: This is irrelevant.

original: yadyapyaṃśata eva saṃyogo yadyapi cāṃśeṣvaṃśaparamparāyā aviśramastathāpyaṃśāṃśinorabhede naivāṃśasaṃyoga eva hi yasmādaṃśinaḥ saṃyogo 'to
analyzed: yadi api aṃśataḥ eva saṃyogaḥ yadi api ca aṃśeṣu aṃśa paramparāyāḥ aviśramaḥ tathā api aṃśa aṃśinoḥ abhede nā eva aṃśa saṃyogaḥ eva hi yasmāt aṃśinaḥ
translated: Even though conjunction is only partial, and even though the series of parts is not based on the parts, still, when there is no difference between the part and the whole, conjunction is only of the parts, because the conjunction of the whole is due to the conjunction of the parts.

analyzed: ayam abhisandhiḥ
translated: This is the intention.

original: syādiyamanavasthā yadi sarvatrāṃśata eva saṃyoga iti vadatāmasmākamaṃśinaḥ saṃyogoṃ'śasaṃyogenaiva jāyata ityabhiprāyaḥ syāt /
analyzed: syāt iyam anavasthā yadi sarvatra aṃśataḥ eva saṃyogaḥ iti vadatām asmākam aṃśinaḥ saṃyoga oṃśa saṃyogena eva jāyate iti abhiprāyaḥ syāt
translated: This infinite regress would occur if those who say that conjunction is only partial had the intention that the conjunction of the whole arises only through the conjunction of the parts.

analyzed: na ca evam
translated: But it is not so.

original: kintu yo yasya aṃśinaḥ saṃyogaḥ sa tadaṃśe vartate /
analyzed: kintu yaḥ yasya aṃśinaḥ saṃyogaḥ sa tad aṃśe vartate
translated: Rather, the conjunction of any part of a whole occurs in that part.

original: niraṃśasya tu saṃyogaḥ kva nāma vartatām /
analyzed: niraṃśasya tu saṃyogaḥ kva nāma vartatām
translated: But where can the conjunction of the partless occur?

original: ataḥ paramāṇvoḥ saṃyoge sati tadvṛttyarthamaṃśo 'ṅgīkaraṇīya iti /
analyzed: atas paramāṇvoḥ saṃyoge sati tad vṛtti artham aṃśaḥ ṅgīkaraṇīyaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, when there is conjunction of atoms, a part must be accepted for their occurrence.

analyzed: na hi evam sati kācid anavasthā asti
translated: For when this is so, there is no infinite regress.

analyzed: anavasthita kārya kāraṇa bhūta asiddha saṃyoga paramparā āśrayaṇa abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no reliance on an infinite series of unestablished conjunctions that are the effects and causes of each other.

analyzed: etāvat tu bhavet
translated: This much, however, would be so.

analyzed: ghaṭa saṃyogaḥ syāt
translated: There would be conjunction of the pot.

analyzed: pramāṇa virodhāt ca
translated: And because it contradicts valid cognition.

analyzed: ghaṭa saṃyogaḥ ghaṭa vṛttiḥ api ghaṭa saṃyogaḥ syāt
translated: The conjunction of the pot would also occur in the pot, and that conjunction of the pot would be the conjunction of the pot.

analyzed: pramāṇa virodhāt ca
translated: And because it contradicts valid cognition.

analyzed: ghaṭa saṃyogaḥ ghaṭa vṛttiḥ tad guṇa tvāt tat rūpavat iti
translated: The conjunction of the pot is present in the pot, because it is its quality, like its form.

analyzed: ghaṭa aṃśa vṛttiḥ saṃyogaḥ na ghaṭa saṃyogaḥ tad anya vṛtti tvāt
translated: The conjunction present in the parts of the pot is not the conjunction of the pot, because it is present in something else.

analyzed: paṭa saṃyoga vat iti
translated: Like the conjunction of the cloth.

analyzed: etat api anavakāśam
translated: This too is impossible.

analyzed: aṃśa aṃśinoḥ abhedasya sādhita tvāt
translated: Because the non-difference of the parts and the whole has been established.

original: atiprasaṅgo hi tadā syādyadi paṭavadghaṭāṃśo 'pi ghaṭādatyantabhinnaḥ syāt /
analyzed: atiprasaṅgaḥ hi tadā syāt yadi paṭa vat ghaṭa aṃśaḥ pi ghaṭāt atyanta bhinnaḥ syāt
translated: For then there would be an over-extension, if the parts of the pot were as different from the pot as the cloth is.

analyzed: abhede tu kva atiprasaṅgaḥ
translated: But when there is non-difference, where is the over-extension?

analyzed: anumānasya api ādyasya siddha sādhana tā
translated: And the first inference also has the fallacy of proving what is already established.

analyzed: aṃśa vṛtteḥ eva ghaṭa vṛtti tvāt
translated: Because what is present in the parts is itself present in the pot.

original: aṃśāvṛttitve sati ghaṭavṛttitvasādhane dṛṣṭāntaḥ sādhyavikalaḥ syāt /
analyzed: aṃśa avṛtti tve sati ghaṭa vṛtti tva sādhane dṛṣṭāntaḥ sādhya vikalaḥ syāt
translated: If the proof is that it is present in the parts and is present in the pot, then the example would be defective in the probandum.

analyzed: dvitīyaḥ tu hetuḥ svarūpa asiddhaḥ nyathāsiddhaḥ vā iti
translated: But the second reason is either unestablished in its own nature or established in another way.

original: yadi ghaṭasaṃyogo ghaṭāṃśe vartate tarhi ghaṭāṃśasaṃyogaḥ kva vartata iti cet /
analyzed: yadi ghaṭa saṃyogaḥ ghaṭa aṃśe vartate tarhi ghaṭa aṃśa saṃyogaḥ kva vartate iti ced
translated: If the conjunction of the pot is present in the parts of the pot, then where is the conjunction of the parts of the pot present?

original: anena eva nyāyena tadaṃśe so 'pi tadaṃśa iti brūmaḥ /
analyzed: anena eva nyāyena tad aṃśe saḥ u pi tad aṃśe iti brūmaḥ
translated: By this very reasoning, we say that it is also present in that part of that part.

analyzed: na ca evam anavasthā
translated: And there is no infinite regress in this way.

analyzed: sarve pi aṃśi saṃyogāḥ tad tad aṃśa vṛttayaḥ iti atra itara apekṣāyāḥ abhāvāt
translated: Because all the conjunctions of the whole are present in each of its parts, there is no need for anything else in this matter.

original: evaṃ tarhi paramāṇuvṛttirapi saṃyogo ghaṭasaṃyogaḥ syāditi cet /
analyzed: evam tarhi paramāṇu vṛttiḥ api saṃyogaḥ ghaṭa saṃyogaḥ syāt iti ced
translated: If it is argued that in that case, conjunction occurring in atoms would also be the conjunction of a pot,

analyzed: kaḥ na iti āha iti
translated: who says it is not?

original: aṃśasaṃyoga eva hyaṃśinaḥ saṃyogo 'to nānavasthetyuktamanavasthāparihāraṃ vivṛṇoti ekasminniti //
analyzed: aṃśa saṃyogaḥ eva hi aṃśinaḥ saṃyogaḥ na anavasthā iti uktam anavasthā parihāram vivṛṇoti ekasmin iti
translated: For the conjunction of parts is indeed the conjunction of the whole. Therefore, it has been said that there is no infinite regress. He explains the avoidance of infinite regress, saying in one and so on.

original: ekasmin jāta evānyaḥ saṃyogo jāyate yadi /
analyzed: ekasmin jāte eva anyaḥ saṃyogaḥ jāyate yadi
translated: If another conjunction arises in one that has arisen,

original: anavasthā tadaiva syāt saṃyogaikye bhavet kva sā // / / //
analyzed: anavasthā tadā eva syāt saṃyoga aikye bhavet kva sā
translated: then the infinite regress would be just then. Where would it be if there were unity of conjunction?

original: avayavaparamparāyā aviśramamabhyupagamyaikaikasminnavayavasaṃyoge jāta evānyo 'vayavasaṃyogo jāyata iti yadyaṅgīkurmastadaivānavasthā syāt
analyzed: avayava paramparāyāḥ aviśramam abhyupagamya ekaikasmin avayava saṃyoge jāte eva anyaḥ vayava saṃyogaḥ jāyate iti yadi aṅgīkurmaḥ tadā eva anavasthā syāt
translated: If we accept that the series of parts is without rest, and if we admit that another conjunction of parts arises in one part that has arisen, then the infinite regress would be just then.

analyzed: saṃyoga aikye avayavi saṃyogaḥ kriyātaḥ jātaḥ tad avayave vartate
translated: If there is unity of conjunction, the conjunction of the whole arises from action and occurs in its parts.

original: avayavavṛtteḥ saṃyogādaparo 'vayavinaḥ saṃyogo nāstīti vāde tu /
analyzed: avayava vṛtteḥ saṃyogāt aparaḥ vayavinaḥ saṃyogaḥ na asti iti vāde tu
translated: But if it is argued that there is no other conjunction of the whole apart from the conjunction occurring in the parts,

analyzed: kva sā anavasthā iti
translated: where is that infinite regress?

analyzed: etena etat api nirastam
translated: By this, this is also refuted.

analyzed: yat āhuḥ
translated: What they say is this:

analyzed: saṃyogaḥ trividhaḥ nyatara karma ja ubhaya karma ja saṃyoga ja bhedāt
translated: Conjunction is of three kinds, distinguished as arising from the motion of one, from the motion of both, and from conjunction.

analyzed: tatra anyatara karma jaḥ yaḥ kriyāvatā niṣkriyasya
translated: Among them, that arising from the motion of one is that of the active with the inactive.

analyzed: yathā sthāṇoḥ śyenena
translated: Like the conjunction of a post and a hawk.

analyzed: ubhaya karma jaḥ tu viruddha diś kriyayoḥ sannipātaḥ
translated: But the conjunction that arises from both actions is the conjunction of two things whose motions are in opposite directions.

analyzed: yathā mallayoḥ
translated: Like the conjunction of two wrestlers.

analyzed: saṃyoga jaḥ tu saṃyogaḥ kāraṇa akāraṇa saṃyogāt kārya akārya saṃyogaḥ
translated: But the conjunction that arises from conjunction is the conjunction of an effect and its cause, from the conjunction of cause and non-cause.

analyzed: yathā hasta taru saṃyogāt kāya taru saṃyogaḥ iti
translated: Like the conjunction of hand and tree, from that there is the conjunction of body and tree.

analyzed: nahi hasta taru saṃyoga atiriktaḥ kāya taru saṃyogaḥ sti
translated: For there is no conjunction of body and tree apart from the conjunction of hand and tree.

analyzed: yena asau tad janyaḥ syāt
translated: By which it could be produced by that.

analyzed: pramāṇa abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no evidence.

original: kintu hastakarmaṇā janito hastavṛttiḥ saṃyoga eva hastakāyayorabhedātkāyasaṃyogo bhavati /
analyzed: kintu hasta karmaṇā janitaḥ hasta vṛttiḥ saṃyogaḥ eva hasta kāyayoḥ abhedāt kāya saṃyogaḥ bhavati
translated: But the conjunction that occurs in the hand, produced by the action of the hand, is the conjunction of hand and body, because of the non-difference of hand and body.

analyzed: atas eva hastasya aśuci saṃyoge kāya kṣālana ādi vidhayaḥ upapadyate
translated: For this very reason, the injunctions to wash the body etc. are also appropriate when there is a conjunction of impurity with the hand.

analyzed: atas eva vibhāga jaḥ vibhāgaḥ nirastaḥ
translated: For this very reason, the disjunction that arises from disjunction is also refuted.

analyzed: dvividham hi tam ācakṣate
translated: For they describe it as twofold.

analyzed: kāraṇa akāraṇa vibhāgāt kāraṇa vibhāgāt ca iti
translated: From the disjunction of cause and non-cause, and from the disjunction of the cause.

analyzed: tatra ādyaḥ yathā
translated: Among them, the first is like this.

analyzed: hasta taru vibhāgāt kāya taru vibhāgaḥ
translated: From the disjunction of hand and tree, there is the disjunction of body and tree.

analyzed: dvitīyaḥ yathā
translated: The second is like this.

original: dvitantukāvayave tantau karmotpannaṃ tasya tantvantarādvibhāgaṃ karoti /
analyzed: dvi tantuka avayave tantau karma utpannam tasya tantu antarāt vibhāgam karoti
translated: An action arises in the thread that is a part of the two-threaded cloth, and it produces the disjunction of that from the other thread.

analyzed: vibhāgāt tantvoḥ saṃyogaḥ naśyati
translated: The conjunction of the two threads is destroyed by the separation.

analyzed: tatas dvi tantuka vināśaḥ
translated: Then there is the destruction of the two-threaded object.

original: tata idānīṃ tantvorvartamāno vibhāgaḥ sakriyasyāvayavasya dvitantukasaṃyuktākāśādideśādvibhāgaṃ karotīti /
analyzed: tatas idānīm tantvoḥ vartamānaḥ vibhāgaḥ sa kriyasya avayavasya dvi tantuka saṃyukta ākāśa ādi deśāt vibhāgam karoti iti
translated: Now, the present separation of the threads produces the separation of the active part from the space connected with the two-threaded object, and so on.

analyzed: tatra ādyaḥ tāvat anupapannaḥ
translated: Among these, the first is indeed unestablished.

analyzed: hasta taru vibhāga atiriktasya kāya taru vibhāgasya anupalambhāt
translated: Because the separation of the body from the tree, which is distinct from the separation of the hand from the tree, is not perceived.

original: hastakarmaṇā janito hi vibhāgo hastakāyayorabhedāddhastakāyaguṇo bhavati /
analyzed: hasta karmaṇā janitaḥ hi vibhāgaḥ hasta kāyayoḥ abhedāt hasta kāya guṇaḥ bhavati
translated: For the separation produced by the action of the hand, due to the non-difference of the hand and the body, becomes a quality of the hand and the body.

original: ata eva vivādādhyāsito vibhāgo na karmāsamavāyikāraṇakaḥ karmaikārthāsamavetatvāt /
analyzed: atas eva vivāda adhyāsitaḥ vibhāgaḥ na karma asamavāyi kāraṇakaḥ karma ekārtha asamaveta tvāt
translated: For this very reason, the separation under dispute is not caused by action as an inherent cause, because it is not inherently connected with action as its only purpose.

analyzed: nirastam
translated: This has been refuted by the opponent's unestablished position, like sound.

analyzed: dvitīyaḥ tu anupapannataraḥ  tantu karmaṇā eva tantoḥ tantu antarāt ākāśa ādi deśāt ca vibhāga utpatti upapattau krama kalpanā anupapatteḥ
translated: The second, however, is even more unestablished.🔽Because the separation of the threads is produced by the action of the threads themselves from the other thread and from the space, etc., the assumption of sequence is not established.

original: anyathāṅgulikarmaṇāṅguleraṅgulyantarādeva vibhāgo bhavati ākāśādideśāttu vibhāgādeveti syāt /
analyzed: anyathā aṅguli karmaṇā aṅguleḥ aṅguli antarāt eva vibhāgaḥ bhavati ākāśa ādi deśāt tu vibhāgāt eva iti syāt
translated: Otherwise, by the action of the finger, the separation of the finger occurs only from the other finger, but from the space, etc., it occurs only by separation.

analyzed: nanu aṅguli karma aṅguli vibhāgam ākāśa ādi vibhāgam ca karoti
translated: But the action of the finger produces the separation of the finger and the separation of space, etc.

analyzed: tayoḥ vibhāgayoḥ aviruddha tvāt  tantu karma tu tantu antara vibhāgam ākāśa ādi vibhāgam ca
translated: Because those two separations are not contradictory.

analyzed: na kartum arhati
translated: But the action of the thread cannot produce the separation of another thread and the separation of space, etc.

analyzed: tayoḥ vibhāgayoḥ dravya ārambhaka saṃyoga virodhi tva avirodhi tva rūpa virodhāt
translated: Because there is a contradiction between those two separations in the form of being opposed to the conjunction that produces a substance and not being opposed to it.

analyzed: na hi aviruddhāt kāraṇāt viruddha kārya utpattiḥ sambhavati iti
translated: For it is not possible for an effect that is contradictory to arise from a cause that is not contradictory.

analyzed: mā evam
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: ekasmāt eva karmaṇaḥ saṃyoga vibhāga janana abhyupagamāt
translated: Because the production of conjunction and disjunction is accepted even from a single action.

analyzed: tantu karma rāḥ dravya ārambhaka anārambhaka tantu antara ākāśa saṃyoga janma aṅgīkārāt ca
translated: And because the action of the thread is accepted to produce the conjunction with another thread, whether it produces a substance or not, and with space.

analyzed: anyathā kāraṇa akāraṇa saṃyoga ja saṃyoga vat kāraṇa mātra saṃyoga jaḥ api saṃyogaḥ svīkāryaḥ syāt
translated: Otherwise, just as conjunction produced from the conjunction of the cause and the non-cause, conjunction produced from the mere conjunction of the cause would also have to be accepted.

analyzed: nanu saṃyogasya na svarūpataḥ virodhaḥ sti
translated: But conjunction does not have contradiction in its own nature.

analyzed: yatas dravya anārambhaka dravya samavetaḥ eva saṃyogaḥ dravya anārambhakaḥ
translated: Because conjunction that inheres in a substance that does not produce a substance is itself not productive of a substance.

analyzed: dravya anārambhakam ca dravyam saptavidham
translated: And a substance that does not produce a substance is of seven kinds.

original: ārabdhadravyamantyāvayavisparśarahitaṃ vinaśyadavasthaṃ vinaśyadavasthasaṃyogaṃ niṣphalārambhaṃ vijātīyaṃ ceti /
analyzed: ārabdha dravyam antya avayavi sparśa rahitam vinaśyat avastham vinaśyat avastha saṃyogam niṣphala ārambham vijātīyam ca iti
translated: That which has begun to produce a substance, which is devoid of contact with the final composite, which is in the state of being destroyed, which has a conjunction in the state of being destroyed, which produces an effectless beginning, and which is of a different kind.

analyzed: tatas karmaṇā eva saṃyoga dvaya janma upapattiḥ iti
translated: Therefore, the origination of the two conjunctions is logically possible only through action.

analyzed: tarhi vibhāgayoḥ api kaḥ virodhaḥ
translated: Then what is the contradiction even in the two disjunctions?

analyzed: dravya ārambha anārambha prayukta tvāt virodha pratīteḥ
translated: Because the cognition of contradiction is based on the production or non-production of a substance.

analyzed: tantu dvaya vibhāga janakam tantu karma na tantu ākāśa vibhāga janakam dravya ārambhaka saṃyoga virodhi vibhāga janaka karma tvāt
translated: The action of the thread that produces the disjunction of two threads does not produce the disjunction of the thread and space, because it is an action that produces a disjunction that is opposed to the conjunction that produces a substance.

analyzed: dravya anṛ ārambhaka saṃyoga virodhi vibhāga janaka karma vat iti ābhāsa samāna yogakṣema tvāt
translated: Like an action that produces a disjunction opposed to the conjunction that produces a substance.

original: tantukarma na tantvantaravibhāgajanakaṃ karmatvāt sampratipannakarmavadityapi prayogasambhavāt tatra pramāṇabādha iti cet /
analyzed: tantu karma na tantu antara vibhāga janakam karma tvāt sampratipanna karma vat iti api prayoga sambhavāt tatra pramāṇa bādhaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that there is contradiction with the means of valid knowledge in that case, because the argument The action of the thread is not the cause of the disjunction of another thread, because it is an action, like a well-known action is also possible,

analyzed: samam anyatra api  vibhāga dvaya yaugapadya anubhavāt
translated: it is the same in other cases as well.🔽Because the simultaneity of the two disjunctions is experienced.

analyzed: tantu karma ākāśa vibhāga janakam karma tvāt iti pratipakṣaḥ ca
translated: And the counter-argument is: The action of the thread is the cause of the disjunction of space, because it is an action.

original: ākāśavibhāge vibhāgena kartavye karmaṇo nimittatvābhyupagamātsiddhasādhanamiti cenna /
analyzed: ākāśa vibhāge vibhāgena kartavye karmaṇaḥ nimitta tva abhyupagamāt siddha sādhanam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that it is futile to prove that action is the cause of the separation of space, since it is already accepted that separation is to be done by separation, it is not so.

analyzed: janaka śabdasya asamavāyi artha tvāt
translated: Because the word janaka (producer) has the meaning of non-inherence.

original: etena vimataṃ karma dravyārambhakasaṃyogavirodhitadavirodhivibhāgajanakaṃ na bhavati karmatvāditi nirastam /
analyzed: etena vimatam karma dravya ārambhaka saṃyoga virodhi tad avirodhi vibhāga janakam na bhavati karma tvāt iti nirastam
translated: By this, the argument The action in dispute does not produce the separation that is incompatible with and compatible with the conjunction that produces substance, because it is an action is refuted.

original: vimataṃ karma dravyārambhakānārambhakasaṃyogārambhakaṃ na bhavati karmatvāt /
analyzed: vimatam karma dravya ārambhaka anārambhaka saṃyoga ārambhakam na bhavati karma tvāt
translated: The action in dispute does not produce the conjunction that produces and does not produce the substance, because it is an action.

analyzed: śyena karma vat iti ābhāsa tulya tvāt sat pratipakṣa tvāt ca  yat ākāśa vibhāga janakam karma na tat dravya ārambhaka saṃyoga virodhi vibhāga janakam yathā aṅguli karma iti
translated: Because it is similar to a false analogy, and because it has a counter-argument.🔽When an action produces the separation of space, it does not produce the separation that is incompatible with and compatible with the conjunction that produces substance, like the action of a finger.

original: vyāptestantukarmaṇo gaganavibhāgajanakatve tantvantaravibhāgajanakatvaṃ na syāditi cennana /
analyzed: vyāpteḥ tantu karmaṇaḥ gagana vibhāga janaka tve tantu antara vibhāga janaka tvam na syāt iti ced na na
translated: If it is argued that if the action of a thread produces the separation of space, it would not produce the separation of another thread, it is not so.

analyzed: yat yat pradeśa vibhāga janakam na bhavati na tat tad pradeśa stha dravya vibhāga janakam iti
translated: Because whatever does not produce the separation of a particular region does not produce the separation of the substance located in that region.

original: vyāpterākāśadeśavibhāgājanakatve tantvantarādapi vibhāgajanakaṃ na syāditi pratiprasaṅgasambhavāt / /
analyzed: vyāpteḥ ākāśa deśa vibhāga ajanaka tve tantu antarāt api vibhāga janakam na syāt iti pratiprasaṅga sambhavāt
translated: If the pervasion does not produce a division of space, it would not produce a division even from another thread. Thus the counter-objection is possible.

original: kiñca tantorākāśavibhāgo yadi vibhāgajo na tu karmajastadā sakarmakasyevākarmakasyāpi kuto na syāt /
analyzed: kiñca tantoḥ ākāśa vibhāgaḥ yadi vibhāga jaḥ na tu karma jaḥ tadā sakarmakasya iva akarmakasya api kutas na syāt
translated: Moreover, if the division of the thread and space is produced by division, not by action, then how could it occur even for that which is without action, just as for that which is with action?

original: vibhāgasyobhayatrāpi sāmyāt /🔽uttaravibhāge karma nimittakāraṇamityato neti cenna /
analyzed: vibhāgasya ubhayatra api sāmyāt  uttara vibhāge karma nimitta kāraṇam iti atas na iti ced na
translated: Because the division is the same in both cases.🔽If it is argued that in the subsequent division, action is the instrumental cause, therefore it is not so, it is not so.

analyzed: ādya vibhāga jananena eva upakṣīṇasya kāraṇa tva anavadhāraṇāt
translated: Because the cause is not determined as exhausted by the production of the initial division alone.

analyzed: avadhāraṇe vā asamavāyi tvasya anivāraṇāt
translated: Or if it is determined, the non-inherence is not excluded.

analyzed: anyathā tad lakṣaṇasya ativyāpteḥ iti alam vistareṇa
translated: Otherwise, because of the over-extension of its definition. Thus, enough of this extensive discussion.

original: evaṃ chalatvenānavasthāprasaṅgaṃ nirākṛtya prakārāntareṇa nirākaroti aṃśa iti //
analyzed: evam chala tvena anavasthā prasaṅgam nirākṛtya prakāra antareṇa nirākaroti aṃśaḥ iti
translated: Having thus refuted the occurrence of infinite regress as a fallacy, he refutes it in another way, saying in part, etc.

analyzed: aṃśi saṃyogasya aṃśa vṛtti tva dṛṣṭeḥ ca na anavasthā doṣaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that there is no fault of infinite regress because the conjunction of the parts is seen to inhere in the parts.

analyzed: dṛṣṭa tve katham adoṣa tvam iti atas āha dṛṣṭe iti
translated: How can it be non-faulty if it is seen? To this he says seen, etc.🔽And because the conjunction is seen in the parts...

analyzed: aṃśe saṃyoga dṛṣṭeḥ ca
translated: And because conjunction is seen in parts.

original: āpādake 'rthe dṛṣṭe sati sā anavasthitiḥ kā na dūṣaṇamiti yāvat /🔽etaduktaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: āpādake rthe dṛṣṭe sati sā anavasthitiḥ kā na dūṣaṇam iti yāvat  etat uktam bhavati
translated: When the object to be established is seen, what is that non-establishment that is not a fault? In other words, this is what is said.

original: yadyaṃśataḥ saṃyogaḥ syāttadānavasthā syāttataśca saṃyogābhāva evāpadyeta /
analyzed: yadi aṃśataḥ saṃyogaḥ syāt tadā anavasthā syāt tatas ca saṃyoga abhāvaḥ eva āpadyeta
translated: If there were conjunction in part, then there would be an infinite regress, and from that, the absence of conjunction would result.

analyzed: na ca asau yuktaḥ
translated: And that is not correct.

original: tasmānnāṃśataḥ saṃyoga iti hi viparyaye paryavasānaṃ kartavyam /🔽anavasthāyāstarkatvāt /
analyzed: tasmāt na aṃśataḥ saṃyogaḥ iti hi viparyaye paryavasānam kartavyam  anavasthāyāḥ tarka tvāt
translated: Therefore, the conclusion should be made in the opposite case: Conjunction is not in part.🔽Because the infinite regress is a reasoning.

analyzed: viparyaya aparyavasāyinaḥ ca tarka ābhāsa tva niyamāt
translated: And because it is a rule that what does not lead to a conclusion in the opposite case is a fallacious reasoning.

analyzed: dṛṣṭe kā sā anavasthitiḥ
translated: What is that non-establishment when it is seen?

original: atrāṃśataḥ saṃyoge na bhavatīti ko 'rtho yadyaṃśisaṃyogasyāṃśasaṃyogapūrvakatāniyamo nāstīti /
analyzed: atra aṃśataḥ saṃyoge na bhavati iti kaḥ rthaḥ yadi aṃśi saṃyogasya aṃśa saṃyoga pūrvaka tā niyamaḥ na asti iti
translated: Here, what is the meaning of not in part? If it means that the conjunction of a part is not necessarily preceded by the conjunction of the parts,

analyzed: tarhi evam iti vadāmaḥ
translated: then we say in this way.

analyzed: yadi aṃśi saṃyogaḥ uṃśa vṛttiḥ na bhavati iti
translated: If the conjunction of a part does not occur in the part.

analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.

analyzed: ghaṭa ādi aṃśi saṃyogasya tad aṃśa vṛtti tāyāḥ pratyakṣa dṛṣṭa tvena viparyaya paryavasānasya bādhita tvāt
translated: Because the conclusion in the opposite case is contradicted by the direct perception of the conjunction of the parts of a pot, etc. occurring in those parts.

analyzed: ghaṭa saṃyogaḥ ghaṭe eva vartate
translated: The conjunction of the pot occurs in the pot itself.

analyzed: kintu avyāpya vṛtti tvāt tad aṃśa vṛttiḥ iva avabhāsate iti ced
translated: But if it is argued that it appears as if it occurs in a part because it occurs in what is not pervaded,

analyzed: kā iyam avyāpya vṛtti tā nāma anyā aṃśa vṛtti tvāt
translated: What is this called non-pervading occurrence? It is different from occurrence in part.

analyzed: sva abhāva samāna adhikaraṇa tvam iti ced na
translated: If it is said to be the relation of inherence with itself, that is not so.

analyzed: viruddha tvāt
translated: Because of contradiction.

analyzed: dṛṣṭa tvāt avirodhaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is said that there is no contradiction because it is seen, that is not so.

original: kimaṃśabhedena bhāvābhāvau dṛśyete uta ghaṭa eveti sandehāt /🔽na hyaviruddhaviṣayatve sati viruddhaviṣayatāṅgīkartumucitā /
analyzed: kim aṃśa bhedena bhāva abhāvau dṛśyete uta ghaṭaḥ eva iti sandehāt  na hi aviruddha viṣaya tve sati viruddha viṣaya tā aṅgīkartum ucitā
translated: Because there is doubt - are existence and non-existence seen as different parts, or is it just the pot?🔽For when the object is not contradictory, it is not proper to accept a contradictory object.

analyzed: upādhi bhedāt avirodhaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is said that there is no contradiction due to the difference of the limiting conditions,

analyzed: ke te upādhayaḥ
translated: what are those limiting conditions?

original: aṃśā eveti cet /🔽ta eva santu tarhi saṃyogāvābhāvāśrayāḥ kimaṃśi
analyzed: aṃśāḥ eva iti ced  te eva santu tarhi saṃyoga avābhāva āśrayāḥ kim aṃśi
translated: If it is said that they are the parts themselves,

analyzed: viruddhena aṅgīkṛtena  aṃśa aṃśinoḥ abhedena atiprasaṅgasya apāsta tvāt iti
translated: then let them be the substrata of conjunction and non-existence. What is the use of accepting the contradictory non-pervading nature?🔽Because the absurdity of the non-difference of the part and the whole has been refuted.

analyzed: pratitarka parāhata tvāt ca atiprasaṅgaḥ yam iti āha yadi iti
translated: And because this absurdity is refuted by reasoning, he says: If...

original: yadyaṃśago na saṃyogaḥ kāryeṣu prathimā katham // / / //
analyzed: yadi aṃśa gaḥ na saṃyogaḥ kāryeṣu prathimā katham
translated: If conjunction does not extend to the parts, how can there be extension in the effects?

original: yadi kāraṇānāṃ saṃyogastadaṃśavṛttirna syāttadā tadārabdheṣu kāryeṣu kāraṇāpekṣayā parimāṇotkarṣo na syādityarthaḥ /
analyzed: yadi kāraṇānām saṃyogaḥ tad aṃśa vṛttiḥ na syāt tadā tad ārabdheṣu kāryeṣu kāraṇa apekṣayā parimāṇa utkarṣaḥ na syāt iti arthaḥ
translated: If the conjunction of the causes does not extend to their parts, then there would be no increase in size in the effects produced from them in comparison to the causes. This is the meaning.

analyzed: ayam abhisandhiḥ
translated: This is the intention:

analyzed: kāraṇa parimāṇa apekṣayā kārye parimāṇa utkarṣaḥ tāvat sarvatra pracaya janyaḥ
translated: The superiority of the magnitude of the effect with respect to the magnitude of the cause is always due to accumulation.

analyzed: dvi tūlake tathā darśanāt
translated: Because it is seen in the case of two tufts of cotton.

analyzed: pracaya hīna tūla dvaya janya rajju dravye tad abhāva upalambhāt ca
translated: And because its absence is perceived in the case of a rope substance produced by two tufts of cotton with less accumulation.

analyzed: pracayaḥ ca kāraṇayoḥ praśithilaḥ saṃyogaḥ
translated: And accumulation is a loose conjunction of the causes.

original: praśithilatā ca saṃyogasya keṣucidaṃśeṣu vṛttiḥ keṣucidavṛttireva /
analyzed: praśithila tā ca saṃyogasya keṣucid aṃśeṣu vṛttiḥ keṣucid avṛttiḥ eva
translated: And looseness of conjunction is the presence of the conjunction in some parts and the absence of it in some other parts.

analyzed: na anyā
translated: There is no other.

analyzed: a nirūpaṇāt
translated: Because it cannot be determined.

original: tataḥ saṃyogasyāṃśavṛttitvābhāve pracayo 'sau na bhavatīti kāraṇābhāvādutkṛṣṭaparimāṇotpādo na syāditi / /
analyzed: tatas saṃyogasya aṃśa vṛtti tva abhāve pracayaḥ asau na bhavati iti kāraṇa abhāvāt utkṛṣṭa parimāṇa utpādaḥ na syāt iti
translated: Therefore, in the absence of the presence of conjunction in parts, that is not accumulation. And due to the absence of the cause, the production of the superior magnitude would not occur.

original: astvanyasya saṃyogo yathātathā /🔽prastute paramāṇau saṃyogasyāṃśavṛttitvābhāve nātiprasaṅga iti cenna /
analyzed: astu anyasya saṃyogaḥ yathā tathā  prastute paramāṇau saṃyogasya aṃśa vṛtti tva abhāve na atiprasaṅgaḥ iti ced na
translated: Let there be the conjunction of another in some way or the other.🔽If it is argued that there is no over-extension in the case of the atom under consideration in the absence of the presence of conjunction in parts, it is not so.

analyzed: anvaya vyatirekābhyām kāraṇa parimāṇa utkṛṣṭasya kārya parimāṇasya pracaya ākhya aṃśa vṛtti saṃyoga ja tva avadhāraṇāt kāraṇa abhāve
translated: Because by positive and negative concomitance, the magnitude of the effect which is superior to the magnitude of the cause is ascertained to be produced from the conjunction which is called accumulation and is present in parts. In the absence of the cause,

analyzed: ca kārya abhāva niyamāt paramāṇu saṃyogasya aṃśa vṛtti tva abhāve tad kārye dvayaṇuke paramāṇu parimāṇāt utkṛṣṭa parimāṇam
translated: And because of the restriction of the absence of effect, in the absence of the contact of atoms extending to parts, the effect of that, the binary molecule, would not arise with a magnitude superior to the magnitude of the atoms.

analyzed: na utpadyeta iti asya eva bādhakasya sattvāt
translated: Because of the existence of this very contradictory reason.

analyzed: nanu idam iṣi āpādanam
translated: But this is an undesirable consequence.

analyzed: paramāṇutaḥ dvayaṇuke parimāṇa utkarṣa abhāvāt iti atas āha paramāṇoḥ iti
translated: Because there is no superiority of magnitude in the binary molecule over the atom, therefore he says of the atom.

analyzed: paramāṇoḥ aṇoḥ na asti mahat tā iti adbhutam vacaḥ
translated: The statement that there is no greatness in an atom is wonderful.

original: paramāṇuparimāṇādaṇodvaryaṇukasya mahattā parimāṇotkarṣo nāstīti vaco 'dbhutaṃ svavyāhataṃ pramāṇaviruddhaṃ cetyarthaḥ /
analyzed: mahat tā parimāṇa utkarṣaḥ na asti iti vacaḥ dbhutam sva vyāhatam pramāṇa viruddham ca iti arthaḥ
translated: The statement that there is no superiority of magnitude in the binary molecule over the magnitude of the atom is wonderful, self-contradictory, and contrary to valid cognition, is the meaning.

original: ayamāḍhyo 'yaṃ paramāḍhya itivadaṇuparamāṇuśabdābhyāmeva parimāṇatāratamyāvagatestadabhāvavacanaṃ svavyāhataṃ bhavati /
analyzed: ayam āḍhyaḥ yam parama āḍhyaḥ iti vat aṇu paramāṇu śabdābhyām eva parimāṇa tāratamya avagateḥ tad abhāva vacanam su avyāhatam bhavati
translated: Because the relative degrees of magnitude are understood by the words atom and molecule themselves, like saying this is rich and this is very rich, the statement of their absence becomes self-contradictory.

analyzed: dvi tantuka parimāṇa vat asaṃmṛdi
translated: Like the magnitude of the dyad, it is not destroyed

analyzed: samudita avayava janya dravya parimāṇa tvena dvayaṇuka parimāṇasya paramāṇu parimāṇāt utkarṣasya anumāna avaga tvāt ca iti
translated: when the components are combined, because the magnitude of the dyad is inferred to be superior to the magnitude of the atom by being the magnitude of a substance produced from combined components.

analyzed: nanu yat kāraṇa parimāṇa janyam utkṛṣṭa parimāṇam tat eva pracaya janmay
translated: But what is the superior magnitude produced by the magnitude of the cause, that alone is produced by aggregation.

analyzed: tryaṇuka parimāṇa vat dvayaṇuka parimāṇam api kāraṇa parimāṇa janyam na bhavati
translated: The magnitude of the dyad is not produced by the magnitude of the cause, like the magnitude of the triadic.

analyzed: kintu kāraṇa saṃkhyā janyam eva
translated: But it is produced only by the number of the cause.

original: tatkathaṃ paramāṇoḥ pracayābhāve dvayaṇuke parimāṇotkarṣānutpādāpādanamityata āha aṇūnāmiti //
analyzed: tat katham paramāṇoḥ pracaya abhāve dvayaṇuke parimāṇa utkarṣa anutpāda āpādanam iti atas āha aṇūnām iti
translated: How then, in the absence of aggregation of atoms, is the production of the superior magnitude in the dyad to be denied? To this he says:

analyzed: aṇūnām prathima apekṣām vinā eva saḥ
translated: That [superior magnitude] in the triadic also, without regard to the extension of the atoms,

analyzed: paramāṇoḥ mahat tvam ca vinā iti etat vacaḥ katham
translated: and the greatness of the atom without greatness - how is this statement [possible]?

original: dvayaṇukānāṃ parimāṇotkarṣāpekṣāṃ vinaiva saṃkhyāmātreṇa tryaṇuke sa parimāṇotkarṣo jāyate /
analyzed: dvayaṇukānām parimāṇa utkarṣa apekṣām vinā eva saṃkhyā mātreṇa tryaṇuke sa parimāṇa utkarṣaḥ jāyate
translated: That superior magnitude arises in the triadic merely by number, without regard to the superior magnitude of the dyads.

original: tathā paramāṇormahattvaṃ parimāṇotkarṣaṃ vinā kevalasaṃkhyayā dvayaṇuke parimāṇotkarṣo jāyata ityetadvacaḥ kathaṃ ghaṭate /
analyzed: tathā paramāṇoḥ mahattvam parimāṇa utkarṣam vinā kevala saṃkhyayā dvayaṇuke parimāṇa utkarṣaḥ jāyate iti etat vacaḥ katham ghaṭate
translated: Similarly, how is this statement possible that the superior magnitude arises in the dyad by mere number without greatness, i.e., superior magnitude, of the atom?

analyzed: mahat dīrghavat vā iti nirasta tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that this has been refuted by [the statement] like the great and long [entity].

analyzed: ca api śabdau itaretara samuccaye
translated: The words ca and api [in the original text] indicate a mutual cumulation [of the reasons].

original: atra parimāṇamātragrahaṇe kartavye prathimeti mahattvamiti coktirvisadṛśaparimāratvasyānapekṣāhetoḥ nirākaraṇaṃ smārayitumiti / /
analyzed: atra parimāṇa mātra grahaṇe kartavye prathimā iti mahat tvam iti ca uktiḥ visadṛśa parimāra tvasya anapekṣā hetoḥ nirākaraṇam smārayitum iti
translated: Here, where the mention of mere magnitude should be done, the statement of 'breadth' and 'greatness' is to remind of the refutation of the cause of non-dependence of dissimilar magnitude.

original: aṃśāṃśinoratyantābhedo bhedābhedau ceti yaduktaṃ tadviśadayati aṃśina iti //🔽aṃśino 'ṃśairabhedo 'yamaṃśena tu bhidābhidā // / / //
analyzed: aṃśa aṃśinoḥ atyanta abhedaḥ bheda abhedau ca iti yat uktam tat viśadayati aṃśinaḥ iti  aṃśinaḥ ṃśaiḥ abhedaḥ yam aṃśena tu bhidā abhidā
translated: He clarifies what was said - the absolute non-difference of the part and the whole, and the difference and non-difference - by saying 'of the whole' etc.🔽This is the absolute non-difference of the whole from its parts, but the difference and non-difference with each part.

original: yathā gaganāderyāvadaṃśabhāvinoṃ'śinaḥ svāṃśairatyantābhedastathā paṭāderaṃśino 'pi sarvairaṃśaiḥ atyantābhedaḥ ekaikāṃśena tu bhidābhidā /
analyzed: yathā gagana ādeḥ yāvat aṃśa bhāvinaḥ oṃśinaḥ sva aṃśaiḥ atyanta abhedaḥ tathā paṭa ādeḥ aṃśinaḥ sarvaiḥ aṃśaiḥ atyanta abhedaḥ ekaika aṃśena tu bhidā abhidā
translated: Just as the whole, which exists as long as its parts, is absolutely non-different from its own parts, in the same way, the whole like a cloth is absolutely non-different from all its parts, but there is difference and non-difference with each part.

analyzed: ayam iti uttara vākyena sambaddhayate
translated: 'This' is connected with the subsequent statement.

analyzed: nanu etat ayuktam  sarva tantu bhāve pi kadācid paṭasya abhāvāt
translated: But this is not correct.🔽Because sometimes the cloth is absent even when all the threads exist.
And because difference and non-difference are accepted when it is torn.

analyzed: atas ekena eva sarvaiḥ api paṭasya bheda abhedau eva upacitau
translated: Therefore, the difference and non-difference of the cloth are established with each and all.

analyzed: tathā ca uktam brahmatarke
translated: And it is said in the Brahmatarka:

analyzed: tantubhyaḥ nyaḥ paṭaḥ sākṣāt kasya dṛṣṭi patham gataḥ
translated: The cloth is seen to be different from the threads by whom?

analyzed: ananyaḥ ced tantu bhāve paṭa abhāvaḥ kutas bhavet iti
translated: If it were not different, how could there be non-existence of cloth in the state of threads?

analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

analyzed: vyatiṣaṅga viśiṣṭāḥ hi tantavaḥ vagamyate
translated: The threads are indeed perceived as distinguished by mutual contact.

original: naca tadbhāve kadāpi paṭābhāvaḥ /🔽tasmādvayatiṣaṅgaviśeṣaviśiṣṭaiḥ sarvatantubhiḥ paṭasyātyantābheda eva /
analyzed: na ca tad bhāve kadāpi paṭa abhāvaḥ  tasmāt vaya tiṣaṅga viśeṣa viśiṣṭaiḥ sarva tantubhiḥ paṭasya atyanta abhedaḥ eva
translated: And never is there non-existence of cloth in their existence.🔽Therefore, the cloth is absolutely non-different from all the threads distinguished by a particular mutual contact.

analyzed: avivakṣita vyatiṣaṅgaiḥ sarva tantubhiḥ tu bheda abhedau eva iti na kaścid virodhaḥ
translated: But with all the threads not intended to be in mutual contact, there is only difference and non-difference. So there is no contradiction at all.

analyzed: nanu evam tarhi vyatiṣakta tantu vyatirekeṇa paṭa abhāve paramāṇu puñjavāda āpattiḥ iti
translated: But if it is so, then in the absence of cloth apart from the threads in mutual contact, it would lead to the doctrine of a heap of atoms.

analyzed: mā evam
translated: No, that is not so.

analyzed: yathā hi guṇānām dravya abhede pi
translated: Just as qualities are not different from substances,

analyzed: na dravyam nirguṇam
translated: yet the substance is not without qualities.

analyzed: yathā ca pareṣām sāmānya ādau atirikta sattā bhāve pi na asattvam
translated: And just as for others, even in the absence of a separate existence in universals etc., there is no non-existence.

original: tathā vyatiṣaktatantava eva paṭastathāpi na paṭābhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tathā vyatiṣakta tantavaḥ eva paṭaḥ tathā api na paṭa abhāvaḥ
translated: In the same way, the cloth is just the threads in mutual contact, yet there is no absence of cloth.

analyzed: kintu sati vyatiṣaktāḥ tantavaḥ paṭaḥ ca
translated: But when there are threads in mutual contact, there is cloth.

original: sa ca tebhyo na bhidyate iti /
analyzed: sa ca tebhyaḥ na bhidyate iti
translated: And that is not different from them.

analyzed: katham etat iti ced
translated: If it is asked how this is so,

analyzed: viśeṣa śaktayā eva iti brūmaḥ
translated: we say it is by a particular power alone.

analyzed: nanu vyatiṣakta sarva tantubhyaḥ pi paṭasya bhedaḥ ṅgīkāryaḥ
translated: But the difference of the cloth from all the threads entangled together must be admitted.

analyzed: tantu vyatiṣaṅga anantaram paṭasya jāyamāna tvāt
translated: Because the cloth is produced after the entanglement of the threads.

original: kathaṃ caikaikatantunābhedaḥ ekaikatra paṭabuddhayabhāvādityata āha sarveti //
analyzed: katham ca ekaika tantunā abhedaḥ eka ekatra paṭa buddhai abhāvāt iti atas āha sarva iti
translated: And how can there be non-difference with each individual thread, since there is no cognition of the cloth in each individual one? To this he says:

analyzed: sarva pratyakṣa viṣayaḥ katham eva hi apohyate
translated: How indeed can the object of all perception be denied?

analyzed: uktaḥ yam arthaḥ sarva pratyakṣa viṣayaḥ yasmāt tasmāt katham evā apodyate
translated: This meaning has been stated. Since it is the object of all perception, how can it be denied?

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is meant.

analyzed: asti tāvat vayatiṣakta sarva tantūnām paṭasya ca abhede pratyakṣam
translated: There is indeed perception of the non-difference of the cloth from all the entangled threads.

analyzed: tad pratīteḥ sambaddha vastu dvaya pratīti vailakṣaṇyasya sākṣi siddha tvāt
translated: Because the difference in the cognition of the two connected objects is established by the witness.

analyzed: na ca bhede pramāṇam asti
translated: And there is no means of knowledge regarding difference.

analyzed: yena saḥ pi svīkariṣyate
translated: By which that also will be accepted.

analyzed: jāyatām nāma tantu vyatiṣaṅgam paṭam ācakṣmahe
translated: Let it be that we call the entanglement of the threads the cloth.

original: kintu vyatiṣaṅge sati yattantūnāṃ viśiṣṭaṃ rūpam /
analyzed: kintu vyatiṣaṅge sati yat tantūnām viśiṣṭam rūpam
translated: But when there is entanglement, it is the distinctive form of the threads.

analyzed: na ca ekaika tantu parityāge sarva tantavaḥ nāma santi
translated: And when each individual thread is abandoned, there are no all the threads.

analyzed: atas tatra api asti eva abheda pratītiḥ
translated: Therefore, there is indeed the cognition of non-difference even in that.

analyzed: eka ekatra paṭa buddhi abhāvaḥ tu bhedam ākṣipati
translated: But the absence of the cognition of cloth in each [part] implies difference.

analyzed: na tu pratyakṣa siddham abhedam apavadati iti
translated: But it does not deny the non-difference established by perception.

analyzed: atha api syāt
translated: Now, it may be said:

analyzed: avayavi ādīnām avayava ādibhiḥ abhedaḥ na upapadyate
translated: The non-difference of wholes, etc. from parts, etc. is not tenable.

analyzed: ekaḥ hi avayavī aneke ca avayavāḥ
translated: For there is one whole and many parts.

analyzed: tad abhede vayavānām api abhedaḥ vayavinaḥ vā bhedaḥ prasajyeta
translated: If they were non-different, either the parts would be non-different or the whole would be different.

analyzed: tathā guṇāḥ ca kecid aneka āśritāḥ
translated: Similarly, some qualities inhere in many [substances].

analyzed: ekā eva hi saṃyoga vayaktiḥ dvayoḥ dvayoḥ vartate
translated: For the individual conjunction occurs in two [substances].

analyzed: tathā vibhāga vyaktiḥ api
translated: So too the individual disjunction.

analyzed: saṅkhayā ca dvividhā
translated: And number is of two kinds.

analyzed: ekatva anekatva bhedāt
translated: Because of the difference between unity and plurality.

analyzed: tatra eka tvasya eka dravya gata tve pi dvi tva ādikam eneka āśritam
translated: There, although unity resides in one substance, duality, etc. reside in many [substances].

analyzed: evam pṛthaktavam api dvividham
translated: Thus separateness is also of two kinds.

analyzed: ekapṛthaktavam anekapṛthaktavam ca
translated: Individual separateness and collective separateness.

analyzed: tatra ekapṛthaktavasya eka dravya vṛtti tve pi dvipṛthaktava ādikam aneka dravya āśri
translated: There, although individual separateness resides in one substance, collective separateness, etc. reside in many substances.

analyzed: ka āśritam eva
translated: It resides in many [substances] alone.

original: evaṃca guṇānāṃ guṇinaikye saṃyogādyāśrayānekadravyābhedo vā saṃyogādibhedo vā'padyeta /
analyzed: evam ca guṇānām guṇinā aikye saṃyoga ādi āśraya aneka dravya abhedaḥ vā saṃyoga ādi bhedaḥ vā āpadyeta
translated: Thus, if qualities were non-different from the qualified, there would be non-difference of the many substances in which conjunction, etc. reside, or there would be difference of conjunction, etc.

analyzed: sāmānyam ca ekam aneka āśritam
translated: And a universal is one, residing in many.

original: tasya vyaktayabhede vyaktīnāmapyabhedaḥ sāmānyasya vā bhedaḥ prasajyetetyataḥ saṃyogavibhāgapṛthaktavānāṃ tāvadanekāśritatvaṃ nāstītyāha saṃyogaśceti
analyzed: tasya vyaktaya bhede vyaktīnām api abhedaḥ sāmānyasya vā bhedaḥ prasajyeta iti atas saṃyoga vibhāga pṛthaktavānām tāvat aneka āśrita tvam na asti iti āha saṃyogaḥ ca iti
